loans.name: Shitu

texts.en: Shitu produces and sells nylon in her shop located at Agege. She goes to Idumota (within Lagos) to buy raw materials for the production of nylon. Shitu learned her business in 6 months and she has been in the business for the past 10 years. Shitu is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She wants the loan amount of NGN 140,000 to purchase raw material for the production and sale of nylon. She is happy with LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for nylon production

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana A., age forty–five, is a married mother of five children, two of whom are females and three males. According to her, one of her children is in the tertiary level of polytechnic, while the rest are in the senior high, junior high, and basic schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband works at the local government hospital.

Christiana works very hard to help her husband provide for the family financially. She sells provisions on a tabletop by the roadside in her community. She also runs a cold store. She procures her products from Kumasi. Christiana has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure more goods. She hopes to sponsor all her children to the tertiary level of education.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Qurbonali

texts.ru: Рахмонов КУрбонали проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 52 года , женат и имеет семерых детей. Работает учитенлем в средней школе. Кроме того занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает различного рода  сельхоз культурами.Планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. Это поможет ему получить качественный урожай. Полученный урожай сможет реализовать и получить прибыль. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Qurbonali R. lives in the city of Vadat. He is 52 years old, married, and the father of 7 children. He is a middle school teacher, but also a farmer. He plants a variety of crops on his piece of land. He decided to use a loan for purchasing seeds and fertilizer. That will help him raise a high quality product. The harvest will be sold to make a profit. The loan will be repaid over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer purchase

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif F. is a family man who wants to expand his business so that he can better support his family and give them a better quality of life. Three years ago, Asif started selling spare parts for various types of cars. He started with $9000 of capital. His business has grown little by little, and now he offers a variety of products. During last two years he also learned how to repair cars and now he is not just seller but also a master.

Asif has been working with AqroInvest and had a Kiva loan, which he successfully completed. He feels very satisfied with the support he has received, because it has allowed him to increase his business, satisfy the needs of his customers, and support his family. Asif has applied to borrow 1200 USD to improve working conditions in his store. He wants to expand his business and increase his income to create a better life for his parents and future family.

loans.use: To expand his car parts store

loans.name: Anorhol

texts.ru: Холбобоева Анорхол проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 60 лет, замужем и имеет восьмерых детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. Занимается растениеводством. Сеет пшеницу, картофель и другие овощи. В данный момент планирует получить кредит и закупить семена и удобрения. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Anorhol H. lives in Vahdat. She is 60 years old, is married and has 8 children. She has a high school education and is a homemaker. She grows plants. Anorhol plants wheat, potatoes and other vegetables. It this moment she plans to take out a loan and purchase seeds and fertilizer. She will be able to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and feritilizer.

loans.name: Adisa

texts.en: Adisa sells plastic drums for water storage and empty paint rubber. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. Adisa has 3 children and she lives in Isaga,in Lagos State. Adisa needs a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more empty drums and paint rubbers to sell. She thanks all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more empty drums and paint rubbers to sell

loans.name: Urafiki Group

texts.en:
Justina has been a soap seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 3 years. She belongs to the Urafiki group loan (Group code 2007). Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more soap for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Justina is 40 years old, married, and has four children: ages 21, 19, 8 and 3. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Rose, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more soap for resale

loans.name: Paxman

texts.en:
Paxman Y. is a single parent with three children and has received schooling through senior high. Paxman has been a photographer since 1997. He travels in order to cover programmes and ceremonies with his video camera for a fee, primarily around the Elmina area. Paxman uses his income to help provide food, clothing and other basic needs of the family.

Paxman will use the loan to enable him to buy the necessary items to help improve the quality of his services to customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Paxman plans to reinvest in his photography business by buying items like a photo-printing machine.

The bicycle by him is what he uses as a means of transport.

loans.use: To buy the necessary items to help improve the quality of his services to customers

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. has sold groceries and farming tools at Agona near Elmina since 2007. He is married with two children and has received a senior high education. His wife is employed as a trader. He is responsible for providing food, clothing and other basic needs of the family.

His loan will be used to buy additional stock to help increase the sale of groceries and farming tools to meet the increase in demand by his customers. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest and help promote the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to help increase the sale of groceries and farming tools

loans.name: Uzeyir

texts.en:
Uzeyir A. is a 41 year old trader who sells bath accessories in the small village of Imishli. He is married and has two children. He started his business more than 12 years ago with a starting capital 200 USD. Uzeyir is an accountant and it is very easy for him to run the business without additional employees. He sells a wide range of bath accessories which makes his shop very attractive for people.

Uzeyir already took a loan from AqroInvest and it helped him to purchase qualified accessories and increase his income. Now he would like to increase the number of the items he sells. He is a trusted client of AqroInvest and he counts on you for your trust and help.

loans.use: To increase the number of items he sells

loans.name: Ukombozi Group

texts.en:
Mebo has owned a small medical store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $45. She works at her business for 12 hours every day.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more medicine for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Mebo is 39 years old, married, and has three children: ages 18, 14, and 9.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Sabina, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth B. is single and has four dependent children. Elizabeth has sold cloth in Kissi, near Elmina, since 2003.  Elizabeth is the sole provider of school fees and housekeeping money, so she uses her income to provide these things for her family. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase additional cloth to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to reinvest in her business so she can better provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy cloth to sell

loans.name: Olima

texts.ru: Розикова Олима проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 58 лет, имеет девятерых детей. Имеет маленький столик рядом с домом , где торгует продуктами питания и частично одеждой. Занимается этим бизнесом около двух лет. Но ей необходимо увеличить товарооборот, для того, чтобы хоть немного увеличить прибыль. Таким образом она улучшит условия жизни.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Olima R. lives in Vahdat. She is 58 years old and has nine children. Olima has a small table next to her home where she sells food products and sometimes clothing. She has been in this business for around 2 years. It is necessary for her to increase her turnover in order to increase her profits at least a little bit. This way she will be able to improve her living conditions. She will be able to pay back her loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Bibi Kallan Group

texts.en:
Bibi Kallan is the group leader of this group. There are five members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses.

Zarghona and Bibi Kallan want to take a loan for their quilt business.  They want to expand and advance their business. Also, K. Khalad and K. S. want to take a loan for their butcher business.  They want to enlarge their shop. And Faryba wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.  She wants to buy a new machine and buy necessary materials for her business.

With this loan they can enlarge their businesses and support their families and make a better future for themselves and for their families in the future.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon G. is a rice grower. She is 51 years old. She loves farming and her harvest is what she uses to feed and clothe her 4 children. She learned to plant when she was just a small kid. Her parents are also farmers and taught her everything about farming. Aside from rice, Corazon also grows vegetables in her backyard. She waters them everyday. She uses her harvest to buy their other needs.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy Urea fertilizers and pesticides. Her loan will truly help her family have a better yield. In that way, they could buy more land to plant more rice.

CEVI helps Corazon sustain her business. CEVI provides her the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage that she needs to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase Urea fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola lives in Agege, but travels to Edo state, a journey of about five hours by bus, to buy plantains. Bukola goes to different markets within Edo state. She has been in this business for the past 12 years. Bukola is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase more plantains to sell. She thanks you for your help.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita L. is engaged in fashion and in selling cosmetics. She is married and has four children. She sells Avon fashion products like moisturizers, creams, lipstick, eye shadows, perfumes, and other beauty products. She enjoys this business because she earns a reasonable profit and her products help people feel confident. 

Norlita is requesting a loan of Php 23,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more cosmetics to sell. In this way, she believes she can reach out to more women of all ages and help them to become more confident and beautiful through the products she sells. Selling cosmetics is a very good business and has helped Norlita support her family.

CEVI provides people with the opportunity to start their own businesses. In addition to the credit assistance that they give, they also provide training and insurance coverage for all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Ebenezer A. sells an array of merchandise including cosmetics, rubbers, watches, and belts in Kissi near Elmin. He has been in this business since 2004. He is married, has three children, and has completed a senior high school education. His wife is employed as a trader. He is financially responsible for his children's school fees and for other bills for his family. The goal of the loan is to expand his business and create higher profits. He plans to reinvest the profits in his business for further growth.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is a corn farmer. She is 52 years old, not yet married and has no children. She worked before as a waitress in a small eatery in her town. Now, she grows corn, which she sells to her neighbors and to other vendors. To buy her needs, she started planting corn on a 3-hectare piece of land from parents . She is hoping to start a new business. Her siblings are encouraging her to raise pigs. She is really interested in looking for another business line to augment her income.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy quality corn seed and fertilizer. Her loan will truly help her increase her yield. It will also help her get started in a new business. 

CEVI helps people start and have their own business. They provide credit assistance, training and insurance to all their clients to help their small business grow.

loans.use: To buy corn seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Mahmadusuf

texts.ru: Холов Махмадюсуф житель города Вахдат. Возраст 28 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Нигде не работает , но занимается сельским хозяйством.Имеет участок земли , который засеивает разного рода сельхоз культурами. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы оплатить аренду земли , а также закупить салярку. Погасить кредит  планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahmadusuf H. lives in Vahdat. He is 28 years old, is married and has two children. He does not have a job, but he has an agriculture business. Mahmadusuf has a plot of land where he plants different types of crops. He plans to take out a loan in order to pay for leasing land and also in order to purchase vehicle oil. He plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent land and purchase vehicle oil

loans.name: Urafiki Group

texts.en:
Sara  has been selling potatoes in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more potatoes for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Sara  is 32 years old, married, and has five children: ages 11, 9, 7, 3 and 1. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Bahati, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Bumi

texts.en:
Bumi is 40 years old and married with two children. She sells kitchen items in her shop located along Ogba Road. She has been in this business for the past 10 years.

Bumi has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for three years. She needs the loan of N100,000 to enable her buy more kitchen items to sell. Bumi is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial support. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen items to sell

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.ru: Исматов Насрулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 43 года , женат и имеет троих детей. Является старшим сыном в семье и живет с родителями. Семья большая , поэтому ему приходиьтся много работать для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Работает частным таксистом. Имеет маршрутку , которую и использует в качестве такси. В данный момент произошла поломка , которая не дает ему работать. Поэтому он решил получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить запчасти и произвезти ремонт. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.Кроме такси он еще занимается садоводством , где выращивает виноград.Это дает ему дополнительный доход  в сезон урожая.
texts.en:
Nasrullo I. lives in the Gissar area. He is 43 years old, is married and has three children. Nasrullo is the oldest son in the family and lives with his parents. His family is large and he needs to work a lot in order to provide for his family. He is a private taxi driver. Nasrullo has a van that he uses as a taxi. His car is currently broken, which keeps him from working. This is why he decided to take out a loan in order to purchase auto parts and make repairs. He will be able to pay back the loan over 12 months. In addition to driving a taxi, Nasrullo also has an orchard where he grows grapes. This gives him additional income during harvest season.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car Repairs

loans.name: Urafiki Group

texts.en:
Asha has been a bites (buns and chapati) seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for two years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to improve her business. She is hoping that with this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Asha is 28 years old, married, and has a 6-year-old child.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Teofrida, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items to improve her business.

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Since 2005, Ebenezer B. primarily sells clothing goods including handbags, shoes and jeans in Kissi near Elmina. He has one child and received schooling through the third stage.  He is primarily responsible for paying school fees and bills. His loan will be used to expand the business and potentially sell more products.  The goal of the loan is to reinvest the money into the business in order to promote expansion and success.

loans.use: To expand the business and potentially sell more products.

loans.name: Mohammad Aslam Group

texts.en:
Faryda is the group leader of the M. Aslam group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their business.

Faryda and Najeya want to take a loan for their tailoring business; they want to buy necessary materials for the business. M. Aslam wants to take a loan for his fruit cart business and buy the necessary materials for his business. Jan Agh wants to take a loan for his general store; he wants to add to his stock and enlarge his shop. They all want to see expansion and progress in their businesses and want to earn more money to support their families.        

They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan. They want to thank all AFSG and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam is a 46-year-old married man with six children. He lives in Ghobeiry in the Beirut suburbs. He has owned a  car welding and body work shop since 1990. Today, Bassam is requesting a $1,000 loan to purchase an air compressor to develop his job.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en: Roland is a 30-year-old single man, living in Al Ashrafieh in the Beirut suburbs. Since 2008, he has owned a cafeteria at a University in Beirut where he services the students. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase a coffee machine to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase a coffee machine

loans.name: Nader

texts.en: Nader is a 58-year-old married man with two children, living in Jadra in Southern Lebanon. He has owned a taxi since 2006, with which he services south and the surrounding areas. Today, Nader is requesting to borrow $700 to change the taxi's engine.

loans.use: Change the taxi's engine

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. raises ducks. She has been in this business for almost 10 years now. She is 47 years old and has six children. She is married to a farmer, Pablo M., who manages their small rice farm. Aside from rice and ducks, she also has a small sari-sari store business. People come to buy their needs at her store. With  these endeavors she is able to feed and clothe her family well.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy 500 ducklings. In that way, she will be able to increase the size of her duck farm.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. CEVI provides their clients with training and insurance coverage services to help their small business grow.

loans.use: To purchase 500 ducklings and 2 sacks of feed

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Таджиев Хасан жиьтель района Гиссар. Возраст 44 года , женат и имеет четверых детей. Работает частным таксистом.Имеет микроавтобус , который и работает по маршруту Гиссар -Душанбе -Гиссар. Работает уже 9 лет. Получает 500 сомони прибыли в месяце. Кредит хочет получить для того, чтобы сделать капитальный ремонт автомашины. Это обеспечит ему бесперебойную работу. Погасить кредит сможет в теченгие 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hasan T. lives in the Gissar region. He is 44 years old, married and has four children. He works as a taxi driver. He has a small bus which travels from Gissar to Dushanbe and back. He has been working for nine years. He receives 500 somoni a month as profit. Hasan wants to use the loan to make overall repairs to the vehicle. This will allow him to work without interruptions. He can pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Mwajabu's Group

texts.en: B. Mwajabu is happy that she has been able to repay back her loan on time and, above all, that she has been able to expand her shop and pay school fees for her seven dependants who are still in school. She is the leader of Twisakirala women’s group in Jinja where she manages her retail shop; it has been operational for 5 years. Mwajabu needs a loan to be able to buy more products for her shop. She has a dream of constructing rental houses on the plot of land that she bought and this loan will increase her income and profits.

loans.use: Buy more products for her shop.

loans.name: Djahongir

texts.en:
Djahongir is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two children who are his main inspiration to continue working hard. He has been transporting passengers for 5 years and due to his sound money management he now owns a minivan which helps to increase his household income. What he enjoys most about his work is the direct contact he has with his passengers. His business is profitable because he is the driver and there is no need to pay an additional salary. This is his second loan with IMON International. Djahongir has proven himself to be punctual in his loan repayments. He will use the loan to buy one more minivan and will give his old minivan to his brother. In that way Djahongir will be able to improve the living conditions of his large family which includes his wife, children, parents and brother.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth  millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve the agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a new minivan

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.en:
O. Rustamjon is 38 years old and a married father of four children, two of whom currently attend school. He owns a shop in which he sells spare moped engine parts, a business he has been running for the last 20 years. The income he earns allows him to pay for his children’s education.

To meet his customers’ constantly growing demand, Rustamjon would like to increase his shop’s capacity. The profits from these sales will allow him to continue to send his children to school and to improve his living conditions. The loan will greatly improve Rustamjon’s income and his family's living standards.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet A. has sold provisions such as flour and oil in Kissi (near Elmina) since 2004. Janet is married with 6 dependent children and has received senior high school education.  Her husband is employed as a trader.  Janet's financial responsibilities include helping her husband pay school fees.  The loans requested will be used to expand Janet's business.  She intends to reinvest the resulting profits back into the business in order to improve capital.

loans.use: The loans will be used to further expand her business.

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.ru: Хабибов Лутфулло проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 37 лет , замужем и имеет троих детей.Занимается торговлей сельхозкультурами.  За кредитом обращается в первый раз и планирует использовать для закупки овощей и фруктов для реализации. Таким образом он увеличит товарооборот и сможет увеличить свои доходы.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Lutfullo H. lives in the Shahrinau region. He is 37 years old, married and has three children. He is in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. This is his first time applying for a loan and he plans to use it to buy fruits and vegetables for resale. This way he can increase his turnaround as well as his profits. Lutfullo will pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnaround of goods

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en: Florence M. is a very hard-working lady who has managed to run her retail shop for 3 years while also selling old clothes in daily markets in and around Jinja. She has seen her businesses grow and has built a strong customer base in almost all of the markets she moves to with the help of loans. All of her children are in school because she can afford to pay for their fees while also providing food and clothing. Florence needs a loan to help buy more products for her shop, as well as a bale of used clothes for sale.

loans.use: Buying more shop products and a bale of used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher A. is a lively entrepreneur with a small business selling clothing for women at the central market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is a very experienced entrepreneur, having been self-employed for the past 4 years. Business has been good for Alisher. There is always demand for clothing and as the economy has improved in Tajikistan, more people have been able to afford new clothing. Alisher is not married yet. He dreams of building his own house and making a happy and friendly family. Alisher has requested a loan of $2000 USD to increase his available working capital. Eventually, Alisher hopes to have his own small store. This loan will help him purchase new inventory and continue to invest in his business.
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, new Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for sale

loans.name: Helina

texts.en: Helina E. sells fresh fish in order to help support and sustain her family in Boatase, Elmina.  She is single with 2 children and has received her junior high school education.  Helina has been in this business since 2005.  The loan will be used in order to further expand the business.  The profits gained from this expansion will be used to build a home for Ms. Helina and her family.

loans.use: The loan will be used in order to further expand business.

loans.name: Yakub

texts.en:
Yakub A. is 56 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Yakub’s goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. He is a taxi driver and travels the streets of Dushanbe city in search of customers. He has owned his business for 6 years. Yakub plans to replace his car's fuel supply system with one using gas, as gas is cheaper than petrol. His car also needs thorough repair.  With these goals in mind, he wants to borrow $2500 USD for the term of 18 months. He sincerely thanks Kiva and all lenders that make this help possible.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchasing Kapron gas cylinders for his car's fuel supply system and spare parts for thorough repair.

loans.name: Ranohol

texts.ru: Кенджаева РАънохол проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 47 лет , замужем и имеет четверых детей. занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке района. Торгует овощами и фруктами. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ranohol K. lives in the Shahrinau region. She is 47 years old, married and has four children. She is in the retail business and has a vendor space on the central market of the region. She sells fruits and vegetables. She plans to use the loan to increase turnover of her produce.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnaround of goods

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce M. sells fresh fish in Boatase, Elmina, a business she began this year. Joyce is married and has received a senior high school education.  Her husband is employed as a fishmonger.  She is financially responsible for paying the family's water bill.  The loan will be used to further expand the business.  The profits will be used toward the creation of a home for Ms. Joyce and her family which will help create independence and a better life.

loans.use: To further expand the business

loans.name: Bobosaid

texts.en:
S. Bobosaid has worked with metal for 15 years in his own shop. He makes iron doors, gates and grating with fences. He's the father of 4 children and he started his business in order to support his wife and children. His plans are to increase his business and invest in tools and input materials, iron products, so he can provide better service to his customers and expand his business.

Bobosaid applied to IMON International for a loan of $ 1500 USD for the term of 12 months. As for his future plan, he wants all of his children to go to university and to get good jobs. Bobosaid is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.

loans.use: Purchasing of  iron products necessary for his business

loans.name: Yeadze

texts.en: Yeadze M. is married with 1 child and has received schooling through Senior High School.  Ms. Yeadze sells jewellery in Elmina, which she has done since 2007. Her husband is a businessman.  The loan will enable Ms. Yeadze to purchase more jewellery so that she may, in turn, sell it and create a profitable business.  The profits gained from the loan will be saved and used towards the ultimate goal of opening a store where Ms Yeadze will continue to sell her jewellery.

loans.use: to purchase more jewellery for re-sale

loans.name: Yatim

texts.en:
S. Yatim has a mobile shoeshine and shoe repair business in the streets of Somoni, mainly in the neighborhood of the main market. He is married and has three children. He works hard to support his family. He has been working at this business for 8 years. Today he has an urgent need to purchase more of the same shoeshine products and for this reason Yatim has been working with IMON International for the last 3 years. He feels very satisfied with the timely credit that has been granted to him, helping him to supply the needs of his business and obtain the products to keep repairing shoes.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. loans.use: Purchasing of input materials for his business

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Ахмедов Фарход  проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 38 лет. В данный момент нигде не работает. Но занимается фермерской деятельностью. имеет хозяйство , где разводит крупно-рогатый скот. Опыт работы в данной сфере уже 6 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Купив еще одного бычка  он сможет чаще выводить животных на рынок.Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Farhod A. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 38 years old. Currently, he is unemployed. However, Farhod is involved in an agricultural business and owns a farm where he raises cattle. He has 6 years of experience in this field. Farhod plans to obtain a loan to increase his livestock headcount. Buying one more bull will allow him to bring the cattle to the market more often. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is married, with 2 children, and has sold fish since 2001. She goes to the seashore to purchase fresh fish; she then processes the fish by smoking them or preparing them in other ways for selling purposes in Elmina. Her husband works as a seaman.

Elizabeth uses her income to help her husband pay their children's school fees. Elizabeth intends to use the loan to expand her business. The profits will be used toward the building of a home for Elizabeth and her family which will help create independence and a better life.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Askarali

texts.en:
S. Askarali is a dynamic and ambitious young man, very professional and focused on his business. He has a business selling cement and feed for cattle in the neighborhood of “Dehkon” market. He has been in this business for 4 years and has gained a rich experience. He has a special warehouse where he keeps his goods in safety. He knows how to store cement so that it doesn’t deteriorate.

All this allows Askarali to make his business quite successful and it brings in stable income for his family. With the profit from his business he has been continuously supporting his 4 children with education and food. Today, knowing that the price of the cement is presently low but will increase soon for sure, he wants to purchase more goods to store up. For this reason he is asking for a loan of 3000 USD for the term of 12 months. Askarali expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cement and feed for cattle for re-sale

loans.name: Bakhtiryar

texts.en:
Bakhtiryar Q. is 36 years old. He is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of goods such as shampoos, detergents, and other items in his grocery store. Bakhtiryar is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales.

Bakhtiryar has run this business for more than 15 years. With savings, he could grow and expand his business. Currently Bakhtiryar is requesting a loan of $1200 USD for a term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to increase his stock

loans.name: Kambarali

texts.en:
T. Kambarali is 38 years old. He is married with three school-age children. Kambarali is a manufacturer. He produces wooden doors and window frames. The shop is located in his house. After working in this business for six years, Kambarali is a rather experienced master and now he has students. Kambarali has many customers because he produces quality goods at acceptable prices. He sells the doors and window frames from his house and at a trading place located in the local market. In general, his business is very successful and generates a stable income for the family. Now Kambarali is planning to purchase the additional woodworker he needs to expand his business. For this reason, he requests $3000 USD for the term of 12 months. Kambarali has gained a reputation for responsibility in his financial obligations and for keeping his word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist him with the operation of his business.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchasing a woodworker.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth M. is married with two children. She has sold fish since 1999.  She goes to the seashore to purchase fresh fish; she then processes the fish by smoking it or preparing it in other ways to sell in Boatase, Elmina.  Her husband is a boat owner.  Her financial responsibilities include paying the light and water bills.  The loan will be used to expand Elizabeth’s business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to use the profits to further her children's education.

loans.use: The loan will be used to expand her business.

loans.name: Ismoiljon

texts.ru: Кенджаев Исмоилджон проживает в районе Шахринау.Возраст 40 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Уже 10 лет занимается услугой такси. Имеет свой автомобиль , которы и использует в качестве такси. Работает по маршруту Шахринау-Душанбе. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить запчасти для автомашины. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ismoiljon K. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 40 years old, married and has three children. He has been in the taxi service business for 10 years. He owns a car that he utilizes as a taxi. He works on the Shahrinav-Dushanbe route. Ismoiljon plans to obtain this loan in order to purchase auto parts for his car. He can repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Zulfuzar

texts.en:
B. Zulfuzar is 36 years old. She is married with 4 children. She started her own business 13 years ago because her husband at that time was unemployed. Currently her husband is earning money in Russia. 

Zulfuzar sells confectionery such as candies, cookies and pastries in the local market.  The generated income allows Zulfuzar to support her family. Zulfuzar dreams of educating all of her children through higher education. Today she is requesting 5000 Somoni for a term of 6 months. She is going to spend the loan for purchasing confectionery to enlarge her range of goods. She is planning to spend the extra income for the well-being of her family as well as for educating her children.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing confectionery to enlarge her range of goods

loans.name: Reset

texts.en:
Reset A. is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 44, married with three children. Reset has a small grocery and sells foodstuffs. The business is very successful but needs some investment of capital to increase its daily turnover. That's why he has applied for a loan of 1225 USD.

This loan will allow him to buy bigger amounts of goods for re-sale and to better provide for his family and save more money to be able to provide his children with better education. With your collaboration he’ll be able to crystallize his dreams in a short time.

loans.use: purchase more goods for re-sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn D. has been educated through primary school, is married with 1 child, and has been selling fish since 1999.  She goes to the seashore to purchase fresh fish; she then processes the fish by smoking it or preparing it in other ways for selling purposes in Boatase, Elmina.  Her husband is employed as a taxi driver.  The loan will be used with the purpose of expanding her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build the family a home.

loans.use: expanding her business

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Мардонова Раъно жительница района Шахринау. Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Возраст 56 лет .Уже 15 лет занимается бизнесом в сфере услуг. Работает в столовой. Ее столовая находится в центре района. Кредит решила получить для того, чтобы закупить инвентарь. Таким образом она сможет улучшить условия работы и качество обслуживания. Этим она привлечет новых клиентов , что даст возможность заработать больше. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rano M. lives in the Shahrinav district. She is 56 years old, married and has four children. She has been in the service industry for 15 years and works at a cafeteria. Her cafeteria is located in the center of the district. Rano decided to obtain a loan in order to purchase additional inventory. This will allow her to improve work conditions and service quality. As a result, she could attract new customers and earn more money. She can repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Manzurat

texts.en:
Manzurat, aged 24, is the loving mother of one child. Since starting a family of their own, she and her husband have dedicated themselves to making and selling buns, through which they have been able to cover the basic needs of their home. Manzurat begins her workday early in the morning. Her dream is to grow her business so she can offer her products personally in markets throughout the regions of her country, thereby earning greater income to arrange for the wedding of her darling son.

For this reason, Manzurat is requesting a loan of 1200 USD that will allow her to do these things, promising to repay within 10 months. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her keep making buns and making her child's dreams a reality.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour and oil for baking buns

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
A. Irene is one of the executive members of Semuti group in Mityana. She is 27 years old and married with 3 children aged 7, 5 and 1 year. She has a clinic in Semuti where she treats the sick who are suffering from illnesses like malaria, colds, flu, cough, minor injuries, and many more. Irene also says that she offers delivery services for mothers though not on a daily basis and she would like to make it permanent as she tries to save so as to have all the necessary equipment for the services.

Irene also sells medicines and tablets over the counter and she is happy that after getting loans, she is able to stock the clinic with all the necessary drugs; hence fetching her more profits. She needs a loan to be able to buy more drugs for her stock. In the photo is also Dianah, the credit officer in charge of the group.

loans.use: Buying more drugs for her clinic

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Норова Дильбар проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 49 лет, замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Муж уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Ей одной приходится обеспечивать семью , так как муж почти не присылает деньги. Сама клиентка работает в магазине , где торгует косметикой и одеждой. Кредит ей необходим для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilbar N. lives in the Shahrinav district. She is 49 years old, married and has six children. Her husband left to earn a living in the Russian Federation. However, because he barely sends any money home, Dilbar now has to support her family. She works at store where she sells cosmetics and clothing. Dilbar needs this loan in order to increase her goods turnover. She can repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman Q. is 48 years old and married with three children. Mehman sells confectioneries, such as candies, cookies, pastries, and fruit jellies. He proudly states that he has been in this line of business for approximately twenty years. Mehman purchases his goods from the neighboring city. The income he is able to generate from his business allows him to support his family. He is the sole breadwinner in his family. 

Mehman will be using this loan to expand his inventory of goods. He plans to purchase additional confectioneries. Mehman thanks everyone for their support, and he promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more confectioneries.

loans.name: Otaboy

texts.en:
Otaboy O. is a 51 year old farmer who lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He is very experienced in his business as he has been farming since 1994. He is married with two children. His elder elder son and wife help him with the business. Unfortunately, Otaboy's farmland is infertile, so he is in need of a loan in the amount of $2500 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants to use on his wheat and potato crop.

Otaboy hopes the loan will allow him to increase his rice yield above and beyond what it was in previous years. As for his future plan, he wants all of his children to go to university, get good jobs, and be an important part of the wellbeing of this humble family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Amope

texts.en:
Amope sells foodstuffs, torchlights, batteries, and provisions. She goes to the Republic of Benin to buy rice in bags, tin tomatoes in cartons, and vegetable oil. She supplies her customers during the daytime from 7 am to 3 pm. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years.

Amope has four children and she is 38 years old. She lives in Orile-Agege and has been in her business for the past twelve years. Amope is requesting a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provision to sell.

loans.name: Jumaboy

texts.en:
Jumaboy A. is married and has two children. He runs a small business selling rice in the local market. His place is located in the main market aisle, where there are many customers every day. Jumaboy has been in this business for over ten years. He is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of his business.

Jumaboy is requesting a loan for $800 to increase the assortment of his sales inventory. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Jumaboy's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase rice to increase his range of business.

loans.name: Takku Ligaye 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Takku Ligaye 6 est un réseau courant toute la commune de Thiès.  C’est un groupement de femmes qui est bien structure.  Elles s’activent dans le commerce de légumes, céréales entre autres et dans la couture.  Ce premier crédit qu’elles sollicitent va leur permettre d’avoir un fond de roulement pour renforcer leur activité de commerce et de couture.  Avec les revenus elles aident leurs maris à entretenir leurs familles.
texts.en:
The Takku Ligaye 6 group is a network extending across the district of Thiès. This is a well-structured group of women. Their business involves selling vegetables and cereals, among other things, and dressmaking. This first loan they are requesting will enable them to have working capital to strengthen their sales and dressmaking business. The income will be used to help their husbands support their families.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and cereals, and dressmaking

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr: Monsieur Balla D. est un chauffeur marié qui habite au quartier Médina FALL de Thiès. Il est chauffeur depuis trés longtemps et a une grande expérience professionnel. Avec ce prêt il compte répérer son véhicule de taxi-urbain qui est en panne d'où il travaille pour entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Balla D. is a married taxi driver who lives in the Médina Fall neighborhood of Thiès. He has been a driver for a very long time and has a great deal of professional experience. He plans to use this loan to repair his taxi, which has broken down. He uses the vehicle for work in order to support his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Azim

texts.en:
Azim D. is a married man with five children. His children are the reason that he tries so hard to provide a stable family life and an education for their future. For the past 15 years, Azim has sold rice. This is a profitable business in his neighborhood. His sales have increased considerably year after year. His start-up capital was from the severance pay he received from where he worked previously.

To expand his business, Azim is requesting a loan of $800, which he intends to use for increasing the range of goods. The loan will greatly improve Azim’s income and his family's living standards.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase rice to increase his range of goods.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
Dilshod H. is a hard working and determined man. From the time he was very young, he was characterized as an excellent student. He finished his studies, but with the difficult economic situation in the country, he could not find work at any company.

Dilshod decided to invest his small savings, to start his own business selling rice at the market. Now it is the sole source of income for his family, including his wife and four children.

Due to the high demand for his products, because of their excellent quality, size and flavor, Dilshod has decided to apply for a loan of $ 700 to buy more goods for selling. This will allow him to earn more and improve his living.

------------------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International. Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History... Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and its lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase rice to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Moses S. is a member of Semuti group in Mityana. He was one of the first people to join this lending group nine years ago, and then he dropped out. Moses is frank to tell Pearl Microfinance Limited that for the three cycles he was out (one year), things were slow and his level of hard work had dropped a bit, and this affected his income.

He is the Chairman of the village and also has rental houses in Semuti trading centre that helps bring in money. Moses is also a farmer with various plantations growing matooke, cassava and maize.

Moses needs a loan to complete his other houses in the trading centre, by buying iron sheets. He also owns a boda (bicycle taxi) that he gives to others to ride for money, though at times he does the job himself. His wife is a teacher and they have six children who are all in school.

loans.use: Buy iron sheets for home construction.

loans.name: Gbemisola

texts.en:
Gbemisola is single parent with four children. She sells provisions and cosmetics.

She has been borrowing from LAPO to support her business for the past three years. Life is a little better than when she was not borrowing from LAPO.

Gbemisola has been in this business for the past 10 years and she lives in Agege, here in Lagos. Gbemisola is 49 years old and she is soliciting for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provision and cosmetics to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: Purchase more provisions and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Sylvester's Group

texts.en:
Sylvester M. is one of the executive members of Semuti group in Mityana. He is a Chief at his Sub County where he collects taxes and revenue from markets and shops and gives out licenses.

Sylvester also has a retail shop in the Semuti trading center as his business, so whenever he is out of work, he goes to it to help out his wife. He needs a loan to help with restocking his shop with more goods that can bring in more revenue.

loans.use: Buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Chioma

texts.en:
Chioma sells foodstuffs in her shop. She has been in this trade for the past three years.

She is 31 years old and married with four children.

Chioma needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru: Саёхат выращивает дома домашний скот. Это дополнение к заработку мужа, который работает в колхозе, а по воскресным дня посещает скотные рынки и если попадается бараны подешевле скупает и привозит домой. Месяц другой Саёхат и дети смотрят за ним и затем продают. Саёхат 37 лет, имеет 2 детей. Вместе с односельчанами решила прийти в МикроИнвест и подала заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Sayohat raises livestock at home. This is an additional to her husband's income who works in a collective farm. And on Sundays she visits livestock markets and if she finds sheep that cost less, she buys and brings them home. For a couple of months Sayohat and her children keep after them and later put them for resale. Sayohat is 37 years old and has two children. Together with her fellow villagers she decided to come to MicroInvest and apply for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sheep and fodder

loans.name: Fedelia

texts.en:
Fedelia sells drinks and pepper soup and has been in this business for the past three years.

She lives in Shibiri, in Lagos State and she has been taking loans from LAPO for the past two years. She needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and pepper soup spices to sell.

Fedelia is the mother of three children and she is 40 years old. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more drinks and pepper soup spices.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou S. est une femme mariée qui habite au quartier Médina FALL DE Thiés. Elle fait le commerce de vanneries  et des objets d'art au niveau de la route de Saint-Louis. Elle compte renforcer son activité avec ce prêt par une commande plus importante à l'occasion du Maouloud de Tivaoune . Avec ses revenues elle aide son mari à payer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou S. is a married woman who lives in the Médina Fall neighborhood of Thiès. She sells baskets and objets d’art along the Saint-Louis road. She plans to use the loan to boost her business by placing larger orders in time for Tivaoune’s “Maouloud” (a festival in celebration of the birth of the Prophet Mohammed). Her income helps her husband pay for their children’s education.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan sells traveling bags and hair extension. She has been in the trade for the past four years.

She lives in Okoko, in Lagos state with her four children. Susan is 45 years old and needs a loan of N80, 0000 to purchase more hair extension and traveling bags to sell. She says thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase more traveling bags and hair extension to sell.

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en:
Ngozi sells electrical accessories and drinks in her shop located along Igando Road in Lagos state. She has been in the trade for the past three years.

Ngozi is 29 years old and married with three children. She has been taking loans from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years and the loans have tremendously increased her business and her family life.

Ngozi needs a loan of N80,000 to purchase more electrical accessories and drinks to sell.

loans.use: Purchase more electrical accessories and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фариде 27 лет, замужем и имеет двоих детей. Ее младший ребенок еще маленький и поэтому она сидит дома. Ее муж работает в колхозе, но заработок очень маленький. Чтобы поддержать мужа Фарида смотрит дома за скотом. Каждые 2-3 месяца можно справить какие-либо расходы семьи за счет прибыли от продажи скота. Фарида обратилась  в МикроИнвест за получением займа.
texts.en:
Farida is 27 years old, married, and has two children. Her younger child is still small, and consequently she stays home. Her husband works on a collective farm, but he earns very little. To help her husband, Farida looks after the cattle at home. Every two to three months they can pay some family bills by using the profit from cattle sales. Farida has asked MicroInvest for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Dorothy's Group

texts.en:
Dorothy N. is a member of Budumbuli group in Jinja. She is a business woman selling fresh matooke in the Budumbuli trading center, her home area.

This is the eigth loan she is taking from Pearl Microfinance and she is grateful that with the loans, she has been able to increase stock and have great yields, both from the farmers she buys from as well as from trucks loaded with matooke.

She has been able to save over time and as a result, she bought a plot of land which she didn’t expect to achieve so fast. She is a farmer, though on a small scale. of maize, ground nuts and plantains and she hopes to increase the yield if she can access more land for farming.

loans.use: Buy more matooke to sell and land for agriculture.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen A. is currently in the business of selling alcohol and is requesting a loan to buy more sugar and yeast for distillation.

She is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy more sugar and yeast for distillation.

loans.name: Kadi

texts.en:
Kadi P. is currently in the business of selling beer and soda and is requesting a loan to buy more crates of beer and soda. Kadi is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Kiva partner BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan in 2007. The microfinance program, which is targeted to returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non government organizations) as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda and beer to sell

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Фируз житель города Яван. Возраст 23 года ,совсем недавно женился , поэтому детей не имеет и живет с родителями. Нигде не работает , а занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить породистого бычка , для получения потомства. Погасить кердит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Firuz A. lives in Yavan. He is 23 years, recently married, has no children and lives with his parents. He is unemployed, but is involved in animal husbandry. He raises cattle. Firuz plans to obtain this loan in order to buy a purebred bull to get offspring. He can repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a purebred bull

loans.name: Mukaddam

texts.ru: Мукаддам 29 лет. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Муж работает, кроме этого занимается куплей продажей скота. Дома Мукаддам помогает ему и смотрит за скотом. Вместе они планируют увеличить поголовье скота и поэтому обратились за получением займа. На полученный займ планируют приобрести маленького бычка.
texts.en:
Mukaddam is 27 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband works and, besides that, buys and sells cattle. At home, Mukaddam helps him and looks after the cattle. Together they plan to increase their number of cattle, and consequently, they have applied for a loan. When they receive the loan, they plan on buying a small calf.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Qiyomiddin

texts.ru: Абишев Киемиддин житель города Яван. Возраст 23 года. Еще не женат. Уже три года занимается бизнесом. Открыл точку обслуживания клиентов по продаже пластиковых карт и денежных переводов за мобильную связь. обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы закупить карты различных провайдеров. Это даст возможность увеличить ассортимент  и соответсвенно доход. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Qiyomiddin A. lives in Yavan. He is 23 years old and is not yet married. He has been a businessman for 3 years. Qiyomiddin opened a sales location that sells plastic cards and money transfers for mobile phones. He turned to us for a loan in order to purchase cards from different providers. This will give him the opportunity to increase his product assortment and profits. He plans to pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cards for sale

loans.name: Jumanazar

texts.ru: Азимов Джуманазар житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 52 года , женат и имеет шестерых детей. Уже 25 лет обеспечивает семью ,занимаясь сельским хозяйством. Арендует землю , которую засеивает пшеницей. Сейчас необходимо удобрять засеинную пшеницу , поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом. Деньги планирует использовать для покупки удобрений. Погасить кредит сможет в течение шести месяцев.
texts.en:
Jumanazar A. is a resident of the Abdurahmon Jomi area. He is 52 years old, is married and has six children. For 25 years now he has provided for his family by doing agriculture work. He rents land on which he plants wheat. Right now it is necessary to fertilize the planted wheat and this is why he turned to us for a loan. He plans to use the money to purchase fertilizer. Jumanazar will be able to pay back the loan over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertizlizer for wheat

loans.name: Naimchon

texts.ru: Наимчон молодой парень и еще не женат. Он живет со своими родителями в небольшой деревне. После окончания школы он начал работать в колхозе. По выходным дням выходит на рынок и занимается там куплей продажей мелкого скота. Дома держит корову и бычков. За ними дома следит его мать (на фото). Молоко используют дома, излишки продают соседям. Наимчон пришел в МикроИнвест и подал заявку на займ. Собирается купить бычка.
texts.en:
Naimchon is a young man, not yet married. He lives with his parents in a small village. After leaving school, he started to work on a collective farm. On his days off, he goes to the market and works buying and selling cattle. At home, he keeps a cow and calves. They are cared for by his mother (in the photo). They use the milk at home and sell any surplus to neighbors. Naimchon has come to MicroInvest and applied for a loan. He is going to buy a calf.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Atogo

texts.en:
Atogo D. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to build a shop for her bread sales. Atogo is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Kiva partner BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan in 2007. The microfinance program, which is targeted to returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non government organizations) as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

loans.use: to build a shop where she can sell her bread.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
El Sr. Adolfo V., està casado con la Sra.Ramona Falcon, juntos tienen 5 hijos ya todos mayores de edad e independientes actualmente.

                       Ambos se dedican al cultivo de diferentes plantas naturales para su comercializaciòn,dicho trabajo es ayudado por un hijo que es Ingeniero Agrònomo.
                          
                         Con el  ingreso   obtenido de  dicho  trabajo lograron sacar  adelante a sus cinco  hijos teniendo en cuenta que el vivero  con el  que  cuenta es unico en  la zona  y  les  sirve  de apoyo  econòmico para  salir adelante  

                           Solicitò el crèdito con nuestra entidad para la compra de semillas .
texts.en:
Adolfo V. and his wife, Ramona Falcon, have five children. The children are all economically independent. Adolfo and Ramona own a nursery, where they cultivate natural plants. One of their sons is an Agronomist, and he helps them. With the income from this work, the couple has been able to help their five children get ahead. This was possible because the nursery is the only one of its kind in their area. Adolfo would like a loan to buy seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Каримова Зарина проживает в городе Яван. имеет одного ребенка.Одна воспитывает сына , так как является вдовой. Приходится много работать. Привозит товар из города Душанбе  и продает на рынке , который работает два раза в неделю. Торгует хозяйственными товарами. Опыт работы три года. Решила получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
