Zarina K. lives in Yavan. She has one child. Zarina is raising her son on her own, because she is a widow. She needs to work a lot. Zarina brings her products from Dushanbe and sells them at the market which is open two times a week. She sells household products and has three years of experience. Zarina decided to take out a loan in order to increase her turnover. She will be able to pay back the loan over 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad is a 27-year-old young man living in Chwayfat in Mount Lebanon. He started as a home-based tailor five years ago, and in 2005, he opened his first shop in his home village. Today, Imad is requesting a loan for $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine to increase his output.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Madalena's Group

texts.en:
N. Madalena is a business lady in the business of selling produce to markets. She works mostly as a supplier whereby she buys from farmers and loads goods on a truck with some of her friends which they then supply to markets where they sell as wholesalers. She deals in produce like cassava, sweet potatoes, maize, beans and so on and this helps her to get her money in a wholesome way.

This is the 18th loan N. is getting from Pearl Microfinance. She says that her loans have helped her in running her businesses. She needs this loan to buy a plantation of cassava so she can sell in portions depending on the demand for her produce.

loans.use: To buy a cassava plantation to sell cassava.

loans.name: Ashurmo

texts.ru: Сафарова Ашурмо проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 56 лет, замужем и имеет восьмерых детей.Уже 8 лет , занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом имеет  магазин , где торгует продуктами питания и другого рода мелочами. Бизнес налажен , но она планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара. Это даст возможность привлечь новых клиентов  и увеличить  товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ashurmo S. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 56 years old, married and has eight children. She has been in the retail business for eight years. She has a store next to her house where she sells food and other small items. Her business is steady and she plans to get a loan so she can increase the variety of the goods she offers. This will also let her attract new customers and increase sales and commodity circulation. She can pay off the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru: Ятимова Садбарг проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 56 лет, замужем и имеет шестерых  детей. Старшие дети в России на заработках. Она с мужем занимается торговлей. Магазин рядом с домом. Ассортимент большой , но оборотная сумма не позволяет развивать бизнес. Поэтому она решила получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sadbarg Y. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 56 years old, married and has six children. Her older children are in Russia as work migrants. She and her husband are in retail. They have a store near the house. They have a large variety of products, but working capital does not allow them to expand business. This is why Sadbarg decided to apply for a loan to increase circulation of goods. She can pay off the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to build a charcoal store as a sales point. Esther is 37 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has four children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, Esther hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a charcoal store

loans.name: Ashurhon

texts.ru: На фото Вы видите дочь Ашурхон. Сама Ашурхон работает, а ее дети смотрят за скотом дома. Ашурхон 44 года, замужем, имеет троих детей. Кроме основной работы занимается предпринимательством – куплей продажей скота. С кормом у Ашурхон нет проблем так как она позаботилась об этом и сделала запасы сена и накладные расходы бизнеса минимальные.В МикроИнвест кредитуется в первый раз и на займ планирует прикупить бычка.
texts.en:
On the photo you see the daughter of Ashurhon. Ashurhon is working and her children are looking after the livestock. Ashurhon is 44 years old, married and has three children. Besides her main job she is an entrepreneur - she buys and sells cattle. She does not have a lack of fodder because she has though of it beforehand and made sure to stock up in advance and has small overhead. This is her first loan at MicroInvest and she plans to use the loan to buy a calf.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline W. is 37 years old and is married to a medical doctor. She has four children who go to school. Jackline currently dispenses drugs and is requesting a loan to build a pharmacy. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Kiva partner BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan in 2007. The microfinance program, which is targeted to returning war refugees, has formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non government organizations) as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

loans.use: Build a pharmacy

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
El Sr. Fidel M., tiene 28 años de edad y vive en el barrio Virgen del Carmen de la  ciudad de Carapeguà. Tiene un hijo y no està casado.

Es empleado de una estaciòn de servicios llamada  Caranda, desempeñandose como playero tiene una antigüedad de 5 años. Tambien hace tres años que se dedica la venta ambulante por la zona de la  ciudad de Paraguarì y sus diferentes barrios. 

               Fidel es  muy conocido en la  zona por ser  muy  luchador  y responsable. Desde muy  niño se inicio trabajando como vendedor ambulante fuera de su casa, ya que su madre lo tuvo de muy  joven y  tuvo que dejarlos para viaja a al Argentina en  busca de mejores oportunidades, quedandosè el  al cuidado de su abuela y sus tres hermanos.
              
              Manifiesta estar muy contento con el trabajo que realiza ya que  gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio està logrando muchos proyectos.
          
                         Solicitò un prèstamo con nuestra entidad para la compra de zapatos  y  uniforme.
texts.en:
Fidel M. is 28 years old, and lives in the Virgen del Carmen neighborhood in the city of Carapeguà. He has one son and is not married. Fidel works in a gas station called Caranda, and has been an attendant there for five years. Three years ago, Fidel also became a street vendor in the Paraguarì area of the city. Fidel is known in the area for being a hard worker and very responsible. He's worked as a street vendor ever since he was a child. His mother had him when she was very young and subsequently had to leave him in search of better opportunities in Argentina. She left him in the care of his grandmother and three uncles. Fidel says that he's happy with his work and thanks to his effort and sacrifice he's earning many projects. He would like a loan to buy shoes and uniforms to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes and uniforms to sell

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
El Sr Concepciòn es  oriundo de la  ciudad de Roque Gonzalez. Tiene 58 años, es soltero  y  no tiene  hijos. Ahora vive en compañía de su  hermano  y  juntos  llevan adelante una  pequeña  despensa en su casa.  Viven  en casa  propia que lograron construir con  mucho ezfuerzo.

Desde muy joven Concepciòn fue  independiente, ya que  fue  huerfano de padre de niño y tuvo  que pasar  por  muchas  necesidades  para  poder ayudar a  su madre para salir adelante. El no  tuvo  la suerte de tener  hijos  pero  vive con su hermano menor y su madre y juntos forman  una   familia.

Con el  ingreso que le genera  su actividad logra mantener a su madre ya que es anciana  y vive con èl.
Con el crèdito obtenido comprarà azucar y maiz.
texts.en:
Concepciòn is from the city of Roque Gonzalez. He is 58 years old and single, and has no children. Now he lives with his brother, and together they run a small store in their home. Concepciòn owns his house, which he and his brother built together. Since he was very young, Concepciòn has been independent. He never knew his father, and had to forgo many basic necessities in order to help his mother get ahead. He was not lucky enough to have children, but he lives with his younger brother and their mother, and together they are a family. Concepciòn's income allows him to support his mother, who is now elderly. With this loan he'll buy sugar and corn.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, corn, and other supplies for his store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace G. is 40 years old and is married to a soldier. She has four children that go to school. Grace currently sells food at a hotel and is requesting a loan to buy more plates, cups, tables, chairs, etc. to use there. She hopes to be able to build a big hotel and lodge with the extra profits she earns from taking this loan.

Kiva partner BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan in 2007. The microfinance program, which is targeted to returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non government organizations) as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

loans.use: buy more plates,cups,tables,chairs etc for the hotel

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en: Sultan B. is a Tanzanian businessman. He runs a fruit shop. He sells a variety of fruits at Kigambon ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells mangoes, oranges, papaws, bananas, avocadoes etc. He purchases the fruit from the Buguruni fruit market at Korimako. He has been in the business for three years. Fruit demand is very high in Dar es Salaam. B. plans to runs a wholesale shop but funds are a limiting factor. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business items.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Josè vive en la Ciudad de Roque Gonzalez. Està casado con la  Sra Juana y ella es docente de profesiòn. Ellos tienen 3  hijos  todos  mayores de edad, viven en casa  propia  que con  mucho   sacrificio lograron construir. 

Se dedica  a la  compra  y venta  de animales  vacunos, el mismo se encarga del faenamiento y  venta de los  mismos.  Se dedica a este rubro hace ya mas de 20 años.  Por suerte Jose es muy conocido en la  zona y esta actividad siempre  le ha  dejado  muy buenas  ganancias.
  
Con el crèdito obtenido comprarà 2 novillos.
texts.en:
Jose lives in the city of Roque Gonzalez. He is married to Juana, and she is a teacher. They have three children, all of whom are grown. They live in their own home which they were able to build with a lot of sacrifice.

He buys and sells cattle and is responsible for the slaughter and sale of them. He has been in this line of work for over 20 years. Jose is well known in his area and this activity has always provided him with good earnings.

With this loan he will buy two steers.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy steers

loans.name: Nassoro

texts.en: Food shops are very common in Dar es Salaam. Nassoro S. runs a food shop business at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells a variety of crop products in his shop. He sells non-cereal and cereal products including wheat flower, maize flower, sugar, beans, groundnuts, cooking oil, cashew nuts and maize grains .He purchases the items direct from the producers and others from Kariakoo city market. He needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to boost his business

loans.use: To buy more products for his shop

loans.name: Diomar

texts.es:
Diomar es socia del Bancomunal Amigas Unidas.
Diomar  es separada, tiene 48 años  una hija de 28 años, que trabaja  
Diomar vendía comida en el mercado durante dos años, lo dejo por qué no-tenia quien le ayudó, hace siete años se  puso a vender productos de belleza por catalogo. 
Diomar necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, para invertirlos en  la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo. 
Desde que está en Finca, ha aumentado su capital, ya no necesita estar pidiendo prestado a otras personas dinero que le cobrarán altos intereses. 
El sueño de Diomar es tener una tienda bazar.
texts.en:
Diomar is a partner in the Amigas Unidas Community Bank. She 48 years old and separated. She has one daughter who is 28 years old and works independently. Diomar sold food in the market for two years, but she had to abandon the business because she didn't have anyone to help her. Seven years ago she began to sell beauty products via catalog. Diomar needs a loan of 2000 soles to invest in beauty products. Since working with Finca she has increased her capital, and now she doesn't need to ask for loans from people who charge high interest rates. Diomar dreams of owning a store in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in beauty products

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor es socia del Bancomunal Amigas Unidas.
Flor es casada tiene 44 años, tres hijos de 27, 19 y 14 años él ultima está estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Flor  tiene su bodega hace quince años, es un local que su papá le vendió  y la fue pagando poco a poco, sus hijos le ayudan, ella también   hace composturas y cose ropa.   
Flor necesita un crédito de 1600 soles, para la compra de gaseosas, helados.
Desde que está en Finca pudo comprar su máquina exhibidora para las gaseosas, vitrinas, para su bodega  su economía ha mejorado.
El sueño de Flor es surtir más su bodega, y le gustaría poner una cabina de internet.
texts.en:
Flor is a partner in the Amigas Unidas Community Bank. She is 44 years old and married, with three children. Flor's children are 27, 19, and 14 years old, and the youngest attends public school. Flor has had a small store for five years, in a building that her father sold to her. She has paid him back little by little, and her children help. Flor also sews and repairs clothes. Flor needs a loan of 1600 soles, which she'll use to buy sodas and ice creams for the store. Since she's worked with Finca, Flor has bought a cooler for her store, where she showcases the soft drinks for sale. The store has improved her economic situation. Flor dreams of supplying her store with more products, and she'd like to add a station for customers to use the internet.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and ice creams

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es socia del Bancomunal Amigas Unidas.
Luzmila es casada tiene 42 años, tiene tres hijos de  23, 13 y 7 años, los dos últimos están en la escuela estatal.
Luzmila era vendedora ambulante por mucho tiempo, alquilo un puesto y se puso a vender fruta, pero no le rendía se le malograba mucho, ella vio que el vender condimentos tenia mas salida y le dejaba mas rentabilidad.
Luzmila necesita un crédito de 1200 soles para la compra de condimentos al por mayor, vinagre, sillao.queso. 
Desde que Luzmila esta en Finca a podido aumentar su mercadería, ha recibido, ha recibido orientación  para su negocio, ahora sabe cómo administrar mejor el negocio.  
El sueño de Luzmila es tener un puesto propio.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of Bancomunal Amigas Unidas. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children aged 23, 13, and 7. The youngest two children are in the state school. Luzmila was a street vendor for a long time and then she rented a booth and began to sell fruit, but the business did not profit and she ended up wasting a lot. She realized that there were more opportunities for her to sell condiments and it would be more profitable for her. Luzmila needs a loan of 1,200 soles (USD$400) to purchase vinegar, soy sauce and cheese at wholesale prices. Since Luzmila has been a part of FINCA she has been able to increase her stock, has received business advice, and now knows how to administrate her own business. Luzmila’s dream is to own her own booth.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase condiments at wholesale prices

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Amigas Unidas.
Juana es viuda  tiene 73 años, tiene 6 hijos, que están casados.
Cuándo el esposo de Juana estaba vivó decidieron poner una Fuente de soda por que el se quedó sin trabajo, fue así como se inicio y poco a poco ha ido creciendo, ella atiende y ha contratado una chica que le ayuda.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para arreglo de las puertas de su negocio, arreglo del techo y pintado del local. 
Desde que esta en Finca ha aprendido como organizar mejor su negocio, gracias al curso que se dictan dentro del Bancomunal.
El sueño de Juana es agrandar mas su negocio, y arreglarlo por que se le ha caído el techo.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Amigas Unidas communal bank. She is a widow, 73 years old and has 6 children, all of whom are married. While Juana's husband was alive they decided to start up a soda store because he didn't have a job, and little by little the store grew. Currently, Juana tends the store and also has hired a woman to help her. Juana needs a loan of 2000 Soles to fix the doors and roof of the store as well as painting it. Since joining Finca she has learned how to better organize her business, thanks to a course that was given at the communal bank. Juana's dream is to grow her business and fix her fallen roof.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair doors and roof of store, as well as painting

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Bancomunal Amigas Unidas.
Olga es casada tiene 46 años, tiene 46 años, un hijo de 23 años, que estudia.
Olga tiene su tienda hace ocho años, empezó vendiendo ternos hechos pero hace dos años contrato dos sastres para que confecciones a medida a sus clientes, su tienda se llama “sastrería  Ángelo”
Olga necesita un crédito de 3600 soles, para la copra de ternos hechos, telas para  confeccionar, y accesorios.  
Desde que está en Finca se ha podido comprar sus maquinas industriales, gracias a las inversiones realizadas.  
El sueño de Olga es tener un taller de confecciones grande en gamarra.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Amigas Unidas Communal Bank. She is 46 years of age and married with a son, 23, who is a student. Olga has had her store, Sastrería Ángelo, for eight years. She began selling manufactured suits, but two years ago hired two tailors to produce suits made-to-order for her clients. Olga needs a loan of 3,600 Sols to purchase ready-made suits, fabrics for custom suits and accessories. Since she has been working with FINCA Peru, she has been able to buy production machinery thanks to the loans she has received. Olga's dream is to have a large tailor shop in Gamarra.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase suits, fabrics and accessories.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina es socia del Bancomunal Amistad Unida.
Georgina es separada tiene  48 años, tiene dos hijos de 30 y 23 años que trabajan.
Ella empezó el negocio de venta de menú, al frente de su casa había un lugar donde daban menú y siempre estaba lleno, converso con su hija que no-tenia trabajó y decidieron vender menú hasta el día de hoy han pasado cuatro años y le va bien, tiene mas clientelas. 
Georgina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de una cocina industrial de tres hornillas.
Desde que esta en Finca, tiene mas capital, puede comprar al por mayor, a comprado ollas, platos para su negocio. 
El sueño de Georgina es terminar de construir su casa, para alquilarla y vivir de sus rentas.
texts.en:
Georgina is a member of "Bancomunal Amistad Unida" (United Friendship Community Bank).

Georgina is separated. She is 48 years old. She has two children who are 30 and 23 years old and working.

She began selling food. In front of her house, there was a place where they sold food and it was always full. She spoke with her daughter, who was not working, and they decided to sell food. Today, they have been working for four years and the business is going well for them. They have a growing number of customers.

Georgina needs a loan of $650 (2000 PEN) in order to buy an industrial kitchen with three ovens.

Since she has been in FINCA, she has more capital, and can buy wholesale and buy pots and dishes for her business.

Georgina’s dream is to finishing constructing her house so that she can rent it and live on the income.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Georgina needs a loan of $650 (2000 PEN) in order to purchase an industrial kitchen with three ovens.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa O. is 45 years old. She is married and has six children. Yaa says two of her children are in senior high school, two are in primary school, and the other two are out of school and run their own businesses. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw, in the eastern region of Ghana.

Yaa runs a palm oil production business to earn income to help support her family. She procures palm fruits from farmers in her community and nearby villages to produce the oil. She trades in vegetables as well.

Yaa distributes her palm oil to customers who come to buy wholesale and retail. She will use her loan to procure palm fruits in bulk, so that she can produce oil in bulk to distribute to her increasing number of customers. She aspires to give her children the very best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros es casada tiene 39 años, cuatro hijos de 18, 16, 12 y 7 años, los tres últimos están en la escuela estatal. 
Milagros tiene su negocio de  “eventos Jams, cuando se caso su esposo trabajaba animando fiestas, en eventos, ella desde entonces lo ha apoyado en todo y gracias a Dios están surgiendo tiene.
Milagros necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para la compra de un  pawer, luces y hacer mantenimiento a sus equipos. 
Desde que esta en Finca, ha recibido orientación de cómo administrar mejor su negocio, ella lo comparte con su esposo, también gracias a los prestamos han podido invertir y comprar una filmadora, parlantes. 
El sueño de Milagros es tener una empresa de eventos.
texts.en:
Milagros is married, and is 39 Years old. She has four children. They are 18, 16, 12, and 7 years old. The youngest of the three go to a public school. Milagros has a business called “Jam’s events”, in which her husband is the MC at events. He supports the family, and thanks to god they are getting by. Milagros needs a loan $975 (3000 Soles), for the purchase of a generator, lights and the maintenance costs for their equipment. Ever since she joined Finca, she has received guidance of how to better administer this business, she shares the information with her husband, and also thanks to the loans they have been able to invest and buy a video camera and loudspeakers. Milagros' dream is to have an event organizing company.

(Translated by Nigel of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Milagros needs a loan $975 (3000 Soles), for the purchase of a generator, lights and the maintenance costs for their equipment.

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarollo Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguà en la Cñia Potrero distante a 5km de la oficina de Carapeguá uñas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa.
 
Estas Señoras son activas. Todas ellas son artesanas o tejedoras. Ellas tejen sus frasadas y sus maridos e hijos llevan a vender en los macates por afuera de la ciudad de Carapeguà. Mediante estas ventas, ellas estan buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar atravez del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de viD..

Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.

En la fotografía aparecen 19 personas ya que dos de ellas son hijas de las integrantes del comité.

1	Jorgelina D. S. 	tejedora
2	Lidia S.	        tejedora 
3	Alejandra D.	tejedora
4	HilD. M.	        tejedora
5	Francisca M.	        tejedora
6	Filomena MiranD.	tejedora
7	Olga M.	        tejedora
8	Juana O.	        tejedora
9	Vicenta M.	        tejedora
10	Antoliana T.	tejedora
11	Daisy V.	        tejedora
12	Graciela O.	        tejedora
13	Delia M.	        tejedora
14	Ma-Luciana O.	EmpleaD. de servicio
15	Vicenta C.	        tejedora
16	Martha P.	        tejedora
17	Silvia M.	        tejedora
texts.en:
5km from the department of Carapeguà in the town of the same name in the Potrero district, a group of women of limited means found out about the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Women Entrepreneurs) programme and decided to get together to find out more about it. These women keep busy, they are all artisans and weavers. They weave blankets that their husbands and children take to sell through street vendors outside of the town of Carapeguà. By way of these sales, the women are looking for a bit more help in order to increase their household incomes and improve their quality of life.

These women need loans to invest in their respective work and thus to be able to obtain sustainable growth that will let them grow both as a group and individually

There are 19 people in the photo, of which two are daughters of members of the committee.

1 Jorgelina D. S. – weaver

2 Lidia S. – weaver

3 Alejandra D. – weaver

4 HilD. M. – weaver

5 Francisca M. – weaver

6 Filomena MiranD. – weaver

7 Olga M. – weaver

8 Juana O. – weaver

9 Vicenta M. – weaver

10 Antoliana T. – weaver

11 Daisy V. – weaver

12 Graciela O. – weaver

13 Delia M. – weaver

14 Ma-Luciana O. – general employee

15 Vicenta C. – weaver

16 Martha P. – weaver

17 Silvia M. – weaver


Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The majority of the committee members will invest their loans in their present activities and buy things such as cloth and thread to weave the bed covers, etc.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu I. is 28 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. According to her, her two children are in primary school. Salamatu lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw, in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

She works to make some income to support her husband financially. She is in the palm oil production business. Salamatu procures palm fruits from farmers in her community and in nearby villages to produce the oil. She distributes the oil to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She wants a loan to procure palm fruits in bulk so she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to an increasing number of her customers.

It is her desire to give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure palm fit for processing.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys P. is 50 years old.  She is a married mother of nine children.  According to her, her last two children are still in school – junior high school. The rest are out of school and running their own businesses. She lives with some of her children in a family house in Nkawkaw, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 

She says though her husband is employed, she still needs to work hard to help herself.

Gladys deals in smoked and fried fish.  She procures smoked fish all the way from Yeji in the north.  She sells to retailers in her community. Gladys has been in business since her youthful days.  She wants a loan to procure smoked fish in bulk.  Gladys also deals in second hand clothes.  She aspires to give her last two children the best education.

loans.use: Procure smoked fish.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel vive en casa propia con sus hijos en la calle Paraguay de la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo es labrador y trabaja en el campo, ella se dedica a la venta de API (parecido al café, pero hecho de maiz) en un puesto que tiene en una plaza de la ciudad; con esta actividad ella mantiene a sus hijos y puede cubrir sus mas mínimas necesidades.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos (maiz molido, azucar,canela, etc.), comprar una mesita y sillas para dar comodidad e higiene a sus clientes, de esta manera mantener sus ingresos y tratar de mejorarlos.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2007 y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel lives in her own house with her children on Paraguay Street in the Miraflores zone of the city of La Paz. Her husband is a farm worker and works in the field. She sells API (like coffee, but made from corn) in a stand that she has in the town square. With this activity she provides for her children and can cover their most basic needs. The credit she is seeking is to buy supplies (ground corn, sugar, cinnamon, etc..) and to buy a table and chairs to provide comfort and hygiene to her customers, and in this way maintain her earnings and try to increase them. She has been a client of Impro since 2007 and has a good payment history, which means she can agree to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ground corn, sugar, and other supplies for the preparation and sale of Api (coffee like drink)

loans.name: Jorge Raul

texts.es:
Jorge  es conviviente  tiene 42 años, tres hijos de 15, 9 y 4 años que están en la escuela  estatal.
Jorge vende pollos y le quedaban bastantes residuos, su esposa vende comida y también le quedaban residuos y  tenían que pagar para que se lo lleven, es cuando vio que los residuos le podían ser útiles como  comida de chanchos, es cuando decidieron criar chanchos, actualmente tiene 180 chanchos. 
Jorge necesita 1600 soles, para comprar chanchos  vivos, y comida para chanchos.
Desde que está en Finca, ha progresado económicamente, también  aprendió a ser puntual en sus pagos por que le cuesta.
El sueño de Jorge es comprar una camioneta para su negocio.
texts.en:
Jorge is 42 years old and he lives with his wife and children. He has three children that are the ages of 15, 9, and 4 years old. They are all in public school. Jorge sells chicken and his wife sells food, and they used to always have leftovers. They always used to have to pay people to take away the leftovers until Jorge got the idea to raise pigs and to feed the leftovers to the pigs. He now has 180 pigs. Jorge needs $525 to buy live pigs and food for them. Since Jorge has been in the group Finca, he has progressed economically. Also, he has learned to be punctual in making his payments on loans for his business. Jorge’s dream is to buy a truck for his business. (Translated by Reece of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jorge needs $525 to buy live pigs and food for them.

loans.name: Perfecto

texts.es:
El señor Perfecto vive en casa de sus padres con su esposa e hijos en la calle Inca Roca de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene una pequeña tienda alquilada en el edificio de la Normal Superior de Estudios de la ciudad de El Alto, donde allí instaló una tienda donde ofrece servicio de fotocopias. Con esta actividad el mantiene a su familia y puede cubrir las necesidades de su familia. El crédito que solicita será destinado a la compra de papel, tinta y otros insumos necesarios para manejar su negocio.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2007 y ya fue parte de kiva con un préstamo anterior el cual  pagó muy puntualmente, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Perfecto lives in his parents' house with his wife and children on Inca Roca street in the Tacagua zone of La Paz city. He has a small photocopy store set up in rented space in the building of the technical college, Normal Superior de Estudios, in El Alto city. With this work he supports his family and can cover their basic needs. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy paper, ink, and other supplies necessary to run his business. Perfecto has been a client of Impro since 2007 and has worked with Kiva on a previous loan, which he repaid punctually in order to be able to access additional loans.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paper, ink, and other supplies for photocopy service

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es socia del Bancomunal Amigas Unidas.
Manuela es casada tiene 54 años, tiene cuatro hijos de 35, 25, 22 y 16 años que está en la escuela estatal. 
La casa de manuela queda al costado de varios talleres de  mecánica  siempre le solicitaban gaseosas, cerveza porque no hay  tienda cerca, ella vio la oportunidad de empezar a vender gaseosas y así fue empezando poco a poco, ahora tiene su bodega ha crecido y esta mas surtida. 
Manuela necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de gaseosa, cerveza, arroz, azúcar.
Desde que está en Finca, con los préstamos pudo invertir en su negocio y comprar una congeladora, también aprendió a ser sociable, porque era de pocas amigas.
El sueño de manuela es seguir creciendo en su negocio  de bodega.
texts.en:
Manuela is a member of Communal Bank "Amigas Unidas" (Untied Friends). Manuela has been married for 54 years, and has four children. They are 35, 25, 22, and 16 years old and the youngest attends a public school. Manuela’s house is near many mechanics shops. The workers wanted soda and beer, but there were no stores nearby. So Manuela took the opportunity to start to sell soda and beer. Now the workers always buy from her. She started off slowly, but now her business has grown to sell more than just selling soda and beer. Manuela needs a loan of $450 to buy rice, beer, soda, and sugar to sell at her store. Since she has been in the group Finca she has been able to get loans to invest in her business and she has also been able to make many new friends. She was also able to buy a freezer with a few of her friends. Manuela's dream is to continue to grow her business. (Translated by Elizabeth of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Manuela needs a loan of $450 to buy rice, beer, soda, and sugar to sell at her store.

loans.name: Maud

texts.en:
Maud O. is 30 years old. She is single and lives independently in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Nkawkaw is a busy commercial town in the region. She works hard to help herself.

She is a hair dresser by profession. Maud has graduated from apprenticeship and currently runs her owns shop. She says most of the women in her neighborhood call on her for her services, probably due to her ingenuity. She wants a loan to procure things such as lotions, creams, pomades, shampoo, etc. to improve upon her services to her cherished clients.

Maud has been in business for three years. It is her desire to be financially sound before she enters into marriage.

loans.use: Buy toiletries to support her business.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como taxi, actualmente es chofer asalariado y maneja una minibús pequeño ya que el vehiculo de su propiedad está en mal estado y  no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para poder pagar los gastos de reparación.
Vive en la zona de Pampahasi de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para mantenimiento completo del vehiculo.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con este crédito tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos y podrá trabajar con su vehiculo propio
texts.en:
Roger has a vehicle that he uses as a taxi, but currently is working as a salaried chauffeur and drives a mini bus since his own vehicle is in bad shape and he does not have the sufficient resources to pay the repair costs for it. Roger lives in a house with his parents in the Pampahasi area of La Paz. The requested loan will be used to completely repair his vehicle. This is the first time that Roger is asking for a loan with IMPRO, and with this loan he will have the opportunity to increase his income and to work as a taxi driver using his own vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs of repairing his taxi

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del Bancomunal Amigas Unidas. 
María es separada tiene 47 años, cuatro hijos de 27, 26,20 y 17 años, los mayores trabajan y los menores estudian. 
Antes María vendía gas en su casa, sus amigas la animaron a que vendiera ropa, ella vende ropa zapatos, lo que le pide  sus clientas. 
María necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para comprar mercadería ropa y zapatos, lo que le pidan sus clientas.
Desde que está en Finca, su negocio creció más, le gusta pertenecer al Bancomunal porque ve el apoyo entre compañeras ve solidaridad en el grupo. 
El sueño de María es tener un puesto  propio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Maria is an associate of the Communal Bank "Amigas Unidas" (United Friends). Maria is separated is 47 years old, four children of 27, 26, 20 and 17 years of age. Her older children work and her younger children go to school. Before Maria sold gas out of her house. Then her friends encouraged her to start to sell clothes. She sells clothes, shoes, or whatever her clients order. Maria needs a loan of $325 (1000 Soles), to buy merchandise. She says since she has been a member of Finca, her business has grown. She likes to belong to the bank communal because she sees the support among fellow members and there is a lot of solidarity in the group. Maria’s dream is to have an own spot in the marketplace. (Translated by Tucker of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of $325, to buy merchandise, clothes and shoes, and whatever her clients order.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra Francisca  es oriunda de la  ciudad de Roque Gonzalez. Ella tiene 4 hijos y  viven  en casa  propia. Ella es viuda y es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora. 

Ella tiene una pequena dispensa para vender cosas en su barrio, pero tambien ells se  dedica a  la cria, engorde y venta de carne de chancho. Lo lleva a la ciudad de Asuncion para vender al  por mayor  a  los supermercados.  Hace 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad y comenta orgullosa que con el  ingreso  generado de tanto  sacrificio y trabajo  ha  logrado dar  una muy buena educaciòn a todos sus hijos.

Con el credito  obtenido comprarà  cerdos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca is a native of the city of Roque Gonzalez. She has 4 children and she has a house of her own. She is a widow and a very hard worker and a strong woman. She has a small store that she uses to sell things in her neigborhood but she also makes a living by raising pigs. She gets them fat and sells their meat. She takes them to the city of Asuncion to sell them to the supermarkets for wholesale prices. She has been making a living by raising pigs for the past 20 years now. She is proud that she has made money to support her family by working hard and sacrificing. She has managed to give a good education to all of her children. She will use the loan money to buy pigs.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es socia del Bancomunal Amigas Unidas.
Lucila es conviviente tiene 49 años, dos hijos de 14 y 12 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Lucila siempre se dedico a su casa y al cuidado de su familia, pero hace cinco años la visitó una consultora de belleza y la animo a vender, explicándole el sistema de ventas le gusto y decidió vender productos de belleza por catalogo, actualmente lleva los productos a diferentes empresas y ofrece a sus amigas.  
Lucila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo.
Desde que está en Finca, ve que es un respaldo para invertir en su mercadería.  
El sueño de Lucila es suplir todas las necesidades de sus hijos, y tener un negocio,
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the Communal Bank "Amigas Unidas" (United Friends). Lucila lives with her husband and she is 49 years old. She has two children who are 14 and 12 years old. They both go to public schools. Lucila has always worked hard to keep her home nice and to take care of her family. Five years ago she decided to visit a beauty consultant and the consultant told Lucila about how great it would be if she started selling beauty products. The consultant explained the system of sales and Lucila liked it. She decided to sell beauty products through catalogues. At the moment she takes products to different companies and also offers the products directly to her friends. Lucila needs a loan $325 (1000 Soles), so that she can buy beauty products out of catalogues to sell. Ever since Lucila has been in the group Finca she has seen that investing money in purchasing more merchandise has helped her to grow her business. Lucila's dream, is to fulfill all the needs of her children and to have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lucila needs a loan $325 so that she can buy beauty products out of catalogues to sell.

loans.name: Bulenga Twekembe (A) Group

texts.en:
Olivia is a full time primary school teacher who runs a poultry business on the side. Oliva works at Bulenga Preparatory School teaching P5 and P6 English classes. The children in P5 and P6 are between 10 and 12 years old.

**
In Uganda, the education system is broken into four sections. There are seven years of primary education, four years of lower-secondary education, two years of upper-secondary education and then three to five years of post-secondary education.
**

Olivia began her poultry business to increase the money that her family has to operate with. In her job as a teacher, Olivia earns only 120,000 USH per month. This would not be enough to support her family, since she has 6 children ranging in age from one year to fourteen years. Although her husband also works in the market in Bulenga, five of their children are currently in private schools in the area and the total amount of school fees is very high.

Thus, Olivia began her poultry business. She has about 100 broiler chickens (the chickens that are raised to be eaten – as opposed to those that are raised for collecting eggs). Olivia buys these chickens when they are one day old and then sells them after 5 weeks. These day-old-chickens cost 1,300 USH and she can sell them for around 5,000 USH. During the fattening period, Olivia spends 35,000 USH per week on chicken mash. This means that she makes roughly 190,000 USH profit from each stock of chickens.

Olivia is requesting a loan of 300,000 USH to purchase chicken mash. She says that if she were able to do anything, she would open a nursery school in Bulenga. She would buy a plot of land and build three big classrooms.

loans.use: To purchase chicken mash

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Bancomunal Amigas Unidas.
Luisa es casada tiene 50 años, tres hijos de 29, 24 y 18 años, ellos trabajan.
Ella tiene familia en el norte y le animaron a  que vendiera  en Lima, así es  como empezó, ahora trae zapatos  del norte y los vende por docenas para algunas tiendas. Han pasado cinco años y le va muy bien. 
Luisa necesita un crédito de 1200 soles para comprar zapatos, sandalias de cuero que trae del norte del país.
Desde que esta en Finca, le va muy bien, lo préstamos le han ayudado mucho, y las charlas que ha recibido en el Bancomunal también.  
El sueño de Luisa es tener una tienda de zapatos.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Amigas Unidas Communal Bank. Luisa is 50 years of age and married. She has three children ages 29, 24, and 18, all of whom are working. Members of her family in the north encouraged her to try selling in Lima, so that's how she began. Now she brings shoes from the north and sells them by the dozen to various stores. She's been doing this for five years now and it's going very well. Luisa needs a loan of 1,200 Sols in order to buy shoes, leather sandals that she brings from the north of the country. Since she's been with FINCA Peru, things have gone well for her. The loans she has received have helped a lot, and the talks she participates in at the Communal Bank have also been helpful. Luisa's dream is to have a shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather sandals.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is thirty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. According to her, all of her children are currently in school – junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Afia works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is farmer.

Afia trades in secondhand clothes. She procures bales of secondhand textiles from Kumasi and Accra. She sells in the local market and hawks to sell as well. She wants a loan to procure more bales of textiles so she can trek to other markets to sell. She aspires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes

loans.name: Omowumi

texts.en: Omowumi R. is 30 years old, and happily married with three children. She lives in Igbo-elerinin, Lagos State, Nigeria. Omowumi sells foodstuffs in her shop and has been in this line of business for over five years. She is a client of Kiva partner, Lift Above Poverty Organisation (LAPO). Omowumi needs the loan amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She sends her thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and a grinding machine

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen F. is a 35-year-old divorcee. She lives with her three children in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw, a busy commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Ellen is a hairdresser by profession and has been in business for nine years. She graduated from her apprenticeship and currently runs her own hairdressing shop. Ellen says most of the women in her neighborhood call on her services. She wants a loan to buy products, such as lotions, creams, pomades, shampoo etc., to improve the services she offers to her valued customers. Ellen works very hard to support herself and her children and desires to be financially sound before she enters into marriage again. She would also like to sell plastic products to support her income.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing products

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en: Romoke A. is a 43-year-old married mother of four children and lives in Igbo-eleri, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs, a business skill she acquired from her mother. Romoke has been in business for the past ten years and has been borrowing from Kiva partner, Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO), for over two years. Romoke needs the loan amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She sends her thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Sheyi

texts.en: Sheyi A. is 50 years old and married with four children. Sheyi lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks, foodstuffs and tailoring materials and has been in this business for years. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and tailoring materials

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia’s main activity is agriculture and her family has 1.6 ha (approx. 4 acres) of arable land and she also has, in addition, 1.6 ha from a brother who has gone abroad. She has worked on these lands since 2001 and grows wheat, corn and sunflowers.

Lidia has a relative who has agricultural technique and who does the mechanized work. The manual work she does by herself. In some of the work, such as weeding, she is helped by her children.

The purpose of her loan is to purchase seed corn, mineral fertilizer and to pay for mechanized services.

loans.use: To purchase seed corn, mineral fertilizer and to pay for mechanized services

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret A. sells crates of eggs. She has been in the trade for over five years. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more crates of eggs to sell. Margaret is 28 years old and married with two children. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy thread and yarn

loans.name: Los Comerciantes De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal, “LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; son naturales del distrito de Andahuaylillas,  ubicado a 45 minutos en auto de la ciudad del Cusco.

Estos miembros son muy emprendedores y realizan diferentes actividades, en la mayoría de casos ellos se dedican a la compra y venta de semillas para sembrar en sus terrenos, tales como son (maíz, alfalfa, otros), otros socios especialmente las socias mujeres se dedican a la crianza de animales menores, (cuyes y aves de corral), uno que otro tiene diferentes negocios, cómo venta de CDs de música y películas,  la presidenta del grupo tiene una pequeña tienda y vende ropa; nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para poder invertir en la implementación de sus negocios y así poder producir más y continuar con el deseo de ver a sus hijos realizar sus sueños y apoyarlos en cada etapa de sus vidas.

Los socios del banco comunal, agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado, así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de su préstamo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank “LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS,” (Business people of Andahuaylillas) are from the district of Andahuaylillas, located 45 minutes by car from the city of Cuzco, Peru. These members are very hard-working and are involved in different activities. In the majority of cases they work selling and buying seeds ( such as corn, alfalfa and others), to plant on their land. Other members, especially the women, raise small animals (guinea pigs and poultry). A few have other businesses, such as selling music CD’s and movies. The president of the group has a small store and sells clothes. Our members are asking for a loan in order to be able to invest in the implementation of their businesses and thus be able to produce more and continue with the desire to see their children realize their dreams and support them at each stage of their lives. The members of the communal bank are thankful for and appreciate the loan being offered, and they commit themselves to following through with the payment of the loan in the time period allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of corn, seeds, and small animals

loans.name: Arowaji

texts.en: Arowaji bakes cakes and meat pies and sells shoes. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more baking items. She is 39 years old with three children. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking items

loans.name: Idiate

texts.en: Idiate is 35 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions and cosmetics and hopes to expand her business. She needs the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more provisions and cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Artene

texts.en:
Artene R. has an individual enterprise in Bratulei village, Nisporeni district. Artene's business is favorably located in the middle of the town, other competitors are not. He has been working for 4 months. Artene has 287 rooms with a surface of 2 square meters to conduct business. At the moment, he opened a hall of ceremonies and he can rent the hall for weddings. Since Artene has the space, he wants to open a food store and bar to expand his business. During the 4 months of activity Artene noticed that the wedding guests going to the stores nearby to serve coffee, tea, beer, and he got the idea of opening a shop-bar. 

Arten is photographed here before the repair of shop.

To open the store Artene needs to buy refrigeration display cabinets and cold foods. The goods will be purchased centrally from wholesale bases in Ungheni town and Nisporeni, from producers in the amount of 25-30000 lei. Monthly performance will be 35-42000 lei. 

Artene wants to thank Microinvest for the services and of course KIVA lenders.

loans.use: buying refrigeration display cabinets and cold foods

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame Y. is fifty-one years old and is married with four children. Three of his children are currently in school - senior-high and junior-high schools. One is under apprenticeship training. Kwame lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Nkawkaw, a commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. His wife is a trader.

Kwame is a farmer and runs a provision store in addition. He sells provisions such as milk, sugar, tea, bread, etc., in a wooden store. His store is located by the roadside. He obtains his goods from nearby cities and, sometimes, from the wholesalers in his community.

Kwame wants a loan to buy more goods to stock his shop. He desires to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To buy more goods to stock his shop

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson sells spiritual items such as candles, olive oil, incense, and Bibles.  She has been in this trade for years. Samson needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more spiritual items to sell. She is 35 years old and married with five children. She lives in Baale Street, Chemist Bus Stop, Igbo-elerin Lagos State, Nigeria. Samson says thanks to Kiva lender.

loans.use: To purchase more spirituals items to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is fifty–two years old. She is a married mother of six children. According to her, three of her children are still in school (junior high school and primary school). The rest are out of school and running their own businesses. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She says though her husband is employed, she still needs to work hard herself to help.

Rose deals in yam. She procures tubers of yam all the way from Yeji in the north and sells them to retailers in her community. She has been in business for two years. Rose also deals in vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, etc. She wants a loan to procure yam in bulk. She aspires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam in bulk

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. lives in Balogun Street, Aso Rock Igbo-elerin Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs. She has been in this business for the past two years, and she hope to expand her business to meet her customers' demand. Grace needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana G. is thirty-eight years old. She is a divorced mother of two children. According to her, her children are still in the basic school. She lives with her children in a family house in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She says a misunderstanding that ensued between her and her husband led to the divorce. She therefore works very hard to help herself and provide for the children.

Diana trades in yams and other vegetables. She procures tubers of yam all the way from Yeji in the north and sells them to retailers in her community. She has been in business for five years. Diana also deals in vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, groundnuts etc.

Diana wants a loan to procure yam in bulk. She aspires to give her children the best education and to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam in bulk

loans.name: Fafilat

texts.en: Fafilat is 40 years old and married with five children. She sells cooked foods and lives in Walebadejo Street, Igbo-elerin, Lagos State in Nigeria. Fafilat needs the loan amount of N50,000 to buy more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose B. is 38 years old. She is a married mother of two children. According to her, her children are still in school: one in junior high school and the other in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She says though her husband is employed, she still needs to work to make some income to support him.

Rose is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey. Kenkey is prepared from corn dough. It is served hot with pepper and fried fish. She procures the maize from farmers in the nearby villages. She sells on a tabletop by the roadside in the evenings. She has been in business for two years. Rose wants a loan to procure maize and other ingredients in bulk. She aspires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure maize

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia DIONICIA; es natural de la provincia de Urubamba, ella tiene 42 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene 5 hijos (20, 19, 12, 6, 2) años de edad.

La socia alterna sus labores domésticas con el comercio minorista, ella compra maíz y elabora una bebida, llamada “chicha”; nuestra socia también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes en número mayor a 20 los cuales los vende a los diferentes restaurantes de la zona. Nuestra socia aún tiene hijos menores que educar y alimentar, por lo que solicita el préstamo para incrementar su producción y de esta manera poder tener mayor ganancia.

La socia Dionicia, esta muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y se ratifica en el cumplimiento del pago total de la deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The member DIONICIA is originally from the Urubamba province. She is 42 years old, has a common law husband and 5 kids of ages 20, 19, 12, 6 and 2 respectively. This member has to alternate her retail job with her daily domestic chores. She buys corn and elaborates a drink called "chicha". Our member also raises more than 20 guinea pigs, which she sells to various restaurants of the area. Our member still has some underage children who she needs to educate and feed, which is why she is requesting a loan to increment her production and achieve a larger profit. The member DIONICIA is very thankful for your loan and confirms she will repay the debt within the pre-determined term.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sell corn and raise small animals

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S. is a 48-year-old mother of three children.  She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw, in the Eastern Region of Ghana, where her children attend junior high school and primary school.  Though her husband is employed, Victoria still needs to work to make some income to help support the family.

Victoria has been in business for twenty years, selling food items such as beans, onions, tomatoes and ‘gari’, a carbohydrate food made from cassava.  She procures the products from the wholesalers in her community and then sells from a table in the market square.  Victoria wants a loan to purchase more supplies in bulk to expand her business.  She aspires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure food ingredients

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria T. is thirty eight years old and is a married mother of four children. According to Victoria, her children are still in school. The oldest is in senior high school and the remaining are in junior high school and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Although her husband is employed, she still needs to work to make additional income to support the family.

Victoria is a food vendor that runs a ‘chop bar’. Chop bar is a restaurant where local dishes are mostly served. She sells local foods such as ‘fufu’ (from pounded cooked cassava), ‘banku’ (from cooked corn dough), and many other local dishes. She procures the items and ingredients from the wholesalers in her community. She has been in business for twelve years. Victoria would like a loan to procure more goods and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business. She aspires to give her children the best education she can afford to provide.

loans.use: To procure cassava, plantain and food ingredients.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida M. is 26 years old. She is the married mother of one daughter who is currently in primary school. She lives with her daughter and husband in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She says that though her husband is employed it is necessary that she work as well, in order to make some income to support him financially. 
Vida sells crates of eggs. She procures the eggs at cost-effective prices from poultry farmers in nearby villages. Vida then supplies the eggs to retailers and food vendors in her community. She has been in business for four years. Vida wants a loan to procure eggs in bulk so as to maximize her profit margin. She aspires to give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure crates of eggs

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. is sixty years old. She is a married mother of six children. All of her children are out of school and living independently. She lives with her husband and some grandchildren in a family house in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer. Vida works to make some income to support him financially.

Vida trades in foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava, etc., and fruits such as oranges. She procures the goods from the farmers in the nearby villages at cost-effective prices. Vida supplies the products to retailers and food vendors in her community. She has been in business for six years.

Vida wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to maximize her profit margin. She aspires to improve upon her living standard.

loans.use: To procure foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Lane Kuru Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu B., Mohamed K. and Yeabu S.. They named their group Lane Kuru, a Temne phrase for “Believe in God.” They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Makeni.

This is not the first loan this group has received from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans created meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They’re also feed and clothed themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans.

Today, they are requesting a loan of Le600,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Mohamed (middle) is the leader of the group. He is fifty-five years of age. He was born in Kamalo, forty-eight miles from Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman, and they have four children. All of his children are in primary and secondary schools. Mohamed sells tobacco.

With this new loan, Mohamed will expand his business. He will use it to buy more bales/heads of tobacco. Each bale is priced between Le300,000 to Le500,000.

So far, Mohamed faces no major challenges. Business is doing fine for him and he enjoys it. With this loan, Mohamed will feel good as he sees his business capital increase.

loans.use: Buy bales/heads of tobacco.

loans.name: Cielos Abiertos Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Cielos Abiertos esta integrado por 4 personas, las cuales se conocen desde hace años y han trabajado juntos tambien por muchos años. estas son las actividades que ellos realizan:
la Sra. Martires G. tiene 42 años de edad, ella vive en union libre con su compañero de hogar, con el cual tienen 5 hijos los cuales les ayudan economicamente para el sosten del hogar, ellos ya estan grandes, la sra Martires se dedica  a la venta de productos de la canasta basica como ser: arroz, azucar, cafe, pan, sardinas, leche, mantequilla, manteca, aceites, ella tiene su pulperia hace 6 años, su mayor sueño es montar un mercado.
El Sr. Santos Luis O. tiene 58 años de edad, esta casado y tuvo 10 hijos de los cuales todos ya se casaron y tienen su propia familia. el se dedica a la venta de materiales para hacer ladrillos y tejas, se dedica a esta tipo de negocio hace 4 años, para vender su producto se desplaza a las ladrilleras para vender el producto como ser tierra, agua que el acarrea en su carro y lo traslada a distintas empresas que fabrican este tipo de producto. cabe mensionar que este señor es reconocido en esta zona por ser muy humilde, cariñoso y trabajador.
La Sra. Magdalena O. tiene 24 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales una esta estudiando en la escuela, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y comidas como ser: enchiladas, tacos, pastelitos, yuca, carne asada, pollo frito y refrescos de botella. los fines de semana ella lleva sus productos hacia el campo de la comunidad donde siempre se realizan encuentros deportivos y los vende a los jugadores, hijos y esposas. su mayor sueño es poder apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien una carrera en la universidad.
la Sra. Eric R. tiene 30 años de edad, ella vive en union libre con su compañero de hogar con el cual tiene 3 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser: platanos fritos con frijoles, pan con frijoles y mantequilla, enchiladas, tacos, refrescos naturales, guineo verde frito con repollo.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus familias y sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group “Cielos Abiertos” (Open Skies) is made up of four people. They have known each other for many years and have worked together for much of that time. These are the activities that they participate in:

Ms. Martires G. is 42 years old. She lives in a common law marriage. She and her husband have five children who help them financially to maintain their home. Their children are now adults. Martires sells food staples such as rice, sugar, coffee, bread, sardines, milk, butter, lard, and oil. She has had a small store for six years. Her biggest dream is to open a market.

Mr. Santos Luis O. is 58 years old. He is married and has 10 children all of whom are married and have their own families. He sells materials to make bricks and tiles. He has been in this business for four years. To sell his product he goes to the brick and tile makers to sell materials like earth and water. He carries these materials in his car and drives to different companies that manufacture this type of product. This gentleman is recognized in this area for being humble, caring, and hardworking.

Ms. Magdalena O. is 24 years old. She is married and has two children, both of whom are studying in school. She sells candies and food such as enchiladas, tacos, pastries, yuca (a root similar to a potato), carne asada (grilled beef), fried chicken and bottled soft drinks. On the weekend, she brings her products to the field in her community where people always play sports and sells them to the players, children, and wives. Her biggest dream is to be able to support her children so that they can study at a university.

Ms. Eric R. is 30 years old. She lives in a common law marriage and has three children who are studying in school. She sells food such as fried plantains with beans, bread and beans and butter, enchiladas, tacos, natural sodas, and fried green bananas with cabbage.

All of these people need this loan to move forward with their families and their businesses.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beans, rice, sugar, coffee, chicken, butter, soda, eggs, juice, lard, oil, beef and pork, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, peppers, bananas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa N. is 45 years old. She is a married woman with two children. Both are currently in senior high school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

Adwoa works to make some income to support her husband financially. She trades in food items such as tomatoes, corn dough, pepper, etc. on a table top in the market square. She procures the goods from wholesalers in nearby towns at cost effective prices. Adwoa sells the products mostly to food vendors in her community. She has been in business for ten years. She wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to maximize her profit margin. She aspires to improve upon her living standard and support her children’s education.

loans.use: Procure food items to sell.

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Danelia M. se dedica hace 7 años a la venta de especias y condimentos, ella quiere comprar enchape de oro para vender ya que como ella vende su producto ambulante tiene la certeza de que el enchape lo puede vender muy bien en diferentes oficinas gubernamentales y privadas, los fines de semana se trasladas a diferentes comunidades, aldeas y caserios para vender su producto.
ella necesita el credito para poderlo invertir en este producto ya que ella el mes anterior tenia el dinero para comprar dicha mercaderia pero cuando viajo a Tegucigalpa la asaltaron y perdio todo el dinero que iba a invertir, ella es soltera y es madre de una hija la cual con su negocio le pudo dar estudios y alimentacion, su hija ahora es maestra y le ayuda economicamente.
texts.en:
Danelia M. has been selling spices and seasonings for 7 years. She wishes to buy gold plated products to sell. She already sells products in a mobile manner and is certain that the gold items will sell very well in different government and private offices.

On weekends she goes to other communities, villages, and small towns to sell her products. She needs this loan to buy these products. Last month she had the money to buy this merchandise, but when she traveled to Tegucigalpa she was robbed and lost all the money she was going to invest.

She is single and has one daughter. With her business she was able to provide education and food for her daughter. Now her daughter is a teacher and she helps her economically.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gold plated products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua G. is 44 years old. She is married and a mother of six children. According to her, three of her children are still in school – junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Nkawkaw, in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

She says, although her husband is employed, she still needs to work to make some income to support him.

Akua is a food vendor. She runs a "chop bar," a restaurant where local dishes are mostly served. Akua sells local foods such as ‘Fufu’ (from pounded, cooked cassava), ‘Banku’ (from cooked corn dough), and many other local dishes.

She procures food items and ingredients from wholesalers in her community. Akua has been in business for 11 years and wants a loan to procure more goods and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business. She aspires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Procure food items abd ingredients.

loans.name: Claudia Banessa

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia Banessa G. de 27 años de edad reside en el barrio San Antonio, ella vive en union libre con el señor Romel Ferrufino Umazor, con el cual han procreado dos hijos, los dos estan en el kinder, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 17 años, ella vive con su madre. ahora necesita el credito para poder salir adelante con su negocio y sus hijos ya que la situacion en este pais es muy critica y como esta actividad es la unica fuente de ingresos que tiene, pues necesita poder inyectarle capital para poder hacer que funcione.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia Banessa G. is 27 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio, she lives with Mr.Romel Ferrufino Umazor, her common law husband, with whom she has had two children both of which are in nursery school. She has been making a living for the last 17 years selling tortillas. She lives with her mother. She now needs the loan to be able to move her business and her children ahead, since the situation in the country is very serious. This is her only source of income and therefore she needs to inject capital into the business to make it work.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, lime, firewood,

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco  es del Barrio San Roque de la  ciudad de Carapeguà  vive en  casa  propia  y esta  casado con la Sra Cecilia  hace mas de 25 años  tiene  una  hija  que  ya  està casada.

Es propietario de un  pequeño taller de  zapaterìa que cuenta con todas  las  maquinarias para  frabricar calzados y  de esa forma  proveer  a los macateros de la  zona,  tambièn  comercializa acorde a pedidos.

El  cliente realiza esta actividad hace varios años, iniciando esta profesión en compañía de uno de sus tíos con quien anteriormente trabajaba, hasta que logro independizarse.

El crédito solicitado y al cual accedió lo utilizo para la compra de una  màquina de aparar.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco is from the neighborhood of San Roque of the city of Carapegua. He lives in his own house and is married to Mrs. Cecilia for more than 25 years. He has a married daughter. He is the owner of a small shoe shop, which has all the necessarry machines for the making of shoes and this way he supplies all the street vendors of the area. He also sell to special orders. This client has been in this business for several years, he started in this profession together with one of his uncles with whom he had previously worked, until he was able to go on his own. The requested and agreed upon loan was used for the purchase of a trimming machine.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
My name is Rizwana K. and my age is 32. I am a citizen of a city named Kot Radha Kishan, in Pakistan. I've got an 8th standard education. I couldn’t study more because of my family’s circumstances.

Actually our financial condition was not so good because my father was the only breadwinner of my family. He married me off to a person whose name is M. Naeem Akhtar who runs a grocery shop. I am a mother of one daughter and her name is Kashaf, and she is just two years old.

I operate a sewing clothes business. I do this work for my daughter because when she grows up I’ll admit her in an English medium school to get a good base.

I’ve successfully repaid my two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying for the third time to buy groceries for my husband’s grocery shop.

loans.use: Buy groceries for husband's shop.

loans.name: Akhtar Baqir Ali Group

texts.en:
Akhtar B. is the wife of B. A. who lives in a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan.  She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for 23 years. 

Akhtar’s husband has had a dairy business for five years.  He sells milk to shops and earns a profit.  Akhtar and her husband get up at 4:00 a.m. to get milk from the buffalo.  Then they pour the milk into pots.  Akhtar successfully repaid four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her milk selling business. 

Akhtar is the group leader.  Two other women are involved locally.  Shafqat Nawaz wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.  Majidan A. wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business.

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy a buffalo for milk selling business.

loans.name: Rashida M. Nazir Group

texts.en:
Rashida is a 58 year old married lady and a citizen of a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan, for the past 25 years.  

Her husband's name is M. N. who is a vegetable seller by profession.  He has been in this profession for the past 10 years.  Rashida is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter.  Both of her kids are getting an education.  Rashida prepares embroidered dresses to pay off the school fees of her kids.  

She successfully repaid four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying again for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her husband’s vegetable selling business.

She is the group leader of three another women from her locality.  Shahida wants a loan to buy medicines for her medical store.  Sharifan wants a loan to buy wood to sell.  Rasoolan wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan.  Loan funds will be distributed among group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy vegetables and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anwar M.ashraf Group

texts.en:
Anwar is a 39 years old married lady and a citizen of a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan, for the past 26 years.  Her husband's name is M. and he deals with animals.  He sells buffalos to people who order them.
