She is the group leader for another four women from her locality. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Zainab baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her dairy business. Jamila baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics and a hair dryer for her beauty parlor. Almay baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their dairy business

loans.name: Rajabmurod

texts.ru: Гулматов Раджабмурод житель города Яван . Возраст 43года иимеет шестерых  детей.Всю жизнь занимается животноводством. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит крупно-рогатый скот. Решил получить кредит для того, чтобы купить молодого бычка. Таким образом он увеличит поголовье скота и сможет развивать бизнес. Погасить кредит планирует в течение шести месяцев.
texts.en:
Rajabmurod G. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 43 years old and has six children. He has been involved in animal husbandry all his life. He owns a small farm where he raises cattle. Rajabmurod decided to obtain this loan in order to purchase a young bull. This will allow him to increase his cattle headcount and expand his business. He plans to repay the loan within six months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Hanifan Munga Masih Group

texts.en:
Hanifan baji is the wife of M. M. and they live in a city named Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan for the past 36 years. Her husband operates a dairy business. He has 6 years of experience in this business. Hanifan baji is a working lady. She owns a furnace and produces bricks. With the income she was able to marry off her daughter. Her son also works with her and they both easily manage the work and complete the orders of their customers. Her business is going well with the grace of God. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband’s dairy business.

She is the group leader for four other women from her locality. Bashiran baji and Safia baji and Zubaida baji and Hafizan baji each want a loan to buy buffaloes for their milk-selling businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their dairy business

loans.name: Salimon

texts.en: Salimon is 45 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lagos State in Nigeria. She sells frozen food. She has been in business for 15 years. She needs a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more frozen food to sell. Salimon says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Хушмахмадов Далер проживает в районе Файзабад. Возраст 23 года , женат и имеет двоих детей. Имеет средне-техническое образование,но по специальности не работает. Занимается животноводством. Планирует получить кредит и купить дойную , породистую корову. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Daler H. lives in the Fayazad district. He is 23 years old, married and has two children. He has a secondary-technical education, but does not work in his field. He is involved in animal husbandry. Daler plans to obtain the loan to buy a purebred dairy cow.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Vatan

texts.ru: Рахимов Ватан проживает в районе Файзобод. Возраст 45 лет, женат и имеет семерых детей. Имеет большую ферму , где разводит бычков. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы обеспечить животных комбикормом. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Vatan R. lives in the Fayzabad area. He is 45 years old, is married and has seven children. Vatan has a large farm where he raises cattle. He turned to us for a loan in order to provide the animals with feed.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace P. is currently in the business of selling greens and tomatoes and is requesting a loan to build a hotel. Grace is 49 years old and is married to a builder. She has six children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. These are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a hotel

loans.name: Rodica

texts.en: Rodica N.’s property consists of 0.88 ha of arable land and 0.90 hectares of vineyard. On the arable land, Rodica grows potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers for sale. At present, Rodica has purchased 700 kg of seed potatoes to plant during the arable period. She needs to buy tomato and cucumber seeds, film for her greenhouse, and more fertilizer. She obtained her first loan from Microinvest in 2007 of 60,000 MDL for a period of 12 months for the purchase of seed potatoes and fertilizer. The purpose of this loan is to purchase tomato and cucumber seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Rajabmurod

texts.ru: Алиев Раджабмурод проживает в районе Файзабад. Садовод со стажем. имеет большой сад . Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 44 года. кроме того работает в хукумате района. Женат и имеет девятерых детей. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы закупить фруктовые деревья. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rajabmurod A. lives in the Fayzabad area. He is a gardener with experience and has a large orchard. He has been in this business for 44 years, in addition he works in the city government. He is married and has nine children. He plans to take out a loan in order to purchase fruit trees.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit trees

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice P. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and flour and is requesting a loan to build a shop.  Alice is 49 years old and is married; her husband is an engineer. She has no children.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony sells shoes retail to his customers. He is 37 years old and single. The demand for his shoes is high and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. He would like a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more shoes to sell. He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
El señor Heriberto tiene 47 años y esta casado con la señora Benita de 46 años.  Cuentan con 2 hijos que estudian en el colegio.

El señor anteriormente trabajaba con sus padres en la compra y venta de mercaderías. Heriberto no cuenta con una profesión ya que solo el colegio terminó. Gracias a la experiencia que adquirió en las ventas y con los clientes que contaba pudo crecer pronto en el ramo a que se dedicaba (venta de guitarras).

Actualmente no cuenta con un local propio ya que se dedica a la venta directa. Posee varios clientes por la zona de Luque y alrededores.

Le gustaría  contar con un local propio mas adelante y que sus hijos terminen una carrera universitaria ya que el no tuvo la misma suerte, debido a que sus padres eran de escasos recursos.

El préstamo fue invertido en la compra de guitarras. arpas, sombreros etc.
texts.en:
Heriberto is 47 years old, and he is married to Benita who is 46 years old. They have 2 children who attend school. He used to work with his parents buying and selling goods. He does not have the education for a professional career. Thanks to his experience with sales and with his customers, he was able to quickly develop his own branch of sales. He sells guitars. He does not now have his own location. He deals in direct sales. He has various customers in and around the area of Luque. He would like to have his own location. He would also like for his children to get a college education. He was not lucky enough to go to college due to the limited resources of his parents. The loan will be used to buy guitars, harps, hats, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guitars, harps, hats

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace S. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to buy more onions, maize, etc. for sale.  Grace is 28 years old and has a husband that is a nurse. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy groceries for sale

loans.name: Ion

texts.en: Mr. Ion D. owns 0.48 hectares of arable land in Pelin village. Mr. D. is requesting a loan to buy seed potatoes to plant on the land he owns. In previous years, Ion cultivated cereals on land he farmed on lease from other villagers. Now he wants to grow potatoes because he believes this activity is more profitable than growing cereals. He has had this business for more than 9 years so he is very experienced in this field. The purpose of the loan is to purchase seed potatoes for sowing. The business is profitable due to a high demand for agricultural products.  In the future, Mr. D. plans to increase his arable area.

loans.use: To purchase seed potatoes

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria Y. is currently in the business of selling onions and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to open a shop. Victoria is 30 years old and is widowed. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for settlement.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a shop

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La señora Susana está casada hace 30 años con el señor Reinaldo Britez con quien tiene una hija de 12 años de edad llamada Daiana.

Anteriormene, como la parada de una empresa de transporte urbano se encontraba frente a su domicilio, doña Susana le daba de comer a los choferes. Como le iba muy bien decidió ampliar su negocio, y pensó anexarle, a la venta de comida, con una pequeña despensita. Pero para eso le hacia falta capital, por lo cual recurrió a la Fundación Paraguaya. La Fundación le otorgó el crédito y pudo abrir su pequeña despensita que todavia tiene en operacion hoy dia.

En la actualidad Susana, gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya, pudo ampliar su negocio, ahora ademas de vender artículos de primera necesidad como lo hacia desde un pricipio tambien comercializa sabanas colchas, fundas para almohadones etc.

Mas adelante piensa en ampliar más su stock en mercaderias ya que su cantidad de clientes se los exige.
texts.en:
Susana has been married for 30 years to Reinaldo Britez with whom she has a 12 year-old daughter named Daiana. Previously, since there was a stop for a bus company right across from her house, Susana sold food to the drivers. Since that was going well for her she decided to expand her business, and thought about adding a food store, with a small storage area. However, she lacked the capital for this and so she went to Fundación Paraguaya. La Fundación gave her the loan and seh was able to open the small store that is still in operation today. Currently, Susana, thanks to Fundación Paraguaya, was able to expand her business; now, in addition to selling basic necessities as she previously did, she also sells sheets, bedspreads, pillowcases, etc. In the future she is planning to expand her selection of merchandise even wider, since her client base now requires it.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yerba, noodles, sugar, rice, sodas, beer, oil, milk etc. to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 51 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells chickens wholesale and retail to her customers. She hopes to expand this business.She needs the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more chickens to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to sell

loans.name: Miguela

texts.es:
La señora Miguela enviudó hace un año y medio, tiene dos hijas que estudian en la facultad y la ayudan en el negocio.

La señora siempre trabajó en el mercado en ventas y su marido era empleado público.  Con mucho esfuerzo lograron montar un negocio propio en su domicilio en las inmediaciones del Mercado Municipal de la ciudad de Luque.  Actualmente cuentan con varios clientes generalmente empleados de los comercios vecinos.

Le gustaría que sus hijas terminen la universidad y que administren su propio negocio.   También alquila  salones comerciales en la parte del frente de su domicilio aprovechando la zona preferencial  al mercado municipal.
texts.en:
Miguela has been a widow for a year and a half. She has 2 daughters that are university students and they help her with her business.

Miguela has always worked in the market selling items and her husband was a public servant. Ms. Miguela worked hard to start her own business which she operates in a commercial space that is attached to her home. Her home is located next to the municipal marketplace in the city of Luque. Now they have many customers who are generally employees of the surrounding businesses.

She would like her daughters to graduate from the university and start their own businesses. She also rents commercial spaces that are located in the front part of her home. These commercial spaces are very desirable since they are located in the preferred zone of the municipal marketplace.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bread, oil, flour, eggs, shoes, pants, T-shirts, dress shirts

loans.name: Magnim

texts.fr: Etant une dame très dynamique Madame B. magnim s'est lancé très tôt dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques et de pagnes, le commerce de pagnes est un commerce qui est rentable à Lomé, elle fait son commerce dans le marché locale d’agoè et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Le stock de marchandises dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, c’est pour cela  qu’elle sollicite de WAGES son premier prêt pour acheter 04 cartons de crèmes, 02 cartons de pommades, 50 mèches et des pagnes. Elle est mariée et  à  01 enfant.
texts.en:
Being a very dynamic woman, Ms. B. Magnim soon got started in the commerce of cosmetics and pagnes (colorful West African cloth). Commerce in pagnes is a profitable one in Lomé. She works at the local marketplace of Agoè and supplies herself at the grand marketplace of Lomé. The stock of merchandise she currently has doesn’t allow her to satisfy the demands of her customers. That’s why she’s requesting her first loan from WAGES, so as to buy four boxes of cream, two boxes of ointment, fifty hair extensions, and some pagnes. She is married and has a child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and cloth for resale

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Pedro V. esta casado desde hace 26 años con la señora Josefina Cabrera con quien tiene dos hijos, ambos ya mayores de edad.

Pedro anteriormente se dedicaba al cultivo en chacras ya que es una persona del interior del pais. En un momento dado como sus ingresos ya no le alcanzaba decidio venir a la zona central y dedicarse a la macateria (venta ambulante), esto ocurrió hace aproximadamente unos 12 años.

Fue así que con el poco ahorro que tenía se compró una pequeña camioneta para asi poder transladar sus mercaderias al Chaco Paraguayo.  Fue asi que recurrió a la Fundacion Paraguaya para poder obtener capital para la compra de sus mercaderias.  Como le va muy bien ahora Pedro V. posee dos camionetas para poder satisfacer las necesidades de mas de sus 300 clientes chaqueños.

Muy pronto Pedro quiere comprar mas vehiculos ya que los dos vehiculos que tiene no le alcanza por la cantidad de demanda que tiene con respecto a los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro V. has been married to Josefina Cabrera for the past 26 years. They have two children together, both of whom are now adults. Pedro is from a rural area of Paraguay, and used to farm for a living. About twelve years ago, however, he realized that he just wasn't earning enough money, so he decided to move to the central part of the country and became a traveling salesperson. He used the little savings he had to buy a small truck to bring his merchandise to the Chaco (a vast, semi-arid region of western Paraguay). Then, he came to Fundacion Paraguaya looking for money to buy his merchandise. He has been doing very well: Pedro now has two trucks in order to meet the needs of his more than 300 clients in the Chaco. Soon, Pedro will buy more vehicles, since the two he currently owns aren't enough to fill the orders of all of his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes, apples, pears, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mèvi Sidéméto

texts.fr: Madame A. mèvi sidéméto  est une résidente du quartier d’agoè assiyéyé un quartier nord de la ville de Lomé, depuis 2005 elle a entamée le commerce de produits génériques, son stock de marchandises est complètement épuisé pour y remédier elle sollicite un second crédit de WAGES pour acheter 01 lot de produits génériques, ce crédit sera son second car elle a déjà obtenu un premier crédit qu’elle a très bien remboursé. Elle est mariée et ils ont 01 enfant à charge.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Mèvi Sidéméto is a resident of Agoè Assiyéyé, a district in northern Lomé. In 2005, she started doing commerce in generic pharmaceutical products. Her inventory is completely exhausted. To remedy the situation, she’s requesting a second WAGES loan to buy an order of pharmaceuticals. This loan will be her second one because she already obtained one before that was indeed repaid. She is married, and they have one child to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos, en la calle Eduardo Avaroa de la zona de Cotahuma de la ciudad de La Paz, percibe una renta de jubilada del magisterio. El crédito que solicita es para pagar la maestría de su hijo que egresó de la Universidad como doctor, ya que por el momento su hijo no trabaja y sus posibilidades de encontrar trabajo mejorarán al obtener la maestria.

No es cliente de Impro pero califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs Rosa lives in her own home with her husband and sons. They live in the Cotahuma Zone of La Paz. They receive rent from some retired teachers. The loan that is being requested is to put towards her son's masters in medicine. Her son cannot currently work but with this enhanced education it will be easier for him to get work and earn an income. She is not a client of Impro but qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Zoe Mullard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of a masters for her son, who is a doctor

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice S. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to buy nets for fishing. Joice is 18 years old and is married to a husband who is a nurse. She has 1 child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy nets for fishing

loans.name: Miel Plus Group

texts.fr: Rose M. a une petite boutique générale. Elle vend aussi des vêtements pour enfants ainsi que des pièces pour dames. Elle a été initiée dans les affaires par sa mère depuis 1993. Rose et sa mère vendaient des sacs de manioc de Mbuji-Mayi à Mweneditu dans la province du Kasai Oriental en RDCongo. Après son mariage en 1995, Rose relança son affaire en 1997 avec un capital de $150. De 2003 à 2006, Elle diversifia son affaire en ajoutant la farine de manioc, des patates douces, des oignons ainsi que des tomates. Elle retourna à Kinshasa en 2006 et ouvrit une petite boutique jusqu’aujourd’hui. Son rêve est d’aller elle-même acheter la marchandise à l’étranger pour ouvrir une grande maison d’habillement mixte. Elle a actuellement un capital de $450, son affaire génère un bénéfice de $ 200 par mois. Elle a 33 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants élèves dont l’âge varie de 3 à 15 ans. Deux de ses enfants vivent avec leurs grands parents et trois habitent avec Rose et son mari. Rose et son groupe ont bien terminé leurs crédits recus au mois de novembre dernier.
texts.en:
Rose M. has a small general store. She also sells clothing for children, as well as items for women. She has been shown how to do business by her mother since 1993. Rose and her mother use to sell sacks of cassava from Mbuji-Mayi to Mweneditu in the province of Kasai Oriental in the Democratic Republic of Congo. After her marriage in 1995, Rose reinvigorated her business in 1997 with $150 in capital. From 2003 - 2006, she diversified by adding cassava flour, sweet potatoes, and onions, as well as tomatoes. She returned to Kinshasa in 2006 and opened a small shop, which she still has. Her dream is to go herself to procure merchandise abroad, so as to open a big house of mixed apparel. She currently has $450 in capital. Her business generates a profit of $200 per month. She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of six children, students, whose ages vary from 3 to 14 years. Two of her children live with their grandparents, and three live with Rose and her husband. Rose and her group have settled the loans they obtained last November.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business by buying a sack of charcoal, a sack of rice, a 25-liter drum of palm oil, and 25 liters of refined vegetable oil

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Remedios

texts.es:
La señora Remedios vive en casa propia con su hijo en la calle Valentín Abecia de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz , la actividad que ella tiene es la venta de productos que contienen vitaminas alimenticias. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más productos y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos ya que con este negocio, el cual ella conoce muy bien, tiene mucha clientela y las posibilidades de aumentarla son muy buenas. 

No es cliente de Impro pero por su carácter social, experiencia en el negocio y el análisis de su flujo de fondos puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Remedios lives in her own home with her son on Valentín Abecia Street in the Alto San Pedro zone of La Paz. Her activities include the sale of food products that contain vitamins. The loan that she requests is to increase her capital and to buy more products. In this way, she will improve her income. Given that she knows the business very well and has a large clientele, the opportunities for growth are very good.

She is not a regular client of Impro, but because of her good social character, business experience, and her own cash flow analysis, she is qualified for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of products that contain vitamins for her clients

loans.name: Inspiration Plus Group

texts.fr: Ange N. a 40 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants âgés de 5 à 18 ans. Cinq d’entre eux sont élèves. Elle a comme activité principale 3 moulins, elle vend aussi de l’eau pure. Son capital actuel est de $500. Ange a diversifié son activité avec le prêt reçu. Elle a acheté comme prévu d’autres articles à revendre tels que les sacs à mains, les sous-vêtements ainsi que des pièces pour dames. Ange s’est lancée dans le monde des micros affaires depuis 1999 avec un moulin. De 1999 à 2008, avec une bonne gestion, un dur travail et le bénéfice généré, Ange est parvenue à s’acheter deux autres moulins. Ces trois moulins lui procurent un bénéfice de $ 130 par mois. En novembre 2008, Ange est devenue membre d’un des groupes de Hope. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une boutique d’habillement pour dames. Ange vend dans la partie nord-est de Kinshasa.Ange et son groupe venaient de terminer à payer totalement et à temps les crédits recus au mois de novembre dernier.
texts.en:
Ange N., age 40, is married and the mother of six children who are 5 to 18 years old. Five of them are students. Her main business involved three mills. She also sells pure water. She currently has $500 in capital. Ange has diversified her business with the obtained loan. As planned, she bought other goods for resale, such as handbags, undergarments, as well as items for women. She got started in the world of micro-business in 1999 with one mill. From 1999 to 2008, with good managing, hard work, and generated profits, Ange has managed to buy two other mills. These three mills bring in a profit of $130 per month for her. In November 2008, she became a member of one of HOPE’s groups. Her ambition is to open an apparels shop for women. She makes her sales in the northeast part of Kinshasa. Last November, she and her group had just finished repaying their loans completely and on time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To diversify her business by buying handbags, undergarments, as well as women’s items.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jérémie 3:16 Group

texts.fr: Josée N. est entrée dans le monde des micros affaires depuis 1980 avec un capital initial de $35. Sa première activité était d’acheter et revendre les différents savons. Elle les achetait dans une société de fabrication des savons dénommée « Marsavco » pour les revendre au marché. De 1980 à 1991, son affaire prospéra jusqu’à atteindre un capital de $700. La reforme monétaire et les pillages de 1991 en RDCongo avaient sérieusement affecté son affaire et causé une baisse. Elle relança l’affaire avec 65 cartons de différents savons jusqu’en 1997 quand les grossistes dans des magasins de Kinshasa commençaient à vendre aussi les articles en détail. Josée décida ainsi de cesser la vente des savons. De 1998 à 2003, avec un capital de $100, Josée commença à revendre du thé en cartons. Elle diversifia son activité en 2003 en ajoutant les babouches (flippers) en vue de croitre le bénéfice. Dans le souci de renforcer son affaire de façon permanente, Josée décida d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope RDC en décembre 2008. Son affaire est entrain de se stabiliser parce qu’elle réalise par semaine un bénéfice d’environ $70. Josée est âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 9 et 29 ans. Cinq d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Josée N. entered the world of micro-business in 1980 with $35 in capital. Her first business involved buying and selling different soaps. She bought them from a soap manufacturing company named Marsavco” to resell them at the marketplace. From 1980 to 1991, her business prospered, attaining $700 in capital. Monetary reform and the pillaging in 1991 in the Democratic Republic of Congo had seriously affected her business and caused a drop. She started up again with 65 boxes of different soaps up until 1997, when wholesalers in Kinshasa stores also started selling goods at the retail level. She therefore decided to stop selling soap. From 1998 to 2003, with $100 in capital, Josée started retail sales of boxed tea. She diversified her business in 2003 by adding babouches (slippers), with the goal of growing her profits. Wanting to bolster her business in an ongoing manner, she decided to join one of the HOPE RDC groups in December 2008. Her business is in the middle of stabilizing because she’s realizing weekly profit of about $70. Josée is 48 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, who range from 9 to 29 years old. Five of them attend school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mushrooms, peanuts, and caterpillars for resale in order to increase her capital and profits

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Juan Granier de la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como profesor urbano donde percibe un sueldo mínimo, por lo que para mejorar sus ingresos tiene un taller donde arregla celulares. El crédito que requiere es para comprar herramientas especiales para arreglo de celulares y estabilizar su negocio ya que tiene bastantes clientes.

El historial del cliente es muy bueno y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2007.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos lives at his parent's house at Juan Granier street, which is in the September 14th zone of La Paz. He works as teacher in the city where he makes a minimal salary. Therefore, he has a shop where he repairs cell-phones to improve his income. He needs a loan to purchase special tools to repair cell-phones and to establish his business because he already has plenty of clients. The client's credit history is very good and he can receive a new loan. He has been an IMPRO client since 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase special tools to repair cellphones

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes C. is 39 years old and married. She has 5 children who go to school. Her husband is a peasant. Alice sells groundnuts at the market and is requesting a loan so she can open up her own shop. She hopes to be able to pay her children’s school fees with the extra profits she earns as a result of receiving this loan.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non-governmental organizations) as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up a shop

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haythem is 24 years old and lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. He has owned a taxi van for five years. His clients can be anybody. He is an extraordinary taxi driver because of his punctuality.

Haythem started his taxi business to supplement his family’s income. In the beginning, he didn’t face difficulties. Now he is requesting his first loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua, which he will use to do maintenance work on his van and reduce his debts. In the future, he plans on starting a new business trading cars.

loans.use: Haytham will use the loan to do some maintenance work on his van and pay debts.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca vive en anticretico con su hija en la calle Poopo de la zona de Alto san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un puesto de jugos de fruta en la zona de Sopocachi, con esta actividad ella mantiene a su familia y puede cubrir sus necesidades primordiales. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más variedad de frutas y leche y poder mantener estable su negocio ya que la competencia le hizo bajar sus ventas, pero espera recuperarse en el menor tiempo posible.

El historial de la señora en Impro es muy bueno, además ya fue parte de Kiva durante el año 2008 y su historial de pagos fue muy bueno. Esto hace que pueda acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Ms. Francisca lives in Calle Poopo in the Alto San Pedro neighborhood of the city of La Paz. She has a fruit juice stand in the Sopocachi neighborhood. With this activity, she maintains her family and is able to pay for her basic needs. She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital, to buy a larger variety of fruits and milk, and to stabilize her business because the competition has caused her sales to go down. She hopes to recover from this quickly.

She has a very good history with Impro. In addition, she had a previous loan with Kiva during 2008, and her repayment history was very good. This has allowed her to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ramon Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of fruits and milk for her fruit jiuce business

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 42-year-old divorced man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Khalil has been selling chicken since 1993. He requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business. Khalil has been a micro credit client for six years now and has always paid on time. 
Khalil's previous loans helped him improve his business as well as his financial situation. His clients can be anybody from his region. Khalil decided on doing this business because of his high living expenses. In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana vive en casa propia con su esposo e hija en la calle Manuel Jofre de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, el esposo trabaja con un minibus de su propiedad, ella se dedica a la costura de enaguas (ropa interior de mujer) las cuales las acomoda cada semana en la calle Garita de Lima, lugar comercial donde se vende todo tipo de prendas de vestir de gente de pollera.

El crédito que solicita es para reparar su movilidad y que su esposo siga trabajando y le ayude con los gastos de la casa.

No es cliente de Impro pero por la actividad y el flujo de caja la califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Ana lives in her own home with her husband and daughter on Manuel Jofre street in the Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz. Her husband drives a minibus that he owns, and she makes a living sewing women's underwear, which she displays every week on Garita de Lima street, a commercial center where all kinds of clothing items are sold. The loan she is requesting will be used to repair the minibus so her husband can keep working and help with household expenses. She is not a client of Kiva partner Impro but her business activity and capital flow qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain and repair a minibus owned by her and her husband so he can keep working transporting passengers

loans.name: Ndidi

texts.en:
Ndidi sells foodstuffs like melon, beans, garri, etc. She has been in this business for a long.

She hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Ndidi is 30 years old and married with a child.

Ndidi says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en:
Joumana is a 46 year old divorced woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her two children.

She has owned a clothing shop for eight years. Joumana requested a loan $3000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop.

Joumana has been a micro-credit client for seven years now and has always paid on time. Her previous loans helped her improve her shop by diversifying her merchandise, as well as help her financial situation. Joumana's clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t have start up capital. She plans on expanding her shop.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formó con señoras del barrio Las Mercedes de Areguá quienes se enteraron del programa de la Fundación Paraguaya, gracias a unas vecinas que ya estaban trabajando en un comité denominado Las Mercedes. Todas las integrantes de este grupo se dedican a la alfarería, a causa de que es la actividad que mas destaca la ciudad de Areguá así como también la venta de frutillas, algunas de ellas aparte de la alfarería realizan y venden dulces.

Ellas utilizaron el préstamo para la compra de insumos tales como arcilla, pinturas y diferentes moldes. Cada una de ellas trabajan de forma individual, realizando y vendiendo sus productos, ya sea en sus propias casas, entregando sus productos a domicilio o incluso sobre pedido a los revendedores.
texts.en:
This village bank was formed by women in the Las Mercedes de Areguá neighborhood who found out about the group loan program offered by Fundacion Paraguaya thanks to some of their neighbors, who were already working with a village bank called Las Mercedes. Like many inhabitants of Areguá, all the group members are potters. Some also sell strawberries, while others make and sell sweets (in addition to making pottery). The women will use this loan to buy potting supplies like clay, paints, and molds. Each one of them works independently, potting and selling their wares. Some sell from home, others sell door-to-door, and others fill orders for intermediaries, who then resell the pottery.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clay, paints, and molds for different pots and clay figurines

loans.name: Asaad

texts.en:
Asaad is a 48 year old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. He has owned a grocery store for twenty nine years. Assad requests a loan of $1500 from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his store.

Asaad has been a microcredit client for ten years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his store by diversifying his merchandise and expand his stock, as well as help his financial situation. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Asaad first started his business, he didn’t have the start up capital. He hopes to improve his financial situation. In the future, Asaad plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La señora Nieves vive en casa propia con su esposo e hija en la calle 7 de agosto de la zona de Villa San Juan de la ciudad de La Paz, la actividad que tiene es la elaboración de arroz tostado con la cual ella y sus esposo mantienen su hogar y cubren sus necesidades de alimentación y de vestir. El crédito que solicita es para comprar mas materia prima y poder producir mas para vender en cantidad y mejorar sus ingresos.

La actividad y el carácter social hacen que pueda acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Nieves lives in her own home with her husband and daughter on Seventh of August street in the Villa San Juan zone of the city of La Paz. She makes a living making arroz tostado (literally "toasted rice", similar to rice cakes), and it helps her and her husband maintain their household and afford food and clothing necessities. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more raw materials (rice) so she will be able to sell a larger quantity of her product and increase her income. Her activity and her character make her qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice for her business.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 26 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. He sells and repairs mobile phones and phone accessories.

He requests a loan of $1500 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time Tarek has requested a loan.

Tarek is speciA. because he sells all kind of mobile phones and knows how to treat his clients. His clients can be anybody. When Tarek first started his business, he didn’t have the start up capitA.. He decided on doing this business because of his experience in the field. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 38 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. He has run a coffee shop since 2005.

Imad requests a loan of $700 from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his shop like “Narguileh” and coal. Nargileh (also known as “Shisha” in Egypt) is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. A water pipe is used to smoke fruit flavored tobacco. Nargileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East, and is beginning to gain popularity in the U.S, Europe and other countries.

This is the first time Imad has requested a loan. He is special in his work because his coffee shop is a nice and relaxing place. He knows how to treat his clients. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash and didn’t have a lot of clients. Now that he is known, his coffee shop has been doing better.

Imad decided on doing this business because he always wanted to open a coffee shop and he also wanted to improve his family’s financial situation. In the future, he plans on purchasing the shop.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia vive en casa de sus padres en la calle sucre de la zona de Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como empleada de limpieza en un centro de salud donde percibe el salario mínimo, que ahora es de 647.00 bolivianos. El crédito que solicita es para pagar la inscripción de su hija en un instituto para que pueda estudiar enfermería.

No es cliente de Impro pero por la actividad puede acceder a un crédito, además del carácter social del crédito.
texts.en:
Virginia lives in her parents' house on sucre street in the Alto Llojeto area of La Paz. She works as cleaning staff in a health center where she earns minimum wage, which is now 647.00 bolivianos. The loan requested will pay for her daughter's registration at an institute where she can study nursing. She is not a customer of Impro but the activity will help her to access a loan, in addition to the social nature of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Registration costs for her daugter to study nursing.

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en:
Itohan sells provisions and drinks. She hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

Itohan is 43 years old and married with five children. She lives in Benin city, Edo state, Nigeria. Itohan says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 45 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their six children.

Mahmoud has owned a grocery store since 2007, and has sold scrap metal since 1990. He requests a loan of $1500 from Al Majmoua to purchase a pick up for his businesses. This is the first time Mahmoud has requested a loan.

Mahmoud is special because he has two businesses and is doing his best to improve his family's financial situation. His clients are friends and neighbors for his store and traders of scrap metals. Mahmoud decided to open a grocery store because the scrap business didn’t allow him to have a good financial situation. When he first started the grocery business, he didn’t have a lot of clients. In the future, he plans on improving his business, as well as purchase land to start a third business.

loans.use: Purchase a pick up for his businesses.

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en:
Nizar is a 42 year old Man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. He has owned a phone shop for a year and a half. Nizar also sells recharge phone cards. He requests a loan of $2500 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase recharge cards. This is the first time Nizard has requested a loan.

Nizar is speciA. in his work because he has competitive prices. His clients can be anybody. When Nizar first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Purchase recharge phone cards.

loans.name: Claudia Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Claudia R. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de alimentos los cuales son preparados por ella misma en el mercado de León donde se dedica a laborar desde hace 15 años llevando el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Es importante destacar que la razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la materia prima ya que requiere de esta para así seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia R. is dedicated to the preparation and sale of food which she prepares herself in the market of León where she has been working for 15 years to support her household.

It is important to emphasize that the reason she has turned to Ceprodel is to be favored with a loan with which to purchase the premium ingredients that are required to advance her business.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of premium ingredients

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy sells clothes and foodstuffs.  She has been in this business for a long time.  Mercy hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more clothes to sell.  She is 48 years old and married with five children.  Mercy says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. He has been working in agriculture since 2007. Ahmad plants bananas and lemons.

Ahmad requests a loan of $1500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his business and rent an apartment. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

loans.use: Purchase tools for his business and rent an apartment.

loans.name: Doina

texts.en:
Doina’s main business is agriculture, a field she has worked in for more than six years. Last year Doina inherited six hectares of arable land from her parents, so she decided to work the land, believing this activity to be more profitable than growing cereals. The business is located in Cimislia district, where the demand for agricultural products is quite high even in the current economic crisis.

The married mother of two children, both pupils in the village lyceum, Doina is assisted in her business by the children, but takes very seriously her responsibility to support them and ensure their futures. To that end, she is now requesting a loan to purchase potato, tomato, eggplant, cabbage and onion seeds for sowing.

loans.use: Purchasing of vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 40 year old man who lives in Tyre, in Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Khalil has owned a fruit and vegetable shop since 2003. He sells all kinds of fruits and vegetables, depending on the season.

Khalil has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his shop. Khalil has been a microcredit client for four years and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him to diversify his merchandise and improve his financial situation. Khalil is special in his work because he has competitive prices and knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Khalil decided to start his business because he needed to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Khalil will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Ramona Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Ramona T. es una persona muy humilde el cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en su propio establecimiento en el mercado Central de la ciudad de León.

Ella se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y por eso lleva el sustento a su casa de habitación. Una de las necesidades que la señora Ramona atraviesa es que requiere de un crédito para la compra de las frutas y verduras y por este motivo ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando ser beneficiada y así salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ramona T. is a very humble person who sels fruits and vegetables at her own establishment in the central market in León. She stands out because she is a very hard worker which enables her to support her household. Ramona needs a loan to purchase fruit and vegetables and has therfore come to Ceprodel hoping to receive assistance and get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 52-year-old divorced woman who lives in Tyre, in Southern Lebanon. Nada owns a grocery store. She has requested a loan of $2000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise and diversify her stock. This is the first time that Nada has requested a loan.

Nada is distinguished in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she had difficulty finding the proper place to open her shop and find a cheap rent. In the future, Nada plans to expand her business.

loans.use: Nada will use the loan to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en: Dolly is 40 years old and is married with 6 children.She sells beef and she has been in this business for a long time.She sells her beef at the Oliha Market in Benin, Edo State, Nigeria. She is hoping for loan of of N80,000 to purchase more beef to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Marcia Elena

texts.es:
La venta de chinelas y sandalias es el negocio al que se dedica la señora Marcia L. en el mercado Central de la ciudad de León siendo este su único ingreso con el cual mantiene su familia.

Ella atraviesa la necesidad de obtener el capital financiero para la compra de las chinelas y por esto es que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio de venta de chinelas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marcia L. sells flip flops and sandals in the central market of León. This is the sole source of income to support her family. She needs to obtain funds to purchase flip flops and has come to Ceprodel to request a loan in order to get ahead in her business selling flip flops.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El presente comité es uno de los primeros formados en la oficina de Luque de la fundación, el mismo se encuentra en el décimo ciclo del programa del comité de Mujeres y esta integrado por señoras que fueron invitadas por unas amigas quienes ya pertenecían a un comité de un barrio vecino. Actualmente se encuentra integrado por 17 señoras quienes invirtieron en diversas actividades.

La señora Francisca Giménez se dedica a la cantina de una escuela e invirtió el dinero en la compra de jugos, gaseosas e insumos para la venta de comestible en su cantina 

La señora Edith Mabel O. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderias para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Mercedes A. se dedica a la venta de electrodomesticos e invirtió el dinero en la compra de los mismos  para su venta posterior.

La señora Marçia Isabel O. se dedica a la venta de dulces invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Mirtha A. se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la realización y venta de los mismos.

La señora Elsa A. se dedica a la herbosteria e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para empaquetar y vender sus hierbas medicinales.

La señora Larissa González se dedica a la venta de cosméticos e invirtió el dinero en la compra de sus productos para su venta para surtir su negocio.

La señora Blanca P. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercederias para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Liz Rossana M. se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos al pasa la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora Hilaria Báez se dedica a la venta de comestible e invirtió su dinero en la compra de insumos al pasa la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora Lilia Rosa C. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió su dinero en la compra de mercederías al por mayor para su venta posterior.

La señora Miguela R. se dedica a la venta de frutas e invirtió su dinero en la compra de frutas para el incremento de sus negocio.

La señora Luz Adriana M. se dedica a la venta de mercería e invirtió su dinero en la compra de mercaderías al por mayor para su venta posterior.

La señora Lidia Cañiza se dedica a la venta de cosméticos e invirtió el dinero en la compra de sus productos para su venta para surtir su negocio.

La señora Juana P. se dedica a la venta de bebidas e invirtió el dinero en la compra gaseosas y cervezas para la venta de los mismos.

La señorita katherine González se dedica a la venta de bijouterie e invirtió el dinero en la compra de bijouterie para lña venta de los mismos.

La señora Nidia A. se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y golosinas e invirtió el dinero para la compra de insumos para la realización de los comestible.
texts.en:
This village bank is one of the first formed in the foundation office in Luque. The Women’s committee is in its 10th loan cycle, and it members are women who were invited by friends who already belongs to a neighboring village bank. Today there are 17 women who invested in various businesses. Mrs. Francisca Giménez runs the snack bar at a school and invested the money in buying juices, soda pop and food to sell in her snack bar. Mrs. Edith Mabel O. sells clothing and invested the money in buying merchandise to increase her sales. Mrs. Mercedes A. sells small domestic electrical appliances and invested the money in buying inventory for future sales. Mrs. Marcia Isabel O. sells candy and invested the money in buying inventory to increase her sales. Mrs. Mirtha A. sells fast food and invested the money in buying ingredients to make and sell her food. Mrs. Elsa A. sells herbal remedies and invested the money in buying inventory to package and sell her herbal medicines. Mrs. Larissa González sells cosmetics and invested the money in buying products to stock her sales business. Mrs. Blanca P. sells clothing and invested the money in purchasing merchandise to increase her sales. Mrs. Liz Rossana M. sells food and invested the money in buying ingredients to make an d sell her food. Mrs. Hilaria Báez sells food and invested the money in buying ingredients to make and sell her food. Mrs. Lilia Rosa C. sells clothing and invested her money in buying merchandise at wholesale to later sell. Mrs. Miguela R. sells fruit and invested the money in buying fruit to increase her business. Mrs. Luz Adriana M. sells general merchandise and invested the money in buying merchandise at wholesale to then resell. Mrs. Lidia Cañiza sell cosmetics and invested the money in buying products to stock her business and then sell. Mrs. Juana P. sells beverages and invested her money in buying soda pop and beer to sell. Mrs. Katherine González sells decorative items and invested the money in buying decorative items to sell. Mrs. Nidia A. sells fast food and snacks and invested the money in buying ingredients to make her food.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy items for use in each member's business

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 38-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in Southern Lebanon. Fouad has owned a cassette and CD shop since 2001.

Fouad has requested a loan of $1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his work. Fouad has been a microcredit client for seven years and has always paid on time. His previous loans have helped him to improve his business, as well as his financial situation. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Fouad chose his business because of his experience.

loans.use: Fouad will use the loan to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Virginia Judith

texts.es:
La señora Virginia A. es una dama que habita en la ciudad de León donde labora a diario con el propósito de brindarle las mejores condiciones a sus hijos para que se desarrollen.

Hoy en día ella ha iniciado a reconstruir su vivienda por el motive de que ha estado deteriorada y require brindarle las mejores condiciones a sus hijos. Por este motivo al haber iniciado la obra de construcción detuvo la construcción para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como bloque sólido, arena, cemento, hierro, entre otros para dar lugar a la construcción y así brindarle las mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia A. lives in the city of León where she works daily with the goal of providing her children with the best conditions possible for their development. Recently, she has begun rebuilding her home, as it had deteriorated and she needs to provide the best conditions for her children. For this reason, having already begun the construction, she stopped to request a loan for the purchase of construction materials such as concrete blocks, sand, cement, iron, etc. in order to proceed with the construction and be able to provide the best possible living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick sells spare parts for machines to his customers. He loves this business because he makes lots of profit from it. He is hoping for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more spare parts to sell. He is 36 years old and is married with 2 children. He says "thanks" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more machine spare parts to sell

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
Doña María Pilar se ha destacado en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de León siendo una excelente cocinera el cual vende alimentos y en especial baho que es una comida que prepara con mucho empeño teniendo muchos clientes en su localidad.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel hoy en día es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para preparar los alimentos. Por esta razón espera muy confiadamente en Ceprodel quien le brindará el crédito.
texts.en:
Dona Maria Pilar stands out in Leon's Mercado Central because she's an excellent cook, her food being in much demand from customers in the area and especially her "baho" [traditionally made with meat and yucca], a dish that takes a lot of effort to make. She's applied for a loan from Ceprodel so that she can buy basic ingredients to make her dishes. She very much hopes that Ceprodel will grant the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic supplies for food business.

loans.name: Zalia

texts.fr: Mariée à un monsieur qui est un chauffeur, elle a 03  enfants et elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè atchanvé au nord de la ville de Lomé, elle exerce comme activité le commerce de céréales comme le maïs, l’haricot et l’arachide, elle a débuté ce commerce en 2002 mais récemment elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de jus. Mais actuellement, le stock de céréales dont elle dispose est épuisé, ayant déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu’elle a remboursé sans aucun problème, elle s’adresse à WAGES une deuxième fois pour obtenir un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 4 sacs de maïs, 03 sacs d’arrachide et 02 sacs d’haricot.
texts.en:
Married to a gentleman who is a chauffeur, this is a woman who has three children and who lives with her family in the Agoè Atchanvé district in the north of the city of Lomé. Her work involves commerce in grains, such as corn, beans, and peanuts. She started in this business in 2002, but recently she added to her business the sale of juices. Right now, the stock of grain she has is exhausted. Having already been the recipient of a WAGES loan, which she repaid without any problems at all, she is inquiring with WAGES a second time to obtain a loan that will enable her to buy four sacks of corn, three sacks of peanuts, and two sacks of beans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, beans, and peanuts

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana Cecilia siempre ha sido comerciante, es su forma de vivir, y a traves de esta actividad ha podido  darle estudios a sus hijos.
Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 1990 su padre fue el que le ayudó poniéndole un negocio de comida en un puesto ambulante, posteriormente le ofrecieron poner la cafeteria del Colegio en donde actualmente se encuentra, ya que el local tiene acceso al Colegio para atender a los alumnos y tiene acceso a la calle, para atender a clientes externos del colegio.
Su negocio  ha ido progresando  desde que inicio a la fecha ya que  compro una camioneta, y con ella empezó a sutir más el negocio, y con las ganancias pudo comprar otra camioneta, actualmente ya tiene dos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $5300 para comprar materia prima para la temporada de semana santa, es cuando  incluye platillos de cuaresma  para llevar.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia has always been a businesswoman. It's her way of life and, thanks to her business, she's been able to educate her children. She started in March 1990, setting up a food vending business with help from her father and selling on the street, at first. Later, she set up a cafeteria in a school where she operates now. The cafeteria can be reached from both inside the school so that she can serve the school's students and from outside so that she can serve people coming in from the street. Her business has grown steadily from the start. She bought a small truck so that she could better supply the business and, with the earnings, she was able to buy another truck so that she now has two.

She needs a MXN$5300 loan to buy supplies for Semana Santa.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Olga María

texts.es:
A la edad de 27 años, la joven Olga M. se dedica a laborar en su negocio de venta de bisuterías como lo son colas, peines, peinetas, espejos de mano, entre otros. Estos productos son ofrecidos por ella misma en su establecimiento en el mercado central de la ciudad de León.

Hoy en día ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de la mercadería. Espera muy confiadamente que su crédito sea otorgado para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y adquirir a lo inmediato la mercadería.
texts.en:
At the age of 27, the young Olga Martinez is dedicated to work in her business of selling costume jewelry, pony tails, combs, clips, and hand mirrors as well as many other things. These products are offered by her in her establishment in the central market in the city of Leon.

She is asking for a loan from Ceprodel so that she will be able to buy merchandise. She is waiting very confidently to be given the loan because she know it will better the conditions of her business and help her to acquire new merchandise immediately.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Costume Jewelry

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes O. is fifty-two years old. She is married and has three children. All of her children are in junior high or primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

O.’s husband is a farmer. She is also a farmer and a trader as well. She trades in onions. O. buys bags of onions from Kumasi and sells the onions in the local market square. She also treks to sell her goods in other markets. She has been in business for one year.

Agnes wants a loan to buy onions in bulk to be able to reach out to more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to high school levels.

loans.use: To buy onions in bulk

loans.name: Amparo De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, la señora Amparo G. se dedica a su actividad de venta de comestibles como lo son galletas y confites siendo vendidos por ella misma a la intemperie y en ocasiones ambulantemente.

A pesar de que su actividad es muy agitada, ella siempre dedica su tiempo a trabajar arduamente y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel ya que requiere la compra de los productos y para ello ha solicitado un crédito para obtener dichos productos que requiere con urgencia.
texts.en:
In the city of Leon, Amparo Gonzalez operates a business selling, among other things, snacks and confectionery. She works in all kinds of weather, sometimes as a street vendor. Despite the hectic pace of the work, she always keeps at it, day and night. She's approached Ceprodel because she urgently needs to buy more products to sell and she's applied for a loan to get them.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Reconnaissance Plus Group

texts.fr: Josée L. vend en détail la farine de maїs, du riz ainsi que du petit poids. Son capital actuel est de $230. Elle a commencé son affaire avec un capital initial de $ 30 qui lui avait permis d’acheter 1 sac de maїs en 1991. De 1991 à 1997, son affaire a prospéré en augmentant le nombre de sacs à 20 totalisant un capital de $600. En 1998, elle tomba sérieusement malade de la fièvre typhoïde et de la malaria qui causèrent une baisse très sensible de ses activités réduisant son capital à $100. Elle  les relança pendant la même année en achetant 1 sac de manioc, de maїs ainsi qu’un bidon de 20 litres d’huile de palme. De 1998 à 2008, Josée travaillait avec détermination et une bonne gestion jusqu’à intégrer l’un des groupes de Hope dénommé « Reconnaissance » en février 2008. Aujourd’hui, Son affaire génère $40 de bénéfice par semaine. Josée a 57 ans, veuve et mère de 9 enfants âgés de 14 à 39 ans dont quatre sont déjà indépendants, trois font des activités commerciales et deux sont élèves. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un dépôt de maїs pour revendre aux détaillants et un service de location des chaises. C’est le bénéfice généré de ses activités qui nourrit et supporte sa famille. Ses activités sont localisées dans la partie Est de Kinshasa.
texts.en:
Josée L. retails maize flour, rice, and peas. Her present capital is at US$ 230. She began her business with an initial capital of US$ 30 which allowed her to purchase 1 sack of corn back in 1991.

From 1991 to 1997, her business prospered, increasing the number of sacks to 20 representing a total capital of US$ 600. In 1998, she contracted a bad case of typhoid fever and malaria, which caused a noticeable reduction in her business activities, reducing her capital to US$ 100.

She got going again during the same year, buying 1 sack of manioc and some maize, as well as a jerry can of 20 liters of palm oil. From 1998 to 2008, Josée worked with determination and good management, and at that point she joined one of the groups of HOPE, a group called « Reconnaissance » (recognition) in February 2008. Today, her business is generating US$ 40 in profit per week.

Josée, 57, is a widow and the mother of 9 children, aged between 14 and 39, of whom four are already independent, three are engaged in commerce, and two are students. Her ambition is to open a maize depot so as to be able to sell to other retailers and also a business renting out chairs. It is the profit generated by her businesses that feeds and supports her family. Her businesses are localized in the Eastern district of Kinshasa.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital by buying 5 sacks of maize

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena F. is forty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to six children. She says that some of her children are in senior high school and others are in junior high and the primary schools. She says that she works to make some income to support her husband financially and to take care of her family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband pastors a church.

Abena deals in all kinds of textiles – shirts, shorts, pants, etc. She deals mostly in children's clothing. Abena buys the goods in Kumasi and hawks them (sells them door-to-door) in her community. She also treks to villages to sell.

Abena has been in business for thirteen years and wants a loan to buy more bales of textiles. She hopes to improve her living standards and sponsor her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia PAULINA; Es natural de Urubamba, ella tiene 60 años de edad, y 1 hijo de 27 años; ella es madre soltera y ha educado a su hijo sola, ella tiene una casita frente a las rieles del tren, este tren va de Urubamba a Ollantaytambo, su distrito se llama Ayllupampa, es una zona muy cálida y benigna.

La socia comparte entre sus labores del hogar con la atención de su pequeña tienda a la que le puso de nombre “VLADIMIR”, como su hijo; ella a su vez mantiene un terreno en el que siembra (maíz, habas, verduras), que fue herencia de sus padres, nuestra socia es una mujer muy valiente, fuerte y llena de mucha energía, ella tuvo una vida muy dura desde su niñez, pero nada de eso la dejó caer ni por un solo instante, ella fue y es muy constante en sus decisiones, sacó adelante a su hijo y ahora está muy feliz por que su hijo está a punto de graduarse de la universidad nacional de la carrera profesional de matemáticas,  para lo cual necesita hacer su última inversión en los pagos que requieren el título profesional y su fiesta de recepción; también comprará las nuevas semillas y el abono para una nueva etapa de cultivos.

La socia Paulina, está muy agradecida con el apoyo brindado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su préstamo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Partner PAULINA is from Urubamba. She is 61 years old, and has a 27 year old son. She is a single mother and has educated her son alone. She has a little house in front of the railroad tracks. The train runs from Urubamba to Ollantaytambo. Her district is called Ayllupampa, and is very warm and mild.

She shares her time between housework and working in her little store that she named "VLADIMIR", after her son. She maintains a piece of land that she sows (corn, beans, vegetables), that was inherited from her parents. Partner Paulina is a very courageous woman, strong and full of energy. She has had a hard life since childhood, but nothing has caused her to falter for even an instant. She is and always has been constant in her decisions. She pushed her son to succeed and is now very happy because he is about to graduate from the national university with a degree in math. She needs to make a final investment to pay the fees required for his degree and his reception party. She will also buy new seeds and fertilizer for a new stage of crops.

Partner Paulina is very grateful for the support and pledges to repay the total amount of her loan in the specified period.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds, her son's graduation.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria M. como mujer nicaragüense se dedica a laborar arduamente en su negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos los que son comercializados por ella misma y elaborados con la más alta calidad por tener ella amplia experiencia en la cocina.

Es importante destacar que ella ha logrado mejorar su situación económica y hoy en día espera en que Ceprodel le brinde un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así continuar mejorando su negocio de venta de alimentos.
texts.en:
Candeleria Membreno, a Nicaraguan woman, works hard at her business making and selling food. She sells what she makes, food made with the utmost care and with wide experience of the kitchen. It's important to point out the strides she's made to improve her economic situation and she now hopes that Ceprodel will provide a loan so that she can buy basic supplies to make her dishes and continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic supplies for food business.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.fr: A. latifa a appris la couture, elle a ouvert un atelier qu’elle a appelé « COUTURE INTELLECT », elle a eu la brillante idée d’y associer le commerce de pagnes ce qui a agrandi son chiffre d’affaire, elle utilise aussi ces pagnes pour confectionner des modèles d’habits qu’elle revend à ses clientes. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1990.elle est une vieille cliente de WAGES et à déjà obtenu 02 crédits, elle sollicite chez WAGES un troisième crédit avec lequel elle pourra augmenter son stock avec 10 pièces de pagnes. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè humbi au nord de Lomé.
texts.en:
A. Latifa learned to sew and opened a little workshop which she calls « COUTURE INTELLECT ». She had the brilliant idea of incorporating the sale of lengths of African print cloth ("pagnes") which increased her turnover. She also uses these "pagnes" to make clothing that she sells to her clients.

She began her business in 1990. She is a long-time client of WAGES and has already received two loans. She is asking for a third loan from WAGES, intending to add 10 lengths of "pagne" to her stock. She is married and the mother of 2 children; she lives with her family in the Agoè Humbi district in the north of Lomé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing "pagnes"

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Frnacisco inició el negocio para tener más ingreso ya que con el sueldo que gana en su otro trabajo no completa con los gastos de la casa. Comenzó el negocio en Julio de 1999 inicio el negocio con un préstamo que le hizo su mamá, quien también se dedica a la venta en mercados ambulantes, con eso empezó el a vender  aparatos electricos.

Actualmente le ha ido bien ya que se ha incrementado su inventario, y tiene más mercancia, pudo comprar una camioneta, que es indispensable ya que los mercados en donde se instala son ambulantes y la necesitaba para trasladar su mercancia sin que se le maltrate.

El necesita un prestamo por MXN $6,000 para comprar mercancia y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisco started his business to have more income since the pay that his other job gave him did not pay for all of the expenses of his house. He started the business with a loan that his mother gave him in July of 1999. His mother makes a living by selling at traveling markets. His business specializes in the sale of electrical appliances.

The business is doing well since its inventory has increased, it has more merchandise, and Francisco could buy a small truck, that is indispensable since he has to transport his merchandise to various marketplaces without mistreating it.

He needs a loan by $425 to buy merchandise and to be able to continue with its business

(Translated by Tyler of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena B. is forty-five years old. She is married and has three children, two sons and a daughter. Two of her children are in junior high and basic school. Her husband is a farmer; she is a trader. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Abena trades in maize. She buys bags of maize from farmers in the nearby villages and sells the maize to food vendors at the local market. She also distributes to retailers. Abena has been in this business for five years and wants a loan to buy the maize in bulk so she can supply more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: María Mercedees

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León la señora María Mercedes Q. se dedica arduamente a su actividad de venta de ropa la cual atiende en su establecimiento teniendo sus vitrinas y un lugar muy bien acondicionado que ha logrado suplir gracias a sus esfuerzos.

Es de importancia destacar que ella se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y hoy en día la razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la ropa y de esta forma continuar mejorando su negocio en su local.
texts.en:
