In the city of Leon, Maria Mercedes Q. works hard operating a business selling clothing. She operates the business from a shop with display cases, a space that's been well fitted out thanks to her efforts. It's important to note that she stands out as an especially hard-working woman. She's approached Ceprodel to ask for a loan so that she can buy clothing and, in that way, continue to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Yadira C. se dedica a su actividad de venta de bebidas las cuales comercializa en su localidad en la ciudad de León donde labora arduamente todos los días por el motivo de llevar el sustento a su hogar.

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de sus productos y es por esta razón que espera ser beneficiada con un crédito porque le urge la compra de las bebidas para comercializarlas y así mejorar su nivel de vida en su localidad.
texts.en:
Yadira Chavez sells drinks in her neighborhood in the city of Leon, where she works hard every day to support her family. The reason that she has approached Ceprodel is that she hopes to receive a loan to buy a wider variety of beverages for her store so that she can increase sales and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Madame Amy D. a son propre entreprise ou elle vend de céréales locales depuis 5 ans.  Elle fait son activité à Diourbel, une petite ville rurale à 150 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.  Avec ce premier crédit, elle va acheter des céréales pour vendre et elle va utiliser les revenus pour aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille et de soutenir leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amy D. has her own little business where she has been selling local cereals for 5 years. She works in Diourbel, a little rural town 150 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. With this first loan, she is going to buy cereals to re-sell and she plans to use the income to help her husband support the family and cover the expenses of their children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local cereals

loans.name: Teofilo Elio

texts.es:
Teofilo F. es un caballero muy esforzado el cual labora arduamente con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia por medio del mejoramiento de su vivienda por lo que ha iniciado la remodelación de su casa de habitación.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta manera dar por finalizado su reconstrucción de su vivienda y así junto con su familia tener un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Teofilo F. is a hard-working man who struggles every day to bring home enough money to support his family. He's started a project to remodel his house so that he can make their lives more comfortable. He's approached Ceprodel to apply for a loan so that he can buy construction materials which he will use to finish the remodeling, a project that will help him give his family a decent place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank A. is twenty-two years old. He is a single young man who lives with his brother. He says that, as a young man, he needs to work very hard to make some income and investments before he marries. He lives with his elder brother in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Frank deals in mobile phones and phones accessories, such batteries, housing, key pads, etc. He buys from dealers in Kumasi and sells in a showcase at the local market. He also treks to markets in nearby communities to sell. Frank has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy more goods to stock his business. He hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy phones and accessories

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un maçon de formation, mais comme il ne trouve pas régulièrement de chantier il s’est lancé dans une autre activité qui est la fabrication de claustras, balustre et de pots de fleurs en vue de la revente, cette activité lui rapporte beaucoup en dehors de la maçonnerie, mais actuellement il ne dispose pas de ciments et de sables et de barres de fer suffisant pour fabriquer ses produits. Il demande à WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 2 tonnes de ciments, 25 m cube de sable, 50 barres de fer de 8 et 2 barres de 6. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who is a mason by training. But since he is not finding regular places to work, he got started in other work, making screens and trellising, balusters, and flower pots for resale. This businss brings in a lot, aside from his masonry. But right now, he lacks sufficient cement, sand, and iron rods to make his products. He's asking WAGES for his first loan to buy two tonnes of cement, 24 cubic meters of sand, fifty #2 iron rods, and two #6 iron rods. He is married and the father of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, and iron rods

loans.name: Ndaga Beye

texts.fr: Madame Ndaga Beye M. est une femme mariée qui vend des bijoux et des vêtements prêt à porter pour enfants à Diourbel,  une petite ville rurale à 150 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.  C’est son premier crédit, et elle va l’utiliser pour reconstituer son stock de marchandises pour mieux servir les clients dans le quartier.  Avec les revenus de son entreprise, elle soutient sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndaga Beye M. is a married woman who sells jewelry and ready-to-wear clothing for children in Diourbel, a small rural city located 150 km from Dakar, the capital of Sénégal. This is her first loan. She's going to use it to replenish her stock of merchandise in order to serve her customers better in the area. With these revenues from her enterprise, she supports her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To jewelry and ready-to-wear clothing for resale

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba A., age thirty-five, is a married mother of four children, two males and two females. According to her, all of her children are in junior high and the basic school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

Abiba works very hard to support her husband financially and to help him to provide for their family. She runs a grocery store in her community. She also sells vegetables on a table top in front of her store. Abiba has been in this business for four years and wants a loan to buy more goods. She hopes to sponsor all her children to the tertiary level of education.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh F. est un éleveur qui élève des moutons et les revend au marché hebdomadaire.  Il sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter des moutons et leur nourriture pour qu’ils soient en bonne sante.  Monsieur F. habite à Diourbel, une petite ville rurale à 150 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.  Avec les revenus de son agriculture, il paye les dépenses de la maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh F. is a livestock farmer who raises sheep and resells them at the weekly market. He's requesting his first loan to buy sheep and fodder, so that they may be healthy. He lives in Diourbel, a small rural city located 150 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. With the revenues from his farming, he pays the expenses of the house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and fodder

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu M. is forty-two years old. She is married and has five children, two sons and three daughters. Her children are in the junior high school and the primary school. Her husband is a farmer. Ramatu is a food vendor. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Ramatu cooks and sells rice, stew and beans. She cooks the food in her house and sells it in front of her house in the mornings. Ramatu buys bags of rice and other ingredients from the wholesalers in her community. She has been in this business for twenty years and is very experienced. She wants a loan to buy more bags of rice and other ingredients. She hopes to sponsor her children to higher levels in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La socia LUZMILA; es natural de la provincia de Urubamba, ella tiene 51 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos, 4 de ellos mayores y con familia propia, y 2 de (18, 14) años de edad, ellos viven en la provincia de Urubamba, en pleno valle sagrado de los inkas, gozan de un clima benigno.

La socia alternas sus actividades del hogar con la de la agricultura, ella tiene un terreno en el que cultiva (maíz, habas, trigo, cebada, verduras), ella también desea invertir en la compra de semillas y de aves de corral, para su procreación y así su próxima venta.

La socia esta muy agradecida y valora el préstamo otorgado para la realización de sus proyectos y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total del préstamo en el tiempo determinado.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a native of Urubamba province in Peru. She is 51 years old and has 6 children, four of whom are older and have their own families, and 2 living at home (18 and 14 years respectively). They live in the province of Urubamba, in the middle of the sacred valley of the Incas, and enjoy a temperate climate. Luzmila moves between her work at home and her work in agriculture. She has a field in which she plants corn, beans, wheat, barley and vegetables. She also wants to invest in the purchase of seeds and poultry, in order to cultivate them and then resell them for profit. Luzmila is very thankful and values the loan offered in order to help her with her projects, and she promises to complete the total repayment of her loan in the time allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn and poultry

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari M. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and currently has no children. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver. She is a trader.

Mari trades in yam. She buys tubers of yams from the north, where she claims the cost is economical, and she sells them in the local market in Mampong. She says that most of her customers are food vendors. She also distributes to retailers.

Mari has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy more tubers of yams so she can supply more customers. She hopes to expand her business and maximize her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam

loans.name: Sarifatou

texts.fr: La vente de charbons est très rentable à Lomé car il est très utilisé dans la cuisine Togolaise, madame bouraïma s’est alors lancé dans ce commerce depuis 2005, elle vend le charbon en gros et en détail, dans les environs de son commerce elle est la seule à exercer ce commerce, actuellement le stock de charbons dont elle dispose ne lui permet pas de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, elle demande à WAGES son premier crédit  pour acheter 12 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Selling charcoal is very profitable in Lomé because it's used a lot for Togolese cooking. Ms. Bouraïma therefore got started in this business in 2005. She sells charcoal wholesale and retail in the area around her. She is the only one in this business. Right now, the inventory of charcoal she has doesn't allow her to respond to the demands of her customers. She's asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 12 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Martha Esperanza

texts.es:
la Sra. Martha E. G. tiene 37 años de edad, ella vive en Jicaro Galan, un lugar muy transitado por mucha gente ya que aqui es la division entre la carretera que conduce a la ciudad capital Tegucigalpa y tambien hacia el Pais de El Salvador, ella tiene 2 hijos, uno de ellos le ayuda economicamente ya que la unica fuente de ingresos que ella tiene es de la venta de frutas, ahora ella quiere comprar pescado y paletas, ya que en esta epoca de semana santa se vende mucho el pescado y como aqui es uno de los lugares mas calientes de Honduras la gente compra muchas paletas para refrescarse, los niños son buenos clientes con las paletas.
ella necesita el credito para poder comprar dicho producto ya que es mas barato comprarlo en cantidades grandes, asi ella tendra mas ganancias, esta temporada dura como 4 meses.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha E. Galos is 37 years old. She lives in Jicaro Galan a place with heavy pedestrian traffic since it is the dividing point between the highway that goes to the capital Tegucigalpa and the country of El Salvador. She has two children and one of them helps her out economically since her only source of income is selling fruits. She wants to buy fish and popsicles, since fish is sold a lot during lent season and because this is one of the hottest places in Honduras, people buy a lot of popsicles to cool off. Kids are great customers that buy popsicles. She needs the loan in order to be able to buy said products since it is cheaper to buy it in larger quantities, which will allow her to have higher earnings. This season only lasts 4 months.

Translated from Spanish by SANDY JUAREZ, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fiish and popsicles

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Brenda Azucena

texts.es:
Brenda inició el negocio para ayudar a su mamá con los gastos de la casa y para tener
dinero  para poder pagar  sus estudios, ya que no tienen mas ingresos adicionales.
Comenzó el negocio  en 1992 desde muy chica le ayudaba a su mamá a vender en mercados rodantes y con lo que ella le pagaba fue ahorrando y  comprando su mercancia, entonces empezò a vender por su cuenta, hasta que puso su propio puesto en el mercado.

Actualmente tiene su propia camioneta la cual compro usada pero funciona muy bien y es en la que mueve la mercancia, también  ha podido comprar  su propia estructura para colocarse en los mercaditos informales, de diferentes colonias .

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $8480 para dar el anticipo de otra camioneta mas nueva, porque quiere ampliar más su negocio, y para esto necesita tener otro vehiculo mas eficiente para mover su mercancia.
texts.en:
Brenda started the business to help her mother with household expenses and to earn money to pay for school because there was no other source of income. She started the business in 1992. From the time she was a girl, she helped her mother at the temporary market where they went to sell their merchandise and, with what she was paid, she saved and bought merchandise. Then she began selling on her own, eventually setting up her own stall in the market. Now she has her own truck which, though used, works just fine and which she uses to transport merchandise. She's also been able to buy a stand that she sets up in the informal markets that spring up in various neighborhoods. She needs a MXN$8480 loan for a down payment on a newer truck because she wants to expand her business. She needs a more efficient vehicle to move her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a truck for retail business.

loans.name: Courage Plus Group

texts.fr: Charlotte L. vend les épices, l’huile de palme et végétale raffinée, du riz, haricots, savons, etc… son capital actuel totalise $227. Son affaire génère un bénéfice de $110 par mois. Charlotte a commencé son affaire en vendant 20 pains qui équivalaient à $2 en 1997. De 1997 à 2002, son capital est passé de $2 à $100. Ce montant lui permit de diversifier son affaire en ajoutant des épices, l’huile de palme et végétale raffinée afin de croitre son revenu. L’affaire de Charlotte a prospéré de 2002 jusqu’à ce jour. Dans le souci d’avoir un soutien financier durable par une institution financière pour développer son affaire,  Charlotte a décidé d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope dénommé « Courage » en février 2008. Avec les crédits reçus de Hope, elle a commencé à ouvrir une petite boutique. Charlotte travaille durement pour réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir une grande boutique d’articles divers et vendre les vivres frais. Charlotte a 48 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants âgés de 6 à 26 ans dont 5 sont élèves et une seule est indépendante.
texts.en:
Charlotte L. sells spices, palm oil, and refined vegetable oil, rice, beans, soap, etc... She currently has $227 in capital. Her business generates a profit of $110 per month. She started her business by selling 20 loaves of bread which was equivalent to $2 in 1997. From 1997 to 2002, her capital went from $2 to $100. This amount enabled her to diversify her business by including spices, palm oil, and refined vegetable oil in order to grow her revenues. Charlotte's business has been prospering since 2002.

Wanting to have sustainable financial support through a financial institution for developing her business, she decided to join one of the HOPE groups called "Courage" in February 2008. With the loans received from HOPE, she started by opening a small shop. She works hard to realize her dream of opening a large shop of various goods and to sell fresh staple foods.

Charlotte is 48 years old, married, and the mother of six children, ages 6 to 26. Five of them are students and one is independent.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three buckets of beans, some spcies, tomatoes, etc... for increase the income from her business

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa S. a pour l’activité la vente de savon et le savon en poudre pour faire la lessive.  Cette vielle dame habite à Diourbel, une petite ville rurale à 150 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.  Elle a fait ce commerce depuis 8 ans, donc elle est bien expérimentée dans ce commerce, et elle est mariée avec des enfants.  Avec ce crédit, elle va reconstituer son stock pour mieux servir ses clients.  Avec les revenus de son entreprise elle aide à soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Awa S. has a business selling soap and powdered laundry soap. She is an elderly woman who lives in Diourbel, a small rural city located 150 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She has been in this business for eight years, so she is very experienced in this field. She is married and has children. With this loan, she's going to replenish her stock to serve her customers better. With the revenues from her enterprise, she helps with supporting her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Miguel Arcangel

texts.es:
El socio MIGUEL ARCANGEL; nació en la bella provincia de Urubamba, el vive en el barrio de callejón chico en tarabamba, a 10 minutos de la provincia.

El socio Miguel, tiene 44 años de edad, y tiene 3 hijos de (22,21,10) años, el está separado de sus esposa; El socio tiene como principal actividad el comercio de maderas, el trae desde la selva de Perú madera hasta su provincia, para venderla al por mayor a las diferentes carpinterías de la zona, para lo cual el socio requiere el préstamo, el desea invertir en la compra de un porcentaje mayor de madera.

El socio agradece y valora el esfuerzo por este medio y se ratifica en el pago de sus cuotas, hasta el pago total del préstamo.
texts.en:
Member MIGUEL ARCANGEL was born in the beautiful province of Urubamba and lives the small town in Trabamba, 10 minutes away from the province.

Member, Miguel is 44 years old and has 3 children, ages 22,21,10. He is separated from his wife. He is in the timber business and he bring wood to his province from the jungles of Peru in order to sell them at wholesale price to different woodshops in the zone. This is why he is requesting a loan. He hopes to invest it in the purchase of a large quantity of wood.

Member Miguel is thankful and values the efforts made here. He agrees to pay fess and the entire amount of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by SANDY JUAREZ, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sell timber wholesale

loans.name: Lissassi

texts.fr: Résidente du quartier d’agoè minamadou, adjavou lissassi exerce la restauration, sa spécialité est le plat de riz, il y a des écoles primaires dans son quartier, à la pause les élèves viennent acheter chez elle, aussi les jeunes célibataires de son quartier ont pris l’habitude d’aller déjeuner chez elle. Son stock de riz mou est épuisé, cliente de WAGES, elle s’adresse à l’institution pour obtenir un crédit et acheter 08 sacs de riz. Adjavou est mariée et à 05 personnes à charges
texts.en:
A resident of the Aagoè Minamadou district, Ms. Adjavou Lissassi works in the restaurant business. Her speciality is rice plates. There is a primary school in her district. During breaks, the students come to buy from her. Also, young unmarried people in the area have gotten into the habit of having lunch at her place. Her stock of (soft) rice is exhausted. A client of WAGES, she's inquiring with that institution to obtain a loan to buy eight sacks of rice. Adjavou is married and has five people to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice for catering

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen inició el negocio porqué le gusta cocinar y tiene mucha experiencia en ello, por lo que se decidio a dedicarse a la venta de comidas,además su papá siempre se dedicó a ese negocio.
Comenzó el negocio en Junio del 2006 con un ahorro que le dieron a su esposo donde trabajaba, inicio vendiendo gorditas y cuando falleció su esposo decidió establecer el  negocio más en forma para tener más utilidades.  Ha ido creciendo poco a poco, invirtiendo en más mobiliario y ampliando la variedad de platillos, lo que le ha ganado mas clientes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $4,000 para  comprar  materia prima ya que la venta se ha incrementado por una fabrica que se puso en frente de su negocio, y para comprar los ingredientes de la comida de cuaresma para la proxima temporada.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen started the business because she likes to cook and has experience cooking. Her father had a business selling food and she decided to follow in his footsteps. She started the business in June 2006 with savings that her husband collected from a former employer. She started selling gorditas and when her husband died, she decided to establish the business more formally so that she could get more from it. It's been growing little by little as she's invested in more space and expanded the menu which, in turn, have increased her customer base. She needs a MXN$4,000 loan to buy basic supplies. Sales have been increasing because a factory recently opened across from her business and she needs extra supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia FORTUNATA; nació en el pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas,  vive en el barrio de nombre callejón chico en Urubamba a 10 minutos de la provincia.

Nuestra socia tiene 56 años de edad, ella tiene 4 hijos de (33, 30, 24, 23) años, ella es madre soltera, y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta de chicha de jora, ella compra maíz y jora para la elaboración de la chica a base de estos productos y los macera y procesa para su venta, ella vende en su casa, para lo cual requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y jora, así mismo ella criará algunos cuyes para hacerlos reproducir y posteriormente venderlos.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo que le permitirá mejorar sus ganancias, y se compromete al pago total del préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Fortunata was born in the middle of the sacred valley of the Incas. She lives in a neighborhood called “Callejón chico” or “Little alley” in Urumbamba, Peru, about 10 minutes from the provincial capital. Fortunata is 56 years old and has four children (33, 30, 24, and 23 years old respectively). She is a single mother, and she alternates her activities between home and the purchase and sale of chicha de jora (a corn-based traditional Incan alcoholic drink). She purchases corn and jora in order to make the chicha from those products and she soaks and processes them for their sale. She sells them from home. She needs the loan in order to invest in the purchase of corn and jora, and she will also raise some guinea pigs in order to make them reproduce and later resell them. Fortunata is thankful for and values this loan which will permit her to improve her income. She promises to repay the full loan in the time period allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and sell corn in order to make chicha de jora (a corn based drink)

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El sr. Emilio G. tiene 46 años, esta casado, y viven en casa propia en la ciudad de San Antonio. Emilio y su esposa tienen 2 hijas mayores. Una de ellas está en el exterior por motivos laborales y la otra vive con los mismos, está en la Universidad.

El Sr. Emilio tiene desde hace 7 años la venta de carbón a mayorista (wholesale) y minorista (retail). El negocio funciona en su domicilio ya que es propio, cuenta con dos personales a su cargo.
Cuenta con buena cantidad de clientes y nos comenta que la Venta de Carbón siempre es rentable. La mayoría de sus clientes compran a gran cantidad por la calidad que el ofrece, por eso recurre al crédito para tener mayor capital operativo.  Tambien para la reparación del vehículo que utiliza para el reparto del mismo.

Dice que los créditos son muy útiles porque siempre  brinda la posibilidad de cumplir con sus clientes, en las entregas a tiempo de los pedidos.
texts.en:
Emilio G., 46, is married and owns his own house in the city of San Antonio. Emilio and his wife have 2 grown daughters. One of them is in the exterior for work and the other, who lives with him and his wife, is at the university. Emilio has operated a business for 7 years selling wholesale and retail supplies of fuel. He operates the business from his house and employs two people to help him run it. He has a good customer base and he told us that fuel sales are always profitable. Most of his customers buy large quantities because the quality of his stocks is high. Consequently, he needs the loan for operating capital. He also needs to repair the vehicle that he uses to deliver the fuel that he sells. He says that the loans are very useful because they allow him to comply with his customers' demands and deliver their orders on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fuel for resale and repair delivery vehicle.

loans.name: Toribio Marcial

texts.es: El Señor Toribio Marcial Téllez I. tiene la edad de 43 años, su estado civil es soletero. Don Toribio tiene 1 hijo y trabaja. La actividad económica de Don Toribio es la venta de verduras y frutas. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en mercado La Estación, ya que es aquí donde consigue a sus mejores clientes. Los propósitos de Don Toribio son de vender todos sus productos ya que el mas solicitado por sus clientes son los tomates. Don Toribio solicita este financiamiento solamente para su capital de trabajo y así invertirlo en la compra de tomate, cebolla, papa, plátanos, ajos y repollo. Es por eso que su deseo más grande es llegar a comercializar estos productos en mayores cantidades. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 8.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Toribio Marcial Téllez I. is 43 years old and single. Toribio has one son and he works. Toribio sells fruits and vegetables. He has had this business for 4 years. His business is located in the La Estación market. That is where he gets his best customers. Toribio’s intends to sell all of his produce; however tomatoes are most in demand by his customers. Toribio asks for a loan for working capital. He will buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes, bananas, garlic and cabbage. His biggest desire is to be able to market these items in larger quantities. He is asking for $400 (8000 NIO).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.es:
La Sra. Iluminada C. tiene 64 años,  esta casada con el Sr. Antonio Gomez Cabrera que tiene 71 años. Ellos tienen cuatro hijos, todos  mayores y con sus familias respectivas.

La Sra. Iluminada tiene su merceria desde el año 1978 que está ubicada sobre una de las avenidas mas importantes de la zona. Las mercaderías que más vende son las prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros  y los calzados de dama.

El crédito que solicita actualmente desea destinarla a la compra de pantalones, camisas, polleras y calzados para uniforme colegial teniendo en cuenta que se están iniciando las clases en las instituciones educativas y que tiene una gran cantidad de pedidos de dicha mercaderias.
texts.en:
Mrs Iluminada C. is 64 years old and married to Mr. Antonio Gomez Cabrera who is 71 years old. They have four children, all of whom are grown and have their own families. Mrs. Iluminada has had a store for since 1978 that is located on one of the most important avenues of the zone. The products she sells the most of are men's and women's clothing and women's shoes. She desires to use the loan she is requesting to buy pants, shirts, skirts and shoes for school uniforms since classes are starting and there is a high demand for such merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, skirts, and footwear for school uniforms

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Monsieur A. Kodjo réside dans le quartier de bè, il fait comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de matériels électriques, il a commencé ce commerce depuis 2004 et s’approvisionne au marché d’attigbodi près du grand marché de Lomé ; son stock de marchandises étant épuisé, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit qui sera son deuxième pour acheter 200 ampoules, 50 réglettes, 20 additionnels et des fils électriques. Il est  marié et a 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. A. Kodjo lives in the Bè district. He earns an income through commerce in electrical equipment and supplies. He started this business in 2004 and acquires his supplies at the Attigbodi market near the grand marketplace Lomé. Because his stock of merchandise is exhausted, he's requesting his second loan from WAGES for buying 200 light bulbs, 50 strip lights, 20 additionnels, and some electrical cord. He is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eletrical supplies

loans.name: Odalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Odalia del Carmen T. R. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Odalia tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Odalia es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica este negocio, por lo que su negocio surge por la necesidad de poseer una fuente de ingresos para su familia. Los propósitos de Doña Odalia son de proporcionar a sus clientes la mejor calidad de ropa. 
Es por eso que solicita financiamiento es destinado especialmente para capital de trabajo por lo que viaja hasta Managua en busca de la mejor calidad de ropa. Es por eso que sus sueños son de mejorar cada día con su negocio para satisfacer completamente a sus clientes. La cantidad que solicita es de C$9.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Odalia del Carmen T. R. is 36 years old, single, and has 3 children who all study. Mrs. Odalia's business is buying and selling clothing. She began this business more than 4 years ago out of the necessity to provide a source of income for her family. Mrs. Odalia's intention is to provide her customers with the highest quality of clothing. It is for this reason that she asks for a loan, which is specifically intentioned for labor capital. She travels to Managua to search for the highest quality clothing, and her dream is to improve her business each day to completely satisfy her customers. The amount she requests is 9,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
La socia MARGOTH; nació hace 32 años en la provincia de Urubamba, exactamente en ayllupampa, ubicado a 10 minutos de la provincia.

Ella tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos (12 y 4), años, nuestra socia tiene un pequeño restaurante, el cual ella misma lo administra, ella solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de productos propios del restaurante e implementar un poco más su pequeño negocio. 

Nuestra socia esta muy feliz con el préstamo que le otorgaran mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
The member, MARGOTH, was born 32 years ago in the province of Urubamba, in Ayllupampa to be exact, located 10 minutes from the province.

She is 32 years old, married, with 2 children, 12 and 4 of age. Our member has a small restaurant, which she administers herself. She is requesting a loan to invest in buying products for the restaurant and implement her small business.

Our member is very happy with the loan she will receive through these means and she is commited to repay the total amount of the loan within the deadline.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for a restaurant.

loans.name: Astou Sène

texts.fr: Astou Sène D. est une vendeuse de bois morts pour faire la cuisine surtout dans les villages et lors des cérémonies, elle a trois ans d’expérience. Elle habite à Diourbel une ville à 150 km de Dakar, elle est mariée  et a des enfants. Elle est à son premier prêt et sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité dont les revenues lui permettent de soutenir son mari à entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Astou Sène D. is a retailer of firewood for cooking, especially in villages and during ceremonies. She has three years of experience. She lives in Diourbel, a city located 150 km from Dakar. Astou is married and has children. She is on her first loan and is requesting it to bolster her business. The revenues from it enable her to support her husband in providing for the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Dibor

texts.fr: Madame Dibor T. a une buvette c'est-à-dire un canT. scolaire au lycée de Diourbel. Elle est mariée et est à son premier prêt. Son activité marche très bien au lycée, elle vend divers produits (des beignets, des chandoises , du café , du thé …) Avec ses revenues elle aide son mari à payer la scolarité des enfants et à épargner pour agrandir sa canT. .
texts.en:
Ms. Dibor T. has a beverages stand, that is, a mobile stall at the Diourbel high school. She is married and is on her first loan. Her business is doing very well at the high school. She sells various items (doughnuts and fritters, chandoises, coffee, tea,...) With her revenues, she helps her husband pay the school costs for the children and to save money for expanding the stall.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start her business

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca López tiene 58 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica de Doña Francisca es la venta de mercadería en general como calzado, ropa para damas, niños y caballeros y cosméticos además en su casa de habitación ofrece los productos de refrescos naturales y pan. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que Doña Juana no poseía ingresos y por medio de la venta de estos productos es que ha logrado salir adelante. Los propósitos de Doña Juana son de son de invertir cada día en su negocio. Es por eso que Doña Francisca recurre a Fundación León 2000 para solicitar un financiamiento que sea destinado a capital de trabajo y así comprar pinturas de labios, perfumes, cremas y frutas para la elaboración de los refrescos. Sus deseos son de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda ya que tiene que dejarles a sus hijos un buen lugar donde vivir. La cantidad que solicita es de C$6.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca López is 58 years old and single. Juana sells general merchandise like shoes, women’s and children’s clothes, and cosmetics. Also, she sells natural drinks and bread from her home. She has done this for the last 10 years. Juana did not have any income, and through the sale of these products she has been able to get ahead. Juana plans to invest in her business everyday. That is why Juana turns to Fundación León 2000 to ask for a loan for working capital. She will buy lipsticks, perfumes, and cream and fruit to make the drinks. Her desire is to improve her home. She feels that she needs to give her children a good place to live. She is asking for $300 (6000 NIO).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ismaël

texts.fr: Monsieur Ismaël N.  est un boutiquier qui vend divers produits il est marie  il gère aussi une télé centre et est à son premier prêt. Il est marié et a des enfants, il habite à Diourbel une petite ville à 150 km de Dakar. Son boutique est son lieu de travail d’où les revenues lui permettent de nourrir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Ismaël N. is a shopkeeper who sells various items. He also manages a telephone center and is on his first loan. He is married and has children. He lives in Diourbel, a town located 150 km from Dakar. His shop is his workplace, and the revenues from it allow him to feed his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To boost his business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Señora Margarita Jirón tiene 79 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Margarita tiene 1 hijo y estudia. La actividad económica de Doña Margarita es la venta y destace de cerdo. Doña Margarita inicio hace más de 54 años, y pesar de la edad en una excelente cliente de Fundación León 2000 ya que cada uno de sus financiamientos los ha aplicado a su negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Margarita son de mantener este negocio activo para proporcionarle a su familia una fuente de ingresos. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de traba ya que con esto comprara a los cerdos y tiene que recurrir a las comarcas en busca del mejor. Los deseos de Doña Margarita son de aumentar la producción de venta de cerdo ya que al mismo tiempo obtendría muchos clientes. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 12.0000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Señora Margarita J. is 79 years of age and is unmarried. She has one son who is studying. Doña Margarita butchers and sells pork for a living and she has been doing so for over 54 years. Despite her advanced years she is an excellent client of the Leon 2000 Foundation since she has invested every one of their loans in her business. Doña Margarita intends to keep her business up and running so as to provide a source of income for her family. The loan is to be used to buy pigs and it is necessary to go to the neighbouring regions in search of the best ones. Doña Margarita wishes to increase her production of pork for sale and at the same time get lots of customers. She is asking for C$ 12,000 Nicaraguan cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette BABOU a  une boutique au marché de Bambey dans la région de Diourbel. Elle est mariée et est à son premier prêt pour renforcer son activité. Avec ses revenues elle compte épargner pour agrandir sa boutique  et aussi aider son mari sur les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Maguette BABOU has a shop at the Bambey marketplace in the Diourbel region. She is married and is on her first loan for bolstering her business. With her revenues, she intends to save money for expanding her shop and also for helping her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ROSA; es natural de la provincia de Urubamba, vive en ayllupampa, ubicado a 10 minutos de la provincia de Urubamba.

La socia tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos de (18, 16,12 y 10), años, ella alterna sus actividades domésticas con la compra al por mayor de verduras y la venta de las mismas, ella también desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de aves de corral, como pollos, gallinas ponedoras de huevos. Para lo cual solicita el préstamo.

La socia esta muy agradecida con este medio por otorgarle el préstamo y así mismo se compromete en el pago total de su deuda en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Our member, ROSA, was born in the province of Urubamba, she lives in Ayllupampa, located 10 minutes from the province of Urubamba.

The member is 36 years old, a single mother with 4 children, 18, 16, 12, and 10 years old, she alternates her chores with the purchase in bulk of vegetables, which she sells. She wants to invest her loan in buying poultry such as chickens and egg-laying hens. This is the reason for requesting the loan.

The member is thankful to these means for giving her the loan and she is committed to repay her total debt within the deadline.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling vegetables and poultry.

loans.name: Tenning

texts.fr: Madame Tenning  D. est une vendeuse ambulent de bissap et du mil ; elle habite à Bambey dans la région de Diourbel ; elle est mariée et a 6 ans d’expérience sur le métier. Avec ce prêt elle veut renforcer son activité  surtout pour le bissap qu’elle compte revendre à Dakar la ville capital. Et elle soutient beaucoup son mari  qui n’a pas de moyen avec les revenues qu’elle gagne sur son petit commerce .
texts.en:
Ms. Tenning D. is an itinerant vendor of bissap (dried hibiscus flowers) and millet. She lives in Bambey, in the Diourbel region. She is married and has six years of experience in this trade. With this loan, she wants to bolster her business, especially in bissap, which she plans to resell in Dakar, the capital city. And she does a lot to support her husband, who lacks funds, through the revenues she earns from her little business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina  inició el negocio por la necesidad de tener un ingreso extra que le permitiera apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijos, ya que con su sueldo no les alcanzaba.  Comenzó el negocio En Febrero de 1997, gracias a una compañera de trabajo que la invitó a una demostración de venta de cosméticos por catalogo de reconocida marca, lo cual le gustó mucho y comenzo a vender entre sus vecinas, amistades y compañeras de trabajo. Desde entonces le ha ido muy bien y en la actualidad organiza bingos con los mismos productos. 
 

Cada día han ido creciendo sus ventas gracias a que sus clientes siempre la recomiendan con otras personas a las cuales también puede venderles sus productos.


Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3500 para comprar productos para poder cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes y de esta manera darles un buen servicio para conservarlos.
texts.en:
Agustina started her business to gain extra income to help her husband with the household expenses and their children’s education. His salary did not cover all of their expenses. She started her business in February of 1997 thanks to a friend from work. The friend invited her to a demonstration on catalog selling of recognized brands of cosmetics. Augustina liked it very much, and she started to sell to her neighbors, friends and co-workers. Since then, it has gone very well for her, and now she organizes bingo games with the same products. Every day her sales have grown thanks to her customers who recommend her to other people who she can then sell to. She needs a loan for $250 (3500 MXN) to buy products to be able to fill her customers’ orders. This way she can give them good service and keep them as customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Sarwari M. Aslam Group

texts.en:
Sarwari baji, the wife of M. A., has lived in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan for the past 10 years. She is the mother of three children, one son and two daughters. All of her children get their education from a local school near their house.

Sarwari baji has a business sewing clothes. She sews clothes to share the financial burden with her husband. Her husband has a dairy business. He gets milk from a buffalo and sells it to the milk shops. Sarwari baji is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her husband’s milk-selling business.

Sarwari baji is the leader of a group of three women from her locality. Gaman baji, Jamila baji, and Asia baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their dairy businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: 'Baji,' which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for a dairy business

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
La socia OLGA; es natural de la provincia de Urubamba, ella vive en el sector de ayllupamapa, a 10 minutos de Urubamba.

La socia tiene 28 años y es casada ella tiene 2 hijos de (11 y 5 años de edad), ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de zapatos, nuestra socia viaja hasta la ciudad de Trujillo en el norte del país y trae zapatos de cuero, ella solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de más zapatos y abrir su pequeña tienda en el pueblo.

La socia está muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y valora el esfuerzo por lo cual se compromete a cancelar el total de su préstamo en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Olga lives in the Ayllupamapa area of the Urubamba province, 10 minutes from the city of Urubamba. She is 28 years old and married with two children (5 and 11 years old). She alternates housework with her small business, buying and selling shoes. She travels to the city of Trujillo in the north and returns with leather shoes to sell. Olga will use this loan to purchase more shoes and open her own small store in the village. She is very grateful for this loan and values your efforts, for which she promises to pay her loan back on time.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling leather shoes

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es soltera, la actividad económica de Doña María es la venta de refrescos naturales, venta de hielo y venta de gaseosas. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Doña María tiene mas de 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio, por lo que inicio con capital propio pero con el paso del tiempo decidió vender gaseosa, hielo y bolsitas. Los propósitos de Doña María son de seguir aumentando la producción de refrescos naturales ya que así dará satisfacción a la demanda de sus clientes. Es por eso que Doña María recurre al financiamiento con la ayuda de Fundación León 2000 para invertirlo en capital de trabajo como frutas, bolsas plásticas, azúcar y la compra de gaseosas. Los deseos de Doña María son de proporcionar estabilidad con su negocio por lo que la situación del país es cada vez más difícil. Es por eso que solicita la cantidad de C$ 3.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Maria Esperanza is 44 years old and single. She sells juices, ice and soft drinks out of her home. Maria has been doing this for more than 5 years. She began with her own capital and with the passing of time began selling soft drinks, ice and bags. Maria plans on increasing her production of natural juices to satisfy the demand for this product. It is for this reason that Maria is seeking a loan through Fundacion Leon 2000, that she will invest in working capital like fruit, plastic bags, sugar and soft drinks. Maria hopes to gain stabaility through her business because the situation in her country is becoming more and more difficult. She is asking for C$3,000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fruit, soft drinks

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua O. is forty-five years old. He is married and has six children, two sons and four daughters. Some of his children are in the junior high and the basic school. Others have apprenticeships. His wife is a trader and he is also a commercial driver and trader. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Joshua trades in food, such as maize, yams, etc. He buys bags of maize and tubers of yams from farmers in the nearby villages and then supplies the food to food vendors in his community. Joshua also distributes to retailers. At times, he also resorts to selling fruit, such as watermelon.

He has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy food in bulk so that he is able to supply to more customers. Joshua hopes to make more income so he can have his own apartment.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is fifty-five years old. She is a widow with six children, two sons and four daughters. Some of her children are in junior high and basic school. Others are in the senior high school. Her husband is a farmer. She is a trader. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  

Akua trades in foodstuff, such as maize and yams. She buys bags of maize and tubers of yams from farmers in the nearby villages and sells them to food vendors at the local market. She also distributes to retailers. Akua has been in this business for thirty good years and wants a loan to procure food in bulk so that she can supply more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children to higher levels in school.

loans.use: To buy yams and maize in bulk

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua S. is forty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to six children. Currently, the last born is in the primary school while the rest are in the senior high and the junior high schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Mampong is mainly a business town.

Akua is a food vendor. She sells porridge in the mornings. Most people eat porridge for breakfast. She prepares the porridge with either maize or millet. Akua buys her raw materials from the wholesalers in the local market and, at times, travels to nearby markets to buy at more economical price. She also hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell the porridge in her community in the mornings.

Akua has been in this business for ten years. She wants a loan to buy raw materials in bulk so she can expand her business and increase her profit margin so she can care for her children.

loans.use: To procure maize, millet, etc.

loans.name: Rhéma Plus Group

texts.fr: Miryam K. vend le maїs en détail. Son capital actuel est de $600. Elle a commencé son affaire avec un capital initial de $250 qui lui avait permis d’acheter 15 sacs de manioc en 1978. De 1978 à 1991, son affaire a prospéré en augmentant le nombre de sacs à 30 totalisant un capital de $700. En 1991, elle subit une intervention chirurgicale qui ralentit ses activités qui diminua sensiblement son capital à $150. Elle reprit ses activités en 1992 en achetant 10 sacs de manioc. De 1992 à 2003, Miryam réussit à totaliser un capital de $800 avec 22 sacs dont $300 furent malheureusement volés. De 2004 à 2008, elle diversifia son affaire en ajoutant 12 sacs de maїs porta son capital à $720. Le divorce avec son mari causé par le décès de son enfant en 2005, la déséquilibra et provoqua une baisse dans son affaire. C’est ainsi qu’en août 2008, elle se décida d'integrer une des banques communautaires de l’IMF Hope dénommée « Rhema ».  Miryam a 49 ans, divorcée et mère de 7 enfants âgés de 14 à 30 ans dont quatre sont déjà indépendants. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une pharmacie et une boutique. C’est le bénéfice généré de ses activités qui nourrit et supporte sa famille. Ses activités sont localisées dans la partie nord-est de Kinshasa. Miryam et son groupe ont remboursement totalement et à temps les crédits recus en novembre dernier.
texts.en:
Miryam K. sells corn at the retail level. She currently has $600 in capital. She started her business with $250 in initial capital that had enabled her to buy 15 sacks of cassava in 1978. From then until 1991, her business prospered by increasing the number of sacks to 30, totaling $700 in capital. In 1991, she underwent surgery which slowed her down and which noticeably diminished her capital to $150. She started up again in 1992 by buying 10 sacks of cassava. From 1992 to 2003, she succeeded in totaling $800 in capital with 22 sacks, of which $300 was unfortunately stolen. From 2004 to 2008, she diversified her business by adding 12 sacks of corn, which brought her capital to $720.

The divorce from her husband, caused by the death of her son in 2005, threw her off balance and resulted in a drop in business. This is why, in 2008, she decided to join one of IMF HOPE community banks called "Rhema".

Miryam is 49 years old, divorced, and the mother of seven children, ages 14 to 30, four of whom are already independent. Her ambition is to open a pharmacy and a shop. The profits generated from her work are what feed and support her family. Her businesses are localized in the northeastern part of Kinshasa. She and her group have totally repaid on time the loans received last November.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster the stock of merchandise by buying 15 sacks of corn

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mukimichon

texts.ru: Магазин Мукимчона изменился с тех пор как он получил свой прошлый займ на КИВА. Ассортимент увеличен, и он включил в него новые товары: рис, масло растительное, муку и тп. Его старшая дочь помогает ему в бизнесе. Мукимичон планирует и дальше развивать свой бизнес, так как это его единственный источник дохода. На новый займ планирует приобрести оптом муку, так как цены на нее немного снизились, а спрос вырос и он считает что получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en:
Mukimichon's store changed since his last Kiva loan. The assortment of goods is larger; now Mukimichon offers rice, vegetable oil, flour, etc. His elder daughter helps him with the store. Mukimichon is planning to expand his business because it is his only source of income. He plans to use the new loan for wholesale purchase of flour, because flour prices are currently down but demand for flour is up. This would allow Mukimichon to make profit.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wholesale purchase

loans.name: Apu Curi - Quiquijana Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal denominado “APU CURI - QUIQUIJANA”; proviene del respeto a los cerros y montañas de la región, para los antiguos inkas los Apus, eran las representaciones de deidades superiores como el padre, quien abraza y protege a la comunidad.

Los socios de este banco son naturales del distrito de quiquijana, una zona muy bonita y rica en productos, ellos tiene entre sus actividades caceras, las de, agricultores (papa, maíz, alcachofas, habas, verduras, trigo, cebada, flores, duraznos, choclos), y la crianza de alpacas, llamas, ovinos, ganados en general, aves de corral, y dos socios tiene su tienda de abarrotes, muchos de ellos venden productos secos, que son los granos que producen sus tierras. Nuestros nuevos socios, requieren el préstamo para poder invertir en su capital de trabajo y mejorar sus ganancias.

Los socios de este banco están muy agradecidos y valoran el préstamo otorgado y se comprometen en cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago en el plazo y fechas programadas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “ APU CURI - QUIQUIJANA ”; it comes from the respect given to the hills and mountains of the region, for the ancient inkas the Apus. They were the representations of top deities like the father, who embraces and protects to the community. The partners of this bank are natives of the district of Quiquijana, a very nice area and rich in products. The partners besides their home activities they are farmers (potatoes, corn, artichokes, beans, vegetables, wheat, barley, flowers, peaches, sweet corn), and they also breed alpacas, llamas, sheep, poultry. Two of the partners have grocery stores. A lot of them sell dry products, which are the grains product of their land. Our new partners need a loan to be able to have a working capital and improve their profits. The partners of this bank are very grateful and value the granted loans and promise to repay in the stipulated terms and dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of sheep, cattle, dry products, groceries and fruits.

loans.name: Ahrorchon

texts.ru: Ахрорчону 28 лет, женат, имеет 2 детей. Дети маленькие и поэтому жена сидит дома и смотрит за ними. Ахрорчон не имеет высшего образования, так как сразу после окончания средней общеобразовательной школы начал работать. Живет со своими родителями и на его долю выпадает часть семейных расходов. Сейчас очень нестабильные времена и приходится много работать, чтобы прокормить семью. Кроме этого по выходным дням занимается мелким предпринимательством – куплей продажей сухофруктов. Ахрорчон пришел в МикроИнвест и подал заявку на займ. Собирается расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Ahrorchon is 28 years old and is married with two children. His children are small and his wife is a stay-at-home mother. Ahrorchon has no higher education because he had to start working after high school. He lives with his parents and he needs to cover part of family's expenses. We are living through unstable times, and one needs to work hard in order to provide for one's family. In addition, Ahrorchon has a small business - he sells dried fruit. Ahrorchon is applying for a loan that would allow him to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Orifchon

texts.ru: Орифчон имеет большую семью – он женат и имеет 5 детей. Старшие дети уже вполне самостоятельные и двое из них уже работают. Но чтобы прокормить такую большую семью необходимо много работать, поэтому Орифчон дополнительно к своей основной работе еще занимается мелким предпринимательством. Он по выходным дням выходит на рынки и занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов. Недавно он услышал о кредитной деятельности МикроИнвест и решил получить здесь небольшой займ, чтобы расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Orifchon has a big family: he is married with five children. His elder children are quite independent and two of them already work. But in order to provide for such a large family, one needs to work really hard. Therefore, in addition to his main job, Orifchon has a business. On weekends he sells dried fruit at the market. Recently Orifchon has heard about Microinvest and decided to apply for a loan that would allow him to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Otobe

texts.fr: K. Otobe est une femme qui est cuisinière de formation, ne trouvant pas du boulot après sa formation et sur conseil de sa maman qui fut revendeuse de pagnes, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de pagnes, au début elle achetait la marchandise à crédit et payait ses fournisseurs  après avoir vendu, elle a réalisé assez de bénéfice et à commencé à acheter directement sans crédit,voulant aussi agrandir son stock de marchandises elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 pagnes boubou, 15 pagnes guinéens et 10 pagnes simples. Etant divorcée de son mari, c’est avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce qu’elle subvient aux charges de son enfant.
texts.en:
K. Otobe is a woman who is cook by training. Not finding a job after her training, and on the advice of her mom who was a retailer of pagnes, she got started in the commerce of pagnes (colorful West African cloth). At first, she used to buy merchandise on credit and paid her suppliers after selling the goods. She earned enough profit and began buying directly without credit.

Wanting furthermore to expand her stock of merchandise, she's requesting a loan from WAGES for buying: 20 boubou pagnes, 15 Guinea pagnes, and 10 plain pagnes. Being divorced, the money she earns from her commerce is what she uses to provide for her child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’agbalépédo, elle est divorcée de son mari et a 02 enfants, elle est très dynamique et travaille dure pour subvenir au besoin de ses enfants, l’activité qu’elle exerce est la vente de chaussures, de pagnes, de sacs et de mèches. Elle désire agrandir son stock avec 02 cartons de chaussures,15 paires de pagnes, 01 carton de mèches et une dizaine de sacs. C’est pour cela qu’elle demande son premier crédit à WAGES.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Agbalépédo district. She is divorced and has two children. She is very energetic and works hard to provide for her children. The work she does involves selling shoes, pagnes (colorful West African cloth), bags, and hair extensions. She would like to expand her inventory with two boxes of shoes, fifteen pairs of pagnes, one box of hair extensions, and a dozen bags. This is why she's asking WAGES for her first loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and cloth

loans.name: Ndoumbé

texts.fr: Ndoumbé S. est mariée avec 06 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Thairé Dendel. Son activité est l’embouche. Elle veut  acheter des bœufs pour renforcer son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndoumbé S. is married and has six children to support. She is a member of the village lending group Thairé Dendel. Her work involves fattening livestock. She wants to buy cattle to bolster her business and to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock for resale

loans.name: Afoua

texts.fr: Cette dame est une résidente du quartier d’agoè assiyéyé au nord de la ville de Lomé, elle est mariée et 02 enfants, son mari est un enseignant à la retraite.  Elle exerce comme activité le commerce de bois de chauffe. Elle maîtrise parfaitement ce commerce parce qu’elle a commencé à l’exercer depuis 1993. Au Togo le bois de chauffe est très utilisé pour la préparation de la nourriture surtout les boissons locales. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays précisément à TCHEBEBE. Son stock de bois de chauffe étant épuisé, elle sollicite un crédit chez WAGES pour acheter des bois de chauffe
texts.en:
This is a lady who resides in the Aagoè Assiyéyé district in the north of the city of Lomé. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a retired teacher. She earns an income doing commerce in firewood. She has perfect mastery of her business because she has been in it since 1993. In Togo, firewood is used a lot for making food, especially local beverages. She supplies herself from the country's interior, in TCHEBEBE to be precise. Since her stock of firewood is exhausted, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy firewood.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami Ndao est mariée avec 07 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Thiaré Dendel depuis 5 ans et demi. Ami veut  acheter des bœufs, des aliments et des arachides pour renforcer son activité d’embouche et de vente d’arachide. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ami Ndao is married and raising 7 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Thiaré Dendel for 5 and a half years. Ami wants to buy cows, feed, and peanuts to bolster her business fattening cattle and selling peanuts. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying cows, feed for fattening cattle, and peanuts for re-sale

loans.name: Emelina Nancy,

texts.es:
Desde hace siete años que Nancy maneja una bodega de abarrotes. A sus treinta y nueve años la mayor parte de su vida se ha dedicado a su casa y la crianza de sus tres hijos, de diecisiete, catorce y nueve años.

No obstante, una vez que compró un terreno junto con su esposo empezó a construir su casa. Ya construida la casa se animó a abrir una tienda para poder ayudar en la economía de su casa, además fue lo primero que se le ocurrió ya que no había ninguna tienda cerca de su casa debido a que el lugar recién se estaba formando como urbanización 

Su esposo, así como ella se animó también a tener un negocio propio y ser independiente. El anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar en un grifo. Hace tres años que entre los dos compraron un mototaxi que ahora él maneja y trabaja dentro una compañía de transporte público. 

En el futuro, Nancy solo ve progreso. Por ahora lo que más anhela es poder terminar de construir su casa material noble, lo que le permitirá ampliar su tienda para una mejor atención de sus clientes.
texts.en:
For the past seven years Nancy has worked in a grocery store. At 39, she has spent the majority of her life dedicated to her home and to caring for her three children, who are 16, 14 and 9 years old. However, once her and her husband bought a piece of land and built their home, she was inspired to open a store. The store would help with her family’s expenses and it was the first store to open near their home, since the area they live in was still being developed into an urban neighborhood. Her husband, who used to work in a gas station, also became inspired to own their own business and work independently. Three years ago they bought a mototaxi and now he works for a public transportation company as a driver. In the future, Nancy only sees progress. For now her biggest desire is to finish building their home with durable materials, which will allow her to expand her store and offer better customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stock for grocery store

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami Lô est mariée avec 10 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Thiaré Dendel depuis 8 ans et demi. Ami veut  acheter des moutons et des engrais pour renforcer son activité d’embouche ovine et de vente d’engrais Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ami Lô, is married and raising 10 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Thiaré Dendel for 8 and a half years. Ami wants to buy sheep and fertilizer to bolster her little business fattening sheep and selling fertilizer. Her income will permit her to support her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raising sheep and selling fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Comprometidas (Committed Women) Group

texts.es:
El comité se había formado mediante otro comité de la misma Zona a la cual pertenece este, (San Antonio). Todas son vecinas del Asentamiento San Roque; Todas poseen actividades individuales y productivas. Poseen buen relacionamiento entre todas.  

Ramona López Santander	Vta de Pollos
María Estela S.	Vta Lencería
Elsa Romelia A.	Vta Comestibles
Mónica E. E.	Vta Carbón
Juana I.	Mercería
Francisca O.	Vta de Bebidas
Marcelina Florentín	Vta de Golosinas
Filipina G.	Comerciante
Carolina O.	Empleada
Coinda C.	Costurera
María S.	Repostera
Romina S.	Vta de Maní
Lucila Brítez	Vta de Bebidas
Juana Pabla Díaz	Vta de Maní
Blanca F.	Vta de Carteras
Lidia R.	Copetín
María E.	Vta  de Frutas
Cynthia Benítez	Vta de Ajos
Silvia E.	Merceria
texts.en:
This group was formed through a different group from the same area (San Antonio). The group is made up of neighbors from the San Roque Settlement; They all work in different and productive jobs and have good relationships with each other. Ramona López Santander sells chicken. María Estela S. sells lingerie. Elsa Romelia A. sells groceries. Mónica E. E. sells coal. Juana I. has a general store Francisca O. sells drinks. Marcelina Florentín sells candies and sweets. Filipina G. is a vendor. Carolina O. is an employee. Coinda C. is a tailor. María S. is a pastry chef. Romina S. sells peanuts. Lucila Brítez sells drinks. Juana Pabla Díaz sells peanuts. Blanca F. sells wallets. Lidia R. sells drinks. María E. sells fruit. Cynthia Benítez sells garlic. Silvia E. has a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various products that the women use or sell

loans.name: Diana Leidy,

texts.es:
A sus veintisiete años y con dos hijos de seis y dos años cada uno Diana, además de ser ama de casa, también se desempeña como una microempresaria. Desde hace cuatro años vende productos de belleza de una marca muy conocida. La idea de emprender este negocio nació a raíz de que se vio en la necesidad de apoyar en los ingresos de su hogar. A medida que su hijo mayor iba creciendo se dio cuenta que debía trabajar.

Anteriormente, estuvo trabajando por dos años vendiendo ropa, pero el negocio era de otra persona. Su esposo trabaja en una imprenta, negocio familiar que lleva a cabo junto con su hermana. Diana mas adelante quisiera abrir una librería en su propia casa, ya que ofrece mas ingresos y es un negocio rentable.
texts.en:
Diana is 27 years old and has 2 children, who are 6 and 2 years old. In addition to caring for her home, she is also a small business owner. For the past 4 years she has sold beauty products from a well-known brand. She started her business because she saw it was necessary for her to contribute to her family’s earnings. As her older son grew, she realized she needed to work. She worked for 2 years selling clothing, but it was through someone else’s business. Her husband works for a printer, as part of a family business he has with his sister. In the future she would like to open a stationary store/ bookstore in her home, since it is a profitable business that would bring in more income.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beauty products to increase her stock

loans.name: Noma

texts.en:
Noma F. is 47 years old and married with six children. She has three years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells taro to the public and to villagers two days per week. She is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of fertilizers, farming equipment, and chemicals for her plantation. Some of the loan will be saved to fund her children’s school fees and school activities. 

Noma has had one previous loan with SPBD; these loans are her only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala ($25 USD).

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer, knife, chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba D. âgée de  42 ans est mariée avec 08 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Thiaré Dendel depuis 8 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre de l’huile de palme, de la pâte d’arachide, des balaies et du savon. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour avoir plus de revenus et pouvoir se prendre en charge Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Coumba D., 42, is married and raising 8 children. She has been a member of the village bank of Thiaré Dendel for 8 and a half years. Her business is buying and re-selling palm oil, peanut butter, brooms, and soap. She wants to bolster her business so as to have more income and support herself. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of palm oil, peanut butter, brooms, and soap

loans.name: Delanila,

texts.es:
Delanila es una madre de familia joven y dedicada a su negocio. Desde hace dos años se encarga de atender en su propia tienda de abarrotes ubicada en un espacio de su casa. Antes manejaba un negocio de venta de medicina natural. Durante un año estuvo vendiendo diversos productos naturales, hasta que se mudo de vivienda.

No hace mucho que ella ha empezado a desenvolverse como microempresaria, antes dedicaba todo su tiempo al cuidado de su hogar y de sus hijos. Sin embargo, se animó a tener un negocio propio para poder contar con recursos propios también. Ella tiene planes de crecer con su tienda, hasta poder invertir en uno más grande.
texts.en:
Delanila is the mother of a young family and is dedicated to her business. Two years ago she opened her own grocery store located in her home. Before that she managed a business that sold natural medicine. She sold various natural products for one year until she moved to a different place. She has not been a small business owner for that long—she used to dedicate all of her time to caring for her home and her children. However, she was inspired to have her own business so that she could also have her own resources. She has plans to expand her store and even to invest in a larger store in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: merchandise

loans.name: 3 De Junio Group

texts.es:
El comité Oñondivepa se formo a partir de la union de varias vecinas del barrio 3 de junio de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Todas las integrantes del comité tienen un trabajo donde invertir el dinero que reciben.  Varias integrantes del comité son artesanas, dedicadas a la confeccion de ropas tradicionales y otros trabajos manuales, asi tambien la gran parte del comité se dedica al micro comercio, ya sea vendiendo ropas, verduras, comidas, etc. 

Maria Cristina D.	Despensa
Adela C.	  Venta de ropas
Delia M.	  Manicurista
 Alicia C.	  Recicladora
Maxima I.	  Venta de ropas
Pablina Gonzalez  Despensa
Benita O.	  Venta de cosmeticos
Felicita R.  Venta de dulces
Norma L.	  Peluquera
Maria V. L.	Costurera
Maria V. T.	Kiosco
Maria M. M.	Venta de carne
Laura C.	Venta de Bebidas
Magda N.	Venta de bebidas
Lisandra S. 	Venta de comidas
Sady Leiva I.   Artesana
Nilda C. F.	   Kiosco
Sandra C. N.	   Venta de ropas
texts.en:
This group was formed when several women from the “3 de junio” neighborhood in Villa Elisa united. Each member has a job where they will invest the money they will receive from this loan. Several of the members are artisans dedicated to making traditional clothing; other work doing manual labor and the majority of the members work in small businesses, selling clothes, vegetables, food, etc. Maria Cristina D. has a small grocery store. Adela C. sells clothing. Delia M. is a manicurist. Alicia C. works in recycling. Maxima I. sells clothing. Pablina Gonzalez has a small grocery store. Benita O. sells cosmetics. Felicita R. sells candy. Norma L. works in a salon. Maria V. L. is a tailor. Maria V. T. has a kiosk. Maria M. M. sells meat. Laura C. sells drinks. Magda N. sells drinks. Lisandra S. sells food. Sady Leiva I. is an artisan. Nilda C. F. has a kiosk. Sandra C. N. sells clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase goods for resale; materials

loans.name: Abdulahmid

texts.ru: Абдулхамид отец четверых детей. Работает в колхозе, кроме того, торгует по выходным на рынках. Ему помогает его старший сын. Его бизнес – купля продажа сухофруктов. Оборот бизнеса небольшой, планирует расширить его. Займ хочет получить в виде небольшой суммы, чтобы обучиться работать с заемными деньгами. В дальнейшем планирует получать займы вновь и в больших суммах.
texts.en:
Abdulahmid is a father of four children. He works in a collective farm and also sells on the market on the weekends. His oldest son helps him. His business is resale of dry fruits. The business does not have a large turnover, but Abdulahmid plans to expand it. He wants to get a small loan so he can learn to work with a credit. In the future he plans to get bigger loans.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Delsy,

texts.es:
La mayor parte de su vida, Delsy la ha dedicado al cuidado de su hogar y a sus tres hijos que hoy tienen dieciocho, once y siete años. No fue sino hasta cuando una amiga le comento sobre los préstamos de EDAPROSPO que empezó a pensar que la idea de tener un negocio propio le seria menos difícil. Es así que empezó a vender gaseosas.

Poco a poco, en tres años, ha ido aumentando el negocio en la cantidad de mercadería. Hoy en día no solo vende gaseosas también cervezas y algunos dulces. Por otro lado, Delsy también es propietaria de un mototaxi, transporte que alquila para que sea trabajado.

Mas adelante, Delsy tiene planeado conseguir el capital suficiente para poder comprar un automóvil y alquilarlo como taxi. Ella y su esposo se encargan de mantener el hogar. Su esposo trabaja como soldador para una empresa.
texts.en:
Delsy has dedicated a large part of her life to caring for her home and her 3 children, who are 18, 11, and 7 years old. It wasn’t until a friend told her about the EDAPROSPO loans that she began to think that having her own business might not be so difficult. That is how she began selling soft drinks. Over the past three years she has slowly increased the amount of merchandise she has. Today she not only sells soft drinks but also beer and some candy. Delsy also owns a mototaxi that she rents out to drivers as a form of transportation. In the future Delsy plans on obtaining enough capital to buy a car and rent it out as a taxi. She and her husband are both responsible for maintaining their home. Her husband works as a welder for a company.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. âgée de  45 ans est mariée avec 02 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Thiaré Dendel depuis 8 ans et demi. Son activité est l’embouche  et la vente de condiments (oignon, ail, jumbo, poivre). Elle veut renforcer son capital pour avoir plus de revenusLe prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is 45 years old, married and has two dependent children. She has been a member of the village bank of Thiaré Dendel for eight and a half years.
