She raises livestock and sells condiments (onions, garlic, Jumbo-brand bouillon cubes, pepper). She wants to increase her capital in order to have more revenues. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in one instalment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise livestock and sell condiments.

loans.name: Peka

texts.en:
Peka M. is 40 years old and married with five children. She has five years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells taro to the public and to villagers three days per week. Peka’s loan will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers for her plantation and to help pay for her children’s school fees.

Peka has had one previous loan with SPBD; these loans are her only access to capital because she has been unable to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 80 Tala ($28 USD).

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer and pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou F. âgée de  39 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Thiaré Dendel depuis 7 ans. Son activité est  la vente de pain, savon et huile. Elle veut renforcer son capital pour avoir plus de revenusLe prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou F. is 39 years old, married and has seven dependent children. She has been a member of the village bank of Thiaré Dendel for seven years. She makes her living selling bread, soap and oil. She wants to bolster her working capital in order to have higher revenues. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in one instalment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell bread, soap and oil

loans.name: Pipiana

texts.en: Pipiana P., 33, is married with one child.  She has five years of experience in the Taro Plantation business. She sells to the public and village people two days per week. She has previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 90 Tala (~30 USD).  SPBD loans are Pipiana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to pay for her child's school fees and to buy timber, iron roofing and cement for the renovation of her house.

loans.use: To pay for her child's school fees and to purchase timber, iron roofing for home improvement

loans.name: Vaimalu

texts.en: Vaimalu P., 47, is married with five children.  She has five years of experience in the Taro Plantation business. She sells to the public and village people two days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala (~23 USD).  SPBD loans are Vaimalu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Vaimalu's loan will be used to purchase things to improve her business like sacks of fertilizer, knifes, chemicals and a wheelbarraow to make work easier for her. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, knifes, chemicals and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El comité se había formado hace como un año atrás y la mayoría de las integrantes recien empezaban a lanzarce al mundo comercial, los créditos les había incentivado aún más.  El comité ha crecido bastante y ha ido mejorando en muchos aspectos se nota el crecimiento y el cambio de mentalidad en las señoras, el comité sigue en crecimiento y con ganas de superación de todas las integrantes.

Josefina R.  Vta Artesanias
Zulma G.	  Copetin
Cristina D.	  Vta Comestibles
Rafaela A.	  Vta Carbon
Maxima A.	  Vta  de Frutas
Carmen N.	  Vta de Ajos
Zulma G.	  Merceria
Andresa P.	  Comerciante
Erma V.	  Empleada
Norma F.	  Costurera
Cecilia B.	  Repostera
Martina L.	  Vta de Mani
Esmeralda C.	Vta de Bebidas
Mirna R.	  Copetin
Simona Balbuena	  Vta Leche
Mirna S.	  Copetin
Margarita P.  Vta  de Frutas
Gloria V.	  Vta de Ajos
Felicia G.	  Merceria
texts.en:
This group was formed a year ago and the majority of the members are new to the business world. The loans have helped give them even more incentive. The group has grown considerably and has been improving in many aspects. You can see the growth and the change of attitude in the women. The group continues to grow and is each member motivated to succeed. Josefina R. sells handicrafts. Zulma G. sells drink. Cristina D. sells food. Rafaela A. sells coal. Maxima A. sells fruit. Carmen N. sells garlic. Zulma G. has a general store. Andresa P. is a vendor. Erma V. is employed. Norma F. is a tailor. Cecilia B. is a pastry chef. Martina L. sells peanuts. Esmeralda C. sells drinks. Mirna R. sells drinks. Simona Balbuena sells milk. Mirna S. sells drinks. Margarita P. sells fruit. Gloria V. sells garlic. Felicia G. has a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: different products that the women sell or use

loans.name: Feagai

texts.en: Feagai T., 62, is married with eight children.  She has three years of experience in the Taamu\Taro Plantation business. She sells at Safua market two days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 80 Tala (~28 USD).  SPBD loans are Feagai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to purchase a new fence to protect the taro and taamu from being damaged; she will also buy nails, a knife and gromozone.

loans.use: Purchase fence, nails, knife and chemicals.

loans.name: Eleoupu

texts.en: Eleoupu P., 40, is married with four children.  She has three years of experience in the Taro Plantation business. She sells to the public and village people two days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 90 Tala (~30 USD). SPBD loans are Eleoupu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer and chemicals for the business. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer and chemicals for the plantation

loans.name: Mirtha Leticia,

texts.es:
Gracias a los consejos de una cercana amiga, una microempresaria con experiencia, Mirtha maneja su negocio propio desde hace tres años. A sus cuarenta y un años, la mayor parte de su vida ha sido ama de casa, dedicándose al cuidado de su hogar, en especial de sus tres hijos de veinte, siete y cuatro años.

Mirtha trabaja fabricando aretes, pulseras y collares para venderlas por unidad a amigos, conocidos y familiares. Al inicio empezó con poco, pues aun no sabia de los prestamos que EDAPORSPO brindaba, una vez que obtuvo el financiamiento pudo invertir mas en la compra de sus materiales y as poder producir mucho mas.

Por ahora, una parte de sus ganancias las vuelve a invertir y la otra para gastos particulares de ellas y de sus menores hijos. Su esposo, quien trabaja como mecánico para una empresa, es quien mantiene principalmente el hogar. Mientras, Mirtha se dedica  a crecer con su negocio más y más.
texts.en:
Thanks to the advice a close friend, who is an experienced business owner, Mirtha has had her own business for the past 3 years. At 40 years old, she has spent the majority of her life as a housewife, dedicated to caring for her home and three children, who are 20, 7 and 4 years old. Mirtha makes earrings, bracelets and necklaces that she sells to friends, acquaintances and family. She started with very little and at that time did not know about the loans offered by EDAPORSPO. Once she got a loan she invested in more materials and began producing a lot more. For now, part of her earnings are re-invested and the other part goes towards personal expenses for her and her younger children. Her husband, who works as a mechanic for a company, is the primary earner in the family. In the meantime, Mirtha is dedicated to expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy materials for jewelry-making

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход занимается куплей продажей различных сухофруктов на местных рынках. Оборот бизнеса большой и приходится много работать. Для сортировки купленных сухофруктов привлекает свою семью, а иногда нанимает работников. Но прибыль позволяет пользоваться услугами наемных рабочих. Фарходу 28 лет, женат и имеет 2 детей. Фарход собирается закупить большую партию абрикосов и поэтому подал заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Farhod purchases and sells a variety of dried fruits and the local markets. He has high turnover and has to work a lot. He uses his family to sort the dried fruits and sometimes hires workers. His profits allow him to use the services of hired laborers. Farhod is 28 years old, is married and has 2 children. Farhod plans to purchase a large quantity of apricots and because of this decided to apply for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase apricots

loans.name: Guillerma,

texts.es:
Guillerma tiene cincuenta y siete años, a su edad maneja un negocio rentable de confección y tejido.
Toda su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar en diversos talleres de confección, pues uno desaparecía detrás del otro, pero siempre conseguía un puesto de trabajo debido a su dedicación y responsabilidad que la caracterizan.

Le iba muy bien por ello decidió independizase hace diez años y trabajar por su cuenta en su casa. Ella ofrece el servicio de confección industrial de manteles, forros de sofás, sábanas y también tejido de chompas con  lana e hilo al por mayor y menor.

Ella cuenta que se especializó en ambos rubros,  tejido y confección puesto que el primero le genera ingresos en la temporada de invierno y lo segundo en  temporadas cálidas como el verano. En un futuro tiene pensado comprar un puesto en algún mercado o centro comercial para vender sus productos.

Con su trabajo ella sola se encarga de mantener su hogar, puesto quedo viuda hace algún tiempo. su tercer hijo de veintiocho años la apoya en todo. También se encarga de criar y educar a su menor hijo de catorce años.
texts.en:
Guillerma is 57 years old and runs a profitable sewing and weaving business. She has always worked in various sewing shops, but each one eventually disappeared. She always had a job because she of the dedication and responsibility that she is known for. Things were going well and 10 years ago she decided to become independent and work for herself. She offers the service of making blankets, sofa covers, sheets and also wool sweaters and wholesale thread. She specializes in both categories, sewing and weaving because sewing provides her with income during the summer months and weaving in the winter. In the future she would like to buy a booth in a market or shopping center where she will sell her products. With her job she supports herself and her home, since she was widowed awhile ago. Her third son who is 18 years old helps with everything. She also cares for her youngest child who is 14 years old.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy material to make sheets and sofa covers

loans.name: Magna Emperatriz,

texts.es:
Magna tiene cincuenta años pero tiene tanta fuerza y entusiasmo que aparenta tener mucho menos. DesD. muy joven ha trabaja en negocios D. otras personas, poco a poco, conforme pasaba el tiempo ella aprendía como se manejaba un negocio. Es por eso que hace diez años aproximadamente junto con su esposo, quien también ha sido comerciante toda su vida, se animo a iniciar un negocio D. venta D. gas domestico.

Luego D. tres años abrieron una  bodega D. abarrotes, la cual ha crecido en base al esfuerzo no solo D. magna y su esposo sino al trabajo y apoyo constante D. toda su familia. Magna reconoce que la unión familiar da mayores frutos cuando se trabaja en una  microempresa.

Hace poco ha implementado su negocio con la venta D. gaseosas y cervezas. Ya que la venta D. bebidas es rentable. Es así que piensa en un futuro convertirse en distribuidora D. cerveza.
texts.en:
Magna is 50 years old but she is so strong and so enthusiastic that she doesn't look her age. Since she was very young she worked for other people, but slowly as time went one she learned how to manage a business. About ten years ago, together with her husband who has been a businessman all his life, she started up her own business selling domestic natural gas.

Three years later they opened a grocery store, which has been expanding with the great efforts of Mangna and her husband but also with the constant support of their entire family. Magna recognizes that a family effort yields greater products when running a small business.

Only a short while ago she started selling soft drinks and beer in her store. Drink sales has been very profitable. She plans to become a beer distributor in the future.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase drinks and beer for resale.

loans.name: Comite Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité se formo a partir de la union de varias vecinas del barrio Ñande Tava de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Todas las integrantes del comité tinen un trabajo donde invertir el dinero que reciben.  Varias integrantes del comité son artesanas, dedicadas a la confeccion de ropas tradicionales y otros trabajos manuales. Tambien integran el comité varias personas que se dedican a la venta de ropas y otros articulos.

Elsa H. de Leon	Venta de Ropas.
Maria E. A.	Despensa
Andrea E. C.	Venta de lenceria
 Estelvina D.	Despensa
Maria C. B.	Venta de ropas
Graciela M.	Despensa
Lisa B.	Venta de cosmeticos
Mariana C.	Venta de carbon
Griselda V.	Artesana
Isidora H. 	Costurera
Angela O.	Kiosco
Cresencia V.	Venta de carne
Susana C. A. 	Venta de Bebidas
Myrian D. H.	Venta de frutas
Rumilda G.	Venta de cosmeticos y ropas
Nilsa V.              Costurera.
Carmen C. L..	Venta de Comidas
texts.en:
The committee was created when a number of women from the Ñande Tava neighborhood in the city of Villa Elisa joined together. All of the members of the group have a job in which they invest the money they receive. Some of the group members are artisans, dedicated to the creation of traditional clothes and other handiworks. There are also various people in the group who sell clothing and other articles. Elsa H. de Leon Clothing sales Maria E. A. General store Andrea E. C. Lingerie sales Estelvina D. General store Maria C. B. Clothing sales Graciela M. General store Lisa B. Cosmetics sales Mariana C. Charcoal sales Griselda V. Artisan Isidora H. Seamstress Angela O. Kiosk Cresencia V. Meat sales Susana C. A. Beverage sales Myrian D. H. Fruit sales Rumilda G. Cosmetics and clothing sales Nilsa V. Seamstress Carmen C. L.. Prepared food sales

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loans granted to the members of the committee were used primarily for the purchase of merchandise such as clothing, sheets, charcoal.  These articles were purchased by the women who sell them.  The artisans purchased raw materials such as thread, fabric, needles, etc.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es: El solicitante es el Sr. Justo G.. El mismo es casado, posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar. Es del Barrio Arroyo Pora del Distrito de Cambyreta y es propietario de una despensa denomidado LOS 3 HERMANOS. Cuenta 1 año 3 meses de antigueda en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos. El cliente soliicto la suma de 1,000,000 a 12 meses para compra de mercaderias como ser harina, yerba, aceite, azucar etc.
texts.en:
Mr. Justo G. is requesting this loan. He is married, and owns his own home with all of the basic essentials. He lives in the Arroyo Pora neighborhood of Cambyreta District, where he has a small grocery store called "Los 3 Hermanos" ("The Three Brothers"). He has one year and three months of experience running his store, and has regular clients and a good income. He is requesting 1,000,000 Paraguayan guaranís (US$195) to buy merchandise like flour, yerba mate, oil, sugar, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic staples like sugar, flour, pasta, yerba mate and oil

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es: GUALBERTO TIENE 2 HIJOS A LOS CUALES MANTIENE, TIENE SU CASA EN LA PLAZA PRICIPAL DE LA LOCALIDAD. CUENTA CON UN NEGOCIO DE KARAOKE LLAMADO "PLAZA" LO ATIENDE LOS FINES DE SEMANA Y LO ATIENDE DE MANERA PERSONAL, NO VIVE CON SU ESPOSA YA QUE ELLA SE FUE A OTRO PAIS. SU ACTIVIDAD TIENE MUCHA COMPETENCIA PERO TAMBIEN MUCHA DEMANDA POR PARTE DE LA GENTE QUE BUSCA DIVERSION. EL KARAOKE ES DE AMBIENTE AGRADABLE. LA VENTAJA QUE TIENE ES QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN PLENO CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD. EL CREDITO LO DESTINARA PARA CONSTRUCCION Y REFACCION DE SU CASA. ES SU SEGUNDA OPERACION Y EN SU ANTERIOR CREDITO TUVO MUY BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO, SOLO TIENE DEUDA EN NUESTRA INSTITUCION.
texts.en:
Gualberto has 2 children whom he supports. His house is located on the main square of the town. He has a karaoke business named "Plaza" which he personally attends to on the week-end. He does not live with his wife as she moved to another country. His line of business has much competition but is also very popular among people looking to have a good time. The karaoke has a friendly atmosphere and the advantage is that it is located right in the center of the town. The loan will be spent on building and refurbishing his house. This is his second operation and the repayment history of his first loan was very good. He only has debt with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building and refurbishing house.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: La familia de Dña. Aurelia esta compuesta 6 miembros. Dña. Aurelia que tiene 63 años su conyugue que no se encuentra con ellos a la fecha y dos de sus hijos trabajan en España y dos que están con ella uno de 14 años que estudia y otro de 16 años que se encuentra trabajando como moto taxista. Negocio: Dña. Aurelia tiene su pensión de venta de comidas y gaseosas el negocio se encuentra en un local que se encuentra junto a su casa de Dña. Aurelia, la preparación de las comidas lo realiza Dña. Aurelia personalmente y tiene una ayudante que le colabora a diario y uno de sus hijos medio día. Competencia: la competencia del negocio de Dña. Aurelia es media ya que es la única pensión que existe en el lugar don de a diario frecuentan los trabajadores de la empresa UNAGRO, si existe competencia es bajo ya que los negocios que existen son venta de refrigerios  y no de comidas. Destino del crédito: con este crédito solicitado la clienta ampliara su negocio, comprara más sillas, algunas mesas y un freezer para el equipamiento del negocio según informaciones obtenidas de Dña. Aurelia.                                                                                                                                                                      Antecedentes: Dña. Aurelia es cliente antigua en nuestra institución, con cinco operaciones crediticias todas ellas con buen comportamiento en sus cuotas en cada una de las operaciones que tiene Dña. Aurelia según el historial crediticio de la misma.
texts.en:
Doña Aurelia's family has 6 members; doña Aurelia who is 63 years old, her husband who is not living with them at the moment, two of her children working in Spain, and two who are with her, a 14-year-old who studies and a 16-year-old who is working as a motorcycle taxi driver. Business: Doña Aurelia has a guesthouse where she sells food and pops. The business is located next to her house. She personally cooks and he has an assistant who works with her on a daily basis and one of her children helps out half-a-day. Competition: There is little competition to doña Aurelia's line of business as it is the only guesthouse frequented on a daily basis by the workers from UNAGRO enterprise. If there is any competition, it is unimportant as the other businesses in the area only sell snacks not meals. With the loan, the client will expand her business, she will buy more chairs, some tables and a freezer for the business, as informed by doña Aurelia.

History: Doña Aurelia is an old client of our institution with five previous loans all with a good repayment record.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business.

loans.name: Repeka

texts.en: Repeka A., 61, is widowed with eight children.  She has two years of experience in the Taro Plantation and vegetable business. She sells to the people of the village and people shopping at the market three days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~150 USD). SPBD loans are Repeka’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and farming equipment.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: El Cliente Juan A. tiene 60 años de edad. El es casado y residente en la ciudad de San Ignacio. Vive en domicilio propio con su familia--el es padre de 3 hijos mayores de edad. El Señor es propietario de una despensa, ubicado en la compañía San Geronimo de la ciudad de Santa Maria, con una antigüedad de mas de 7 años en el ramo. El destino de los fondos de esta operación de préstamo realizada en nuestra institución fue para compra de mercaderías(útiles escolares) para la despensa debido a que en esta temporada empiezan las actividades en las escuelas y colegios, de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Juan A. is 60-years old. He is married and lives in the city of San Ignacio. He lives in his own house with his family - he is father of three grown children. For more than seven years he has owned a store, located inside a company called San Geronimo in Santa Maria city. The purpose of this loan from our institution was to buy merchandise (school supplies) for Juan's store, since classes are beginning. In this way Juan will be able to increase his family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for the store (school supplies)

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: El Cliente es propietario de una despensa – carniceria, ademas se dedica a la elaboracion de ladrillos. Esta casado con la Sra. Virginia Baez, tienen 3 hijos menores. Reside en la compañía Santa Rita de San Ignacio.  Destinó el Préstamo para comprar mercaderías despensa, para aprovechar  el incremento  demanda de esta época ya que se esta cosechando arroz y algodón que se cultiva en su zona y hay mayor circulante.
texts.en:
Mr. Guillermo T. owns a general store/butcher shop and also makes bricks. He is married to Mrs. Virginia Baez, and they have three young children. He lives in the Santa Rita neighborhood of San Ignacio. Currently, the flow of people coming through his area has increased due to the rice and cotton harvesting season, and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity by buying more merchandise to sell in his store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock general store

loans.name: Divino Rostro Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Divino Rostro, está integrado por las señoras Martha S., quien vende comida en su casa, ofrece platos de menú corriente en los almuerzos y cenas que ofrece a sus clientes, Doña Sandra Vanesa Sequeira, vende cosméticos y joyería de plata, doña Juana Mercedes que tiene una pulpería en su casa y doña María Auxiliadora R. que vende rosquillas de manera ambulante en los diferentes departamentos del país. Estas señoras son originarias de la ciudad de Diriomo, siendo mujeres muy trabajadoras, emprendedoras y responsables, ejemplo de esto tenemos a la señora Juana Mercedes B. quien con mucho esfuerzo ha sabido mantener su pequeña pulpería, ella es una mujer de 56 años con muchas esperanzas de salir adelante, se siente con muchas energías de emprender más en su negocio. Ella vive con su esposo, no tiene a ningún hijo a cargo, trabaja para mantenerse, su esposo le ayuda a hacer compras y además colabora con los gastos de la casa.
Doña Juana expresa que ella se siente muy orgullosa de trabajar con Adim porque ha tenido la oportunidad de compartir capacitaciones donde está aprendiendo a manejar el negocio, poco antes de trabajar con el crédito ella pensaba cerrar el negocio y en Adim ha aprendido que el negocio puede seguir compitiendo con otros establecimientos, esto le ha dado un reto en la vida.
El grupo espera siempre ser un grupo puntual, esto les ha dado mucha satisfacción y oportunidad de trabajar.
texts.en:
The members of the Divino Rostro group are Martha S. who sells food from her house, providing a running menu for lunch and dinner; Sandra Vanesa Sequeira who sells cosmetics and silver jewelry; Juana Mercedes who owns a general store in a space at her house; and Maria Auxiliadora R. who travels the country selling "rosquillas" (a local pastry). These women are natives of the city of Diriomo. They're hard-working, entrepeneurial and responsible. As an example of this, we have Juana Mercedes Bermudez who, with much effort, has learned to operate a small general store. She is a woman of 56 with a lot of experience at getting ahead and energy to spare for improving her business even more. She lives with her husband. She works to keep herself but her husband helps with sales and shares the household expenses. Juana says that she is very proud to work with Adim because it's given her the chance to attend seminars and learn to manage her business. Before starting to work with the bank, she thought about closing the business but Adim has taught her that businesses sometimes have to compete with other businesses and that it's nothing more than another of life's challenges. The group always expects its members to repay their loans on time, something that has given them a lot of satisfaction along with the chance to work.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es: `El Cliente Victoriano M. de 60 años de edad.  El es casado y residente en la ciudad de San Ignacio. Vive en domicilio propio con su familia-- el es padre de 2 hijos menores. El Sr. M. es propietario de una despensa y un gimnasio, ubicado sobre la ruta 1 de la mencionada ciudad, con una antigüedad de mas de 11 años en el ramo. El destino de los fondos de esta operación de préstamo realizada en nuestra institución fue para compra de mercaderías para la despensa debido a que en esta temporada de calor posee mucha venta de bebidas y comestibles. De esta manera incrementar sus ingresos ya que de este negocio depende el estudio y la salud de su familia.
texts.en:
Victoriano M. is 60 years old. He is married and lives in the city of San Ignacio. He lives in a home he owns with his family: he has two young children. Mr. M. owns a grocery store and a fitness centre located on Route 1 of the above-mentioned city and has been established in this industry for more than 11 years. The loan will be used to buy merchandise because in this season, due to the heat, refreshments and drinks sell very well. He will increase his income thanks to the loan because his children's studies and the health of his family depend on his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for the grocery store and materials for the fitness centre

loans.name: Pio Xii Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo solidario Pio XII, conformado por las señoras Zoila Luz, quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de Nacatamales, la otra integrante es la señora Melenciana quien vende tortillas y fritos sobre la carretera a su comunidad y refrescos naturales y jugos enlatados, y la señora Leda María quien vende nacatamales y sopas los días Lunes . Estas mujeres son originarias de la originarias de la comarca Pio XII que pertenece a la ciudad de Masaya, ubicada al sur de la nuestra ciudad capital, estas mujeres son muy trabajadoras, emprendedoras, responsables, y semi-analfabetas, pero con muchos deseos de superación. Estas señoras abonan todos los Lunes, es el mejor día para abonar, después del fin de semana que las ventas son mejores.


Doña Zoila Luz R., es una mujer de 49 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos, los cuales son mayores de edad. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de Nacatamales los fines de semana, ella vende en su casa, pero la mayoría va a venderlos al Mercado Oriental, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, con el crédito ha logrado abaratar sus costos porque los insumos de los productos los compra al por mayor, es conocida como persona muy responsable en su comunidad y además por la actividad que realiza. Trabajan con Adim porque una de las clientas le animó que se integrará en un grupo solidario, así ella conformó su grupo con dos amigas cercanas y obtuvo el préstamo. Están contentas porque sienten que la institución confía en ellas y expresan que se proponen a quedar bien en los pagos.
texts.en:
This is the group Pio XII made up of Zoila Luz who sells nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales), Melenciana who sells tortillas, fried foods, natural juices and canned juices along the highway to her community, and Leda María who sells nacatamales and soups on Mondays. These women are natives of the Pio XII region in the city of Masaya, located South of the capital city. These women are hard-workers, responsible entrepreneurs, and are semi-literate, but with many wishes to overcome. These women make payments every Monday, which is the best day to make payments after the higher weekend sales. Doña Zoila Luz Robelto is a 49-year-old woman, married, and mother of three children, all whom are older. Her business is in the production and sales of nacatamales on the weekends. She sells from her home, but the majority goes to sell at the Mercado Oriental market. She has worked in this for many years. With credit, she has been able to reduce her costs because she can buy consumables in bulk. She is known as a responsible person in her community and her business. They work with ADIM, because another client encouraged her to form an integrated group. She formed her group with two close friends and obtained a loan. They are happy because they feel that the institution trusts them, and they set out to stay on top of the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital, investment to satisfy customer demand

loans.name: Sialuga

texts.en:
Sialuga V., 42, is married with four children.  She has three years of experience in the BBQ business.  Sialuga sells to school children and village people, seven days per week. 

She has one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~ USD).  SPBD loans are Sialuga’s only access to capital because she was not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

Sialuga has a shop but she needed to make BBQ because on bad days, when her shop does not do as well, she can always sell BBQ to get extra money.   Her loan will mainly be used to buy things needed for BBQ, such as a box of chicken legs, mutton flaps, sausage, onions and soya-beans.

loans.use: Buy ingredients needed for her BBQ business.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Maria Auxiliadora, está ubicado en la comarca El coyolar que pertenece a la ciudad de Granada, está conformado por las siguientes personas:
Manuel Antonio M. C., vende granos básicos en el mercado de Granada, Juliana del Carmen F. C., vende frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya, María Lucrecia V. también vende frutas y verduras e n el mercado de Masaya y Granada de forma ambulante y Mario José O. C. vende granos básicos en el mercado de Granada. Tienen actividades similares ya que es en el mercado donde se encuentran y además se conocen en su comunidad.

Esperan trabajar bien, cumpliendo con sus cuotas, ellos llegaron a tener crédito con Adim porque una cliente les habló del tipo de crédito que recibían, donde confiaban en la honorabilidad de los clientes.

Doña María Lucrecia V., es una mujer de treinta y ocho años, con un hijo de catorce años, su fuente de trabajo es la venta de frutas y verduras ambulante  en el mercado de Masaya. Ella tiene la ayuda de su esposo en los gastos del hogar, piensa dar estudio a su hijo y mejorar su vivienda, expresa que esta contenta de trabajar con Adim porque ella nunca había tenido oportunidad de un crédito por no tener garantías y ahora ella va a agradecer mucho a la institución que confía en ella.

Estos señores abonan todos los Lunes, es el mejor día para abonar, después del fin de semana que las ventas son mejores y así garantizan la cuota del préstamo.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora group is located in the region of El Coyolar in the city of Granada. It is made up of the following people: Manuel Antonio M. C. sells basic grains in the Granada market. Juliana del Carmen F. C. sells fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market. María Lucrecia V. also sells fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market and in Granada as a street vendor. Mario José O. C. sells basic grains in the Granada market. They all have similar work, which is why they met each other in the market and know each other in the community, They hope to work hard, fulfilling their payments. They came to Adim for credit because another customer told them about her loans and their trust in the honesty of their customers. Doña María Lucrecia V. is a 30-year-old woman with a 14-year-old son. Her work is in the sales of fruits and vegetables from stalls in the Masaya market. She has the support of her husband in household expenses. She is thinking of giving her son an education and improving her home. She expresses her satisfaction for working with Adim, because she never had the opportunity to take out loans before for lack of credit. Today she is very thankful that the institution trusts her. They make payments every Monday, the best day to pay after the higher weekend sales and in this way guarantee the loan repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Roger Francisco

texts.es:
Roger P. es un joven de 28 años que labora en su negocio de pulpería en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde posee mucha experiencia en su negocio.

El motive por el cual Roger ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de mercadería como lo son productos de plásticos para comercializarlos y así mejorar su nivel de vida y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Roger P. is a young man of 28 who works at his grocery business in the "La Terminal" marketplace of the city of León. He is very experienced in his line of work. Roger has turned to Ceprodel in order to benefit from a loan to buy merchandise such as plastic goods in order to retail them and thus improve his standard of living and improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic goods

loans.name: Jesús Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jesús del Carmen O. es una dama muy esforzada el cual se dedica a su actividad de venta de productos varios teniendo su propia pulpería donde a diario la atiende con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hogar.

Actualmente ella se ha destacado por ser una excelente trabajadora y ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la mercadería y así ofrecerla en su locaildad.
texts.en:
Jesús del Carmen O. is a very hardworking woman who sells a variety of goods in her convenience store. She is open every day in order to improve her family's living conditions. She stands out as an excellent worker and has approached Ceprodel for a loan to buy merchandise and retail it in her neighbourhood.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods to retail

loans.name: Maxima Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Máxima del Carmen E. R. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica es la venta de prendas de plata y oro. Hace más de 5 años que dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de este negocio es de forma ambulante ya que dio inicio a este negocio por que ayudaba a su hermano y así con el paso del tiempo decidió que este seria su trabajo. Los propósitos de Doña Máxima son de emplear a otros en este negocio para generar más ingresos y a al mismo tiempo incrementar sus ventas. Doña Máxima solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así comprar anillos, pulseras, cadenas y aros. Los deseos de Doña Máxima son que los países que aportan ayuda para nicaragua sigan apoyando a las personas que realmente lo necesitan. La cantidad que solicita es de C$12.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Máxima del Carmen E. R. is 36 years old and single. She has been selling silver and gold jewelry for more than five years. She is a street vendor as she started out helping her brother. With time, she decided to become serious about the business. Máxima's goals are to hire employees to generate more income and at the same time increase her sales. Máxima is asking for this loan as working capital so that she can buy rings, bracelets and necklaces. Máxima hopes that those countries which help Nicaragua will continue to help those people who truly need it. She is asking for a loan of C$12.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norma Beatriz

texts.es:
Con muchas ganas de hacer empresa, Norma empezó su negocio propio hace quince años. Para entonces ella ya había trabajado en algunas empresas confeccionando especialmente trajes de novios y novias: vestidos, ternos, etc.  En su segundo lugar de trabajo se animo a proponerle a su jefe confeccionar trajes de disfraces para el alquiler o venta de ellos, su jefe aceptó y hoy en día el rubro de la empresa no es mas novios y novias sino disfraces. 

Al darse cuenta de lo rentable que podía ser el negocio de alquiler y venta de trajes de disfraces, Norma decidió independizarse luego de comprar sus maquinas industriales. Hoy con sus más de veinte años de experiencia trabajando para terceros y quince años trabajando para si misma, Norma continúa creciendo en su negocio.

Hoy en día, ofrece eventualmente sus servicios de confección a la última empresa en la que trabajó, lleva adelante su negocio propio con el alquiler y venta de disfraces y como si fuera poco, en los últimos meses esta invirtiendo en el comercio de atún al por mayor. Esto último gracias a la pequeña alianza que tiene con un sobrino suyo, dueño de una fabrica de conservas de atún. 

Una parte de sus ingresos los vuelve a invertir en sus negocios y la otra la destina para la educación de su menor hijo, el único que vive con ella de los tres que tiene.
texts.en:
Eager to do business, Norma started her own business 15 years ago. Prior to that she had already worked in various enterprises making wedding apparel: dresses and suites, et cetera. In her second place of employment she was encouraged to propose to her boss that they make costumes for sell or rent. Her boss liked the idea and today they are no longer in the business of wedding apparel, but the costume business. Realizing how profitable the sale and rental of costumes could be Norma decided to branch out on her own after purchasing their industrial sewing machines. Today, with 20 years of experience working for others and 15 years working for herself, Norma continues to expand her business. Nowadays, she provides sewing services to the previous company for which she worked, pursues her own business renting and selling costumes and, as if that were not enough, in the past few months has invested in the wholesale tuna trade. This latest is thanks to a partnership with her nephew, the owner of a tuna cannery. A portion of her earning are reinvested in her businesses and the remainder goes towards the education of the youngest of her three children, the only son still living at home.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of canned tuna

loans.name: Sandra María

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Leiton con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de pulpería en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León atendiendo a diario con el propósito de mejorar su condición económica.

Es de importancia destacar que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la mercadería y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su inversión.
texts.en:
Sandra Leiton puts a lot of daily effort into her grocery store business in LaTerminal Market in the city of León in order to improve her economic condition. It is important to emphasize that she has applied to Ceprodel for credit to purchase merchandise. Getting ahead in her business requires this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Sara Bertha,

texts.es:
Ella siempre ha sabido proveerse de ingresos extras para apoyar en los gastos de su hogar  trabajando en diversas cosas. No obstante, lo principal ha sido la venta de comida. Ofrece sus servicios como cocinera para diversos eventos o fiestas desde hace algún tiempo. Pero a lo que dedica más tiempo es a la preparación de menús para algunos obreros que trabajan cerca de su casa. Prepara el almuerzo y les lleva la comida al lugar de trabajo.

Por otro lado, en casa vende gaseosas y cervezas. Además alquila habitaciones en su casa desde hace cinco años. Con los ingresos que obtiene de sus diversos negocios ella logra mantener el hogar. A pesar de que es casada, vive prácticamente sola. Su esposo se encuentra por el momento trabajando en los Estados Unidos. Sus tres hijos ya son mayores y cada uno vive con sus familias.
texts.en:
Sara Bertha has always been able to secure income to cover her home expenses. She has cooked for parties and others events, but her main job has been preparing meals. She prepares and delivers lunches for construction workers who work near her house.

Also at home she sells soft drinks and beer and has been renting rooms for five years. She is able to cover the home expenses with the income from her work.

Even though Sara Bertha is married she lives practically alone. Her husband is working in the United States and their three children are adults living with their own families.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, beer and basic ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Buscando Al Señor Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Buscando al señor, está conformado por las siguientes personas: Verónica del Socorro F., vende carnes de pollo y res, Nidia del Socorro G. R. su actividad es similar a la otra integrante y Clara Rosa M. es la coordinadora y se dedica a la elaboración de vestuario textil.

Doña Verónica del Socorro F. vende carne en su casa, tiene más de cinco años de tener este negocio, ella ha pasado por momentos difíciles en los que estaba por cerrar el negocio, con el crédito que Adim le dio ella ha logrado comprar por cantidad y poder competir en precios con otros establecimientos.
Es casada, tiene un hijo adolescente que le ayuda en la venta y su esposo aporta con su trabajo a los gastos de la casa. Espera poder crecer en su negocio para alcanzar sus metas de mejorar su vivienda.
Expresa que en Adim le han enseñado a controlar mejor su negocio con las capacitaciones que recibe y también a mejorar de manera personal.

Se proponen trabajar con Adim en varios ciclos y están claras que para esto es solamente si son disciplinadas en sus pagos. El grupo ha obtenido cuatro créditos y ellas han salido adelante mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The supportive group Buscando Al Señor (Seeking the Lord), is made up of the following people: Verónica del Socorro F. who sells chicken and beef, Nidia del Socorro G. R.. whose business is similar, and Clara Rosa M., the group's coordinator who supports herself by handcrafting clothing. Doña Verónica del Socorro F. sells meat from her home. She has been working in this business for more than 5 years. She has gone through difficult times, including moments when she was about to close the business. With the loan that Adim gave her, she has succeeded in buying her products wholesale. As a result she is now able to compete on price with other butcher shops. She is married, and has an adolescent son who helps her sell her products. Her husband helps cover household expenses with his own work. She hopes to be able to grow her business and to reach her goal of improving her home. Veronica comments that the Adim training she has received has taught her to better control her business and to improve herself as a person, as well. The group plans to work the Adim through several cycles. All of the members are clear that they will be able to do so only if they are disciplined about their payments. The group has already received 4 loans; all of the members have imrproved their quality of life as a result.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve their businesses

loans.name: Nancy,

texts.es:
Hasta hace dos años, Nancy y su esposo manejaban una cebichería exitosa cuando aun vivían en una casa que quedaba en el centro de su localidad. No obstante, cuando decidieron comprarse un terreno para construir su casa propia, tuvieron que dejar el restaurante y mudarse a su nuevo hogar.
Una vez ahí ambos decidieron dedicarse a sus otros negocios. El esposo de Nancy es “curandero”,  ofrece servicios de medicina natural y ceremonias de curanterismo a domicilio. Mientras que Nancy Ha empezado a vender en mayor cantidad productos de belleza por catalogo, negocio que ya tiene alrededor de cuatro años.

Para más adelante, ambos piensan retomar el negocio de la cebicheria, cuando construyan su casa con material noble y tengan pista asfaltada en la calle de su casa.
texts.en:
Until two years ago, Nancy and her husband ran a successful "Cebichería", a restaurant serving the typical Latin American seafood dish "ceviche". However, when they decided to buy some land and build their own house, they had to leave the restaurant and the house they were living in the centre of town so that they could move into their new home. Once they had moved, they both decided to start up new businesses. Nancy's husband is now a "witch doctor" offering treatments using herbal medicines and carrying out home ceremonies to cure illnesses. Meanwhile, Nancy has started to sell large quantities of cosmetics by catalogue, a business that she's been running for around four years now. They both intend to start up another "Cebicheria" in the future, once they have built a sturdy enough house and their road is asphalted.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and herbal medicines.

loans.name: Leana Teresa

texts.es: Leana Teresa R. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es soletar, Doña Leana tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian y trabajan. La ubicación del negocio de Doña Leana es de manera ambulante ya que recorre las calles para ofrecer sus productos. La actividad económica de Doña Leana es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que tiene de poseer este negocio, ya que surgió por que a Doña Leana es una mujer que le gusta trabajar fuertemente y es así como decide vender estos productos. Los propósitos de Doña Leana son de invertir en suficientes productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para aplicarlo al capital de trabajo y así efectuar la compra de golosinas, pan, gaseosa y jugos. Los sueños de Doña Leana son de establecer una pulpería en su vivienda ya que la posee actualmente es de manera ambulante y es así como asiste a los diferentes colegios. La cantidad que solicita es de C$7.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Leana Teresa R. is 36 years old, single, and has two children who both study and work. The location of Leana’s business is mobile by means of walking as she covers the streets in order to offer her products for sale. Leana’s business operation is a store which she has had for more than 4 years. It came about because Leana is a woman who enjoys working hard, and therefore she decided to sell these products. Leana’s intentions are to invest in sufficient products in order to satisfy the demands of her customers.

The financing that she asks for is for working capital to purchase candy, bread, sodas, and juices. Leana dreams of establishing a store in her home as her current business is mobile which is how she attends to the different schools. The amount she is asking for is 7000 NIO.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Con una alegre sonrisa y con mucho entusiasmo la señora Ana P. se dedica a su negocio de venta de comida en el Mercado Le Terminal en la ciudad de León siendo un lugar que se destacar por tener personas muy trabajadoras como ella.

La necesidad que la señora P. atraviesa es que requiere de la compra de materia prima para la preparación de los alimentos y por esta razón ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con este crédito y así salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
With a cheerful smile and much enthusiasm, Mrs. Ana P. works at her business of food sales in La Terminal Market in the city of León, a place known for having hardworking people like her. Mrs. P. needs to buy the raw materials with which to prepare the food, and for that reason she has come to Ceprodel for a loan so that she can go forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food staples

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Juan S. con gran esfuerzo y dedicación se dedica diariamente a atender su negocio de venta de ropa el cual es comercializada en su propio tramo en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde se desempeña a diario.

La única razón por la cual él ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de la ropa para así salir adelante mejorando la situación del negocio y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan S., with great vigor and dedication, tends to his business of clothing sales. He conducts this business on a daily basis from his own stall in the market, La Terminal, in the city of León. The only reason he has come to Ceprodel is to benefit from a loan that will allow him to buy clothing in order to move forward and improve the situation of his business and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: {urchase clothing

loans.name: El Pozo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo tiene su domicilio en pueblo de Niquinohomo perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya, estas tres mujeres tienen la misma actividad de ventas de Ropas y especies, venden  en la zona norte del país en ciudades como Matagalpa, Estela y Somoto. Se conocen desde hace muchos años y tienen una gran confianza una en la otra.

Doña Yahaira es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, madre de un niño, expresa que tenía necesidad de un crédito para comprar algunos artículos que no ofrecía, se informó en el mercado con una señora que trabaja con Adim, que es de la comarca y visitó la oficina, obtuvo la información y conformó su grupo para recibir la charla.
Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad que la aprendió de su mamá, espera salir bien en su crédito junto a sus compañeras y poder darle a su hijo estudios superiores.
Ella viaja por tres días a la semana fuera de su comunidad y un día va a Managua a comprar la ropa y especies, los otros días los dedica a su familia y a ir a dejar la cuota, ella es bien organizada con su tiempo y su negocio.
Su esposo le colabora con los gastos de su trabajo en la finca, piensa que van a mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
Doña Yhajaira ha  recibido varias capacitaciones y le ha servido para llevar un mejor control en su negocio.
texts.en:
This group calls the village of Niquinohomo, part of the city of Masaya, home. These three women all work in the same business: clothing and spice sales. They sell in the northern region of the country, in cities including Matagalpa, Estela and Somoto. They have known each other for many years and have a great deal of confidence in each other. Yahaira is the coordinator of the group. She is the mother of a young son. She comments that she needs a loan in order to buy items that she does not currently offer. She learned about Adim, a local organization, from a woman at the local market who works with the organization. She visited the office, gathered the information and formed her group, so they could all meet with Adim. Yahaira has been working in this business for years. She learned the business from her mother. She hopes to get ahead with this loan together with her partners in the group; she hopes to be able to give her son a college education. She travels 3 days of the week outside of her community, and one day of the week she goes to Managua to buy the clothing and spices. The other days she spends taking caring of her family and going to Adim to make the group's loan payment. She is very organized about her time and her business. Her husband helps pay the household expenses with his work on a farm. Yahaira plans to make improvements to their home. Yahaira has received several training courses; they have helped her to better manage her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elena Marisol

texts.es: La señora Elena Marisol L. M. tiene la edad de 31 años, su estado civil es casada. La ubicación del negocio de Doña Elena es su vivienda. La actividad económica de Doña Elena es venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que necesitaba ganar los ingresos necesarios para la sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Los propósitos de Doña Elena  son de mantener su negocio activo para seguir ayudando a su familia. El financiamiento que solicita Doña Elena es para capital de trabajo y así poder comprar ropa para niños, damas y caballeros, además de cremas, perfumes, pinturas de labios y pinturas de uñas. Los sueños de Doña Elena son de poseer un negocio estable para que el día de mañana sus hijos puedan administrarlo. La cantidad que solicita es de C$10.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elena Marisol L. M. is 31 years old and she is married. The location of Doña Elena's business is her home. She makes a living by selling general merchandise. She started this business seven years ago because she needed to earn money to be able to support her family. Doña Elena's objective is to continue to keep her business active and profitable so that she can continue to help her family. The financing that she is asking for is so that she can invest capital in her business and thus be able to buy clothing for children, ladies and gentlemen, in addition to creams, perfumes, lipsticks and nail polishes to sell. Doña Elena's dream is to own a profitable and stable business so that in the future her children can run it. She is requesting a loan of $500.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Business

loans.name: Francis Lisbeth

texts.es:
La señora Francis se ha destacado por ser una persona que vende productos lácteos en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León habiendo desarrollado su negocio y obtenido varios clientes.

Actualmente ha realizado 14 créditos en Ceprodel ya que este ha sido el pilar en el desarrollo de su negocio. El motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel una vez mas es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los lácteos para ofertarlos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Francis stands out as a person who sells dairy products in the market "La Terminal" in the city of Leon, having developed her business and obtained various clients. At the moment she has completed 14 loans in Ceprodel and this has been essential to the development of her business. Her reason for coming to Ceprodel once again is to obtain credit for the purchase of raw materials with which to create dairy products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
La señora Flor S. es una dama que se dedica a su labor de venta de ropa en el Mercado La Terminal desde hace cinco años y habiendo logrado mantener su familia compuesta por sus dos pequeños hijos.

El único motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere de la compra de la mercadería para seguir ofertándola y de esta manera mejorar poco a poco su situación económica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flor S. is a woman who has worked in clothes sales at the market “LaTerminal” for five years and has managed to provide for her family composed of two small children. Her only motive for turning to Ceprodel is that she needs to buy merchandise to continue her sales and in this manner improve her economic situation little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing
